sentence.English: ”Never”is a long word.
sentence.Chinese: 不要轻易说“决不”。

sentence.English: ”Nothing in the world is difficult for one who sets his mind to it.”To cross the threshold is not diffiicult,and mastery, too,is possible provided one sets one's mind to the task and is good at learning.
sentence.Chinese: ”世上无难事,只怕有心人.”入门既不难,深造也是办得到的,只要有心,只要善于学习罢了.

sentence.English: ”They say so” is half a lie.
sentence.Chinese: 传闻多失实.

sentence.English: ”Though death befalls all men alike.it may be weightier than Mount Tai or lighter than a feather.”To die for the people is weightier than Mount Tai.
sentence.Chinese: ”人固有一死,或重于泰山,或轻于鸿毛.”为人民利益而死,就比泰山还重.

sentence.English: A good tongue is a good weapon.
sentence.Chinese: 会说话的舌头是一件精良的武器。

sentence.English: A bad beginning makes a bad ending.
sentence.Chinese: 恶始必有恶终.

sentence.English: A bad padlock invites a picklock.
sentence.Chinese: 坏锁招人撬。

sentence.English: A bad penny always comes back.
sentence.Chinese: 伪币迟早归原主。

sentence.English: A bad workman quarrels with his tools.
sentence.Chinese: 人笨怨刀钝。

sentence.English: A baited cat may grow as fierce as a lion.
sentence.Chinese: 被逼急的猫，凶得象狮子。

sentence.English: A bargain is a bargain.
sentence.Chinese: 成约不能翻悔。

sentence.English: A barly-corn is better than a diamond to a cock.
sentence.Chinese: 对于公鸡来说,麦粒胜过钻石.

sentence.English: A beard well lathered is half shaved.
sentence.Chinese: 皂沫涂得好,胡须半剃掉. /磨刀不误砍柴工.

sentence.English: A beggar can never be bankrupt.
sentence.Chinese: 乞丐永远不会破产.

sentence.English: A belly full of gluttony will never study willingly.
sentence.Chinese: 吃得过饱，懒得学习。

sentence.English: A big wind can blow through a small hole.
sentence.Chinese: 针尖大的窟窿，斗大的风。

sentence.English: A birbe will enter without knocking.
sentence.Chinese: 贿赂毋须敲门而入。

sentence.English: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
sentence.Chinese: 双鸟在林,不如一鸟在手.

sentence.English: A bird is known by its note, and a man by his talk.
sentence.Chinese: 闻声知鸣鸟，闻言见人心。

sentence.English: A bit in the morning is better than nothing all day.
sentence.Chinese: 上午有一点收获,总比全天无收获好.

sentence.English: A black plum is as sweet as a white.
sentence.Chinese: 黑梅白梅一样甜。

sentence.English: A blind man will not thank you for a looking-glass.
sentence.Chinese: 瞎子不谢赠镜人.

sentence.English: A blunt knife may be sharpened on a stone, but if a man is stupid there is no help for his stupidity.
sentence.Chinese: 刀钝石上磨，人蠢没奈何。

sentence.English: A boaster and a liar are all one.
sentence.Chinese: 吹牛撒谎一家亲。

sentence.English: A boisterous horse must have a boisterous bridle.
sentence.Chinese: 烈马要套上好辔头。

sentence.English: A bonny bride is soon buskit [=dressed].
sentence.Chinese: 美丽的新娘好打扮.

sentence.English: A book is a success when people who haven't read it pretend they have.
sentence.Chinese: 一本书如果没有看过的人也冒充看过，便是成功的。

sentence.English: A book that is shut is but a block.
sentence.Chinese: 有书不读如藏木.

sentence.English: A bow long bent at last waxeth weak.
sentence.Chinese: 良弓张久必驰.

sentence.English: A bow long bent grows weak.
sentence.Chinese: 常拉满弓无力。

sentence.English: A brave man may fall, but he cannot yield.
sentence.Chinese: 勇者可能跌倒,但不会屈服.

sentence.English: A brave man risks his life, but not his conscience.
sentence.Chinese: 勇敢的人可用生命冒险，但不以良心冒险。

sentence.English: A bride is diligent for three days.
sentence.Chinese: 新娶媳妇三日勤.

sentence.English: A broken friendship may be soldered,but will never be sound.
sentence.Chinese: 破裂了的友谊,再补也难如故.

sentence.English: A brother is a friend given by God.
sentence.Chinese: 兄弟是天赐的朋友.

sentence.English: A bully is always a coward.
sentence.Chinese: 恃强欺弱者均是懦夫。

sentence.English: A burnt child dreads the fire.
sentence.Chinese: 烧伤的孩子最怕火。

sentence.English: A cat in gloves catches no mice.
sentence.Chinese: 带手套的猫捉不到老鼠.

sentence.English: A cat may look at a king.
sentence.Chinese: 猫也可以看皇帝。/ 地位虽不同，人人应平等。

sentence.English: A cautious mind is the half of wisdom.
sentence.Chinese: 谨慎小心近于明智.

sentence.English: A cheerful wife is the joy of life.
sentence.Chinese: 有个乐天的妻子是人生的欢乐.

sentence.English: A city that parleys is half gotten.
sentence.Chinese: 求和之城已陷落一半。

sentence.English: A clean fast is better than a dirty breakfast.
sentence.Chinese: 宁为清贫，不为浊富。

sentence.English: A clean hand wants no washing.
sentence.Chinese: 手要是干净无须洗。

sentence.English: A clear conscience laughs at false accusation.
sentence.Chinese: 只要问心无愧，无端的指责可以一笑置之。

sentence.English: A close mouth catches no flies.
sentence.Chinese: 嘴巴闭得紧，苍蝇飞不进。

sentence.English: A conservative is a man who is too cowardly to fight and too fat to run.
sentence.Chinese: 保守主义者是胆小得不敢斗争，又胖得跑不动的人。

sentence.English: A covetous man is good to none, but worst to himself.
sentence.Chinese: 贪心不足的人对他人无益，对自己最有害。

sentence.English: A crabbed knot must have a crabbed wedge.
sentence.Chinese: 难解的绳结得用坚硬的楔子来对付。

sentence.English: A cracked bell can never sound well.
sentence.Chinese: 破钟无好音。

sentence.English: A creaking door hangs long.
sentence.Chinese: 旧门久用，病夫命长。

sentence.English: A critic is a man who knows the way but can't drive the car.
sentence.Chinese: 批评家是一个认得路但不会开车的人。

sentence.English: A crooked stick will have a crooked shadow.
sentence.Chinese: 身不正，影必斜。

sentence.English: A curst cow has short horns.
sentence.Chinese: 性子烈的牛角短，脾气暴的人为害有限。

sentence.English: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 玩世不恭者是知道一切事物的价格，却不知道任何东西的价值的人。

sentence.English: A danger foreseen is half avoided.
sentence.Chinese: 预见隐患犹如防患一半.

sentence.English: A day is a miniature of eternity.
sentence.Chinese: 一天是永恒的缩影.

sentence.English: A dear ship stands long in the haven.
sentence.Chinese: 贵重的船只停留在避风港里的时间长。

sentence.English: A diligent scholar, and the master's paid.
sentence.Chinese: 学生勤奋学习,就是对老师的报答.

sentence.English: A dog will not howl if you beat him with a bone.
sentence.Chinese: 肉骨头打狗，狗不叫。

sentence.English: A dream that is not interpreted is like a letter that is not opened.
sentence.Chinese: 一个未圆的梦恰似一封未拆的信。

sentence.English: A drowning man will catch at a straw.
sentence.Chinese: 快淹死的人连草也要抓。

sentence.English: A dwarf on a giant's shoulders sees the farther of the two.
sentence.Chinese: 侏儒站在巨人的肩膀上,能比巨人看得远.

sentence.English: A faint heart never won a fair lady.
sentence.Chinese: 懦夫难得美人心.

sentence.English: A fall into the pit, a gain in your wit. / A stumble may prevent a fall.
sentence.Chinese: 小踬防大跌. / 小惩大戒. / 吃一堑,长一智.

sentence.English: A fool and his money are soon parted.
sentence.Chinese: 傻瓜花钱快.

sentence.English: A fool knows more in his own house than a wise man in another.
sentence.Chinese: 傻子在自己家里比聪明人在别人家里知道得多。

sentence.English: A fool may ask more questions in an hour than a wise man can answer in seven years.
sentence.Chinese: 傻子一小时提出的问题，聪明人七年也回答不了。

sentence.English: A fool may give a wise man counsel.
sentence.Chinese: 愚人也能为智者出主意. / 愚者千虑,必有一得.

sentence.English: A forced kindness deserves no thanks.
sentence.Chinese: 虚情假意不值得感谢.

sentence.English: A foreign language is a weapon in the struggle of life.
sentence.Chinese: 外语是人生斗争的一种武器.

sentence.English: A foul morn may turn to a fair day.
sentence.Chinese: 阴霾的早晨能变成晴朗的白天.

sentence.English: A friend in need is a friend indeed.
sentence.Chinese: 患难见真情.

sentence.English: A friend is easier lost than found.
sentence.Chinese: 朋友易失不易得.

sentence.English: A friend is known in necessity.
sentence.Chinese: 患难见友情.

sentence.English: A friend to all is a friend to none.
sentence.Chinese: 对一切人都是朋友,对哪一个也不是朋友.

sentence.English: A friend's frown is better than a fool's smile.
sentence.Chinese: 朋友对你皱眉,胜过傻瓜对你微笑.

sentence.English: A friennd in word is never friend of mine.
sentence.Chinese: 口头上的朋友决不是朋友.

sentence.English: A full belly neither fights nor flies well.
sentence.Chinese: 肚子太饱，不能打仗也不能逃跑。

sentence.English: A ganging fit is aye getting./ A going foot is always getting.
sentence.Chinese: 腿勤生财

sentence.English: A generation without a cause in its youth has no legacy in its old age.
sentence.Chinese: 一代人如年轻时没有事业,老了就不会有遗产可以传下去.

sentence.English: A glass at supper is not amiss.
sentence.Chinese: 晚酌一杯也无妨。

sentence.English: A good anvil does not fear the hammer.
sentence.Chinese: 好砧不怕铁锤砸.

sentence.English: A good archer is not known by his arrows but his aim.
sentence.Chinese: 神箭手因其射中靶子而非因其箭而闻名。

sentence.English: A good beginning is half the battle.
sentence.Chinese: 好的开端等于成功了一半.

sentence.English: A good beginning makes a good ending.
sentence.Chinese: 欲善其终,先善其始.

sentence.English: A good book is the best of friends, the same today and for ever.
sentence.Chinese: 好书如好友,友情永不渝.

sentence.English: A good conscience is a continual feast.
sentence.Chinese: 问心无愧天天乐。

sentence.English: A good deed is never lost.
sentence.Chinese: 好心一定有好报。

sentence.English: A good face is a letter of recommendation.
sentence.Chinese: 漂亮的面孔就是推荐书。

sentence.English: A good face needs no band, and a pretty wench no land.
sentence.Chinese: 英俊的小伙子无需吹鼓手,漂亮的村姑无需田地.

sentence.English: A good friend is my nearest relation.
sentence.Chinese: 好友即至亲.

sentence.English: A good horse cannot be of a bad colour.
sentence.Chinese: 好马无劣色

sentence.English: A good husband makes a good wife. A good Jack makes a good Jill.
sentence.Chinese: 丈夫好,妻子也好.

sentence.English: A good man can no more harm than a sheep.
sentence.Chinese: 好人象绵羊，为恶不在行。

sentence.English: A good man terminates a friendship with out rancour.
sentence.Chinese: 君子绝交不记仇.

sentence.English: A good marksman may miss.
sentence.Chinese: 好射手也有失手的时候.

sentence.English: A good marriage is like an incredible retirement fund. You put everything you have into it during your productive life, and over the years it turns from silver to gold to platinum.
sentence.Chinese: 美满婚姻就象一笔丰厚得难以置信的退休金.盛年时你将一切所得放入其中,经过积年累月,它便会从白银变成黄金,再从黄金变成白金.

sentence.English: A good name is better than riches.
sentence.Chinese: 美名胜过金钱。

sentence.English: A good name is sooner lost than won.
sentence.Chinese: 美名难得而易失.

sentence.English: A good neighbour, a good morrow.
sentence.Chinese: 邻居好,日子好.

sentence.English: A good newspaper, I suppose,is a nation talking to itself.
sentence.Chinese: 我认为，一份好的报纸是一个民族在同自己谈话。

sentence.English: A good reputation sits still;a bad one runs about.
sentence.Chinese: 好名不出门，恶名传四方。

sentence.English: A good shift may serve long,but it will not serve ever.
sentence.Chinese: 好的推诿之词或许长期有用，但不会永远有用。

sentence.English: A good surgeon must have an eagle's eye,a lion's heart,and a lady's hand.
sentence.Chinese: 一个好外科医生要有鹰的眼、狮子的胆和女性的手。

sentence.English: A good tale ill told is marred in the telling.
sentence.Chinese: 好故事还要讲得好。

sentence.English: A good tale is none the worse for being told twice.
sentence.Chinese: 好戏不厌两回看。/好故事百听不厌。

sentence.English: A good thing is soon snatched up.
sentence.Chinese: 好货卖得快。

sentence.English: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit,neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
sentence.Chinese: 好树不会结坏果子，坏树不会结好果子。

sentence.English: A good tree is a good shelter.
sentence.Chinese: 枝叶茂盛的大树是躲避风雨的好去处. / 大树底下好乘凉.

sentence.English: A good wife and health is a man's best wealth.
sentence.Chinese: 男子的最大财富,在于妻子贤惠,自己健康.

sentence.English: A gossip's mouth is the devil's mail-bag.
sentence.Chinese: 饶舌者的嘴巴是魔鬼的邮袋。

sentence.English: A great city, a great solitude.
sentence.Chinese: 城市越大越寂寞。

sentence.English: A great dowry is a bed full of brambles.
sentence.Chinese: 满屋的嫁妆犹如满床荆棘.

sentence.English: A great fortune is a great slavery.
sentence.Chinese: 财多多受累.

sentence.English: A great man is always willing to be little.
sentence.Chinese: 伟大的人物总是愿意当小人物的.

sentence.English: A great poem is a fountain forever overflowing with the waters of wisdom and delight.
sentence.Chinese: 伟大的诗篇犹如永远流出智慧和欢欣之水的喷泉。

sentence.English: A great ship asks deep waters.
sentence.Chinese: 大船要在深 水行./ 深水浮大船.

sentence.English: A great vessel will be long in completion.
sentence.Chinese: 大器晚成.

sentence.English: A green wound is soon healed.
sentence.Chinese: 新伤口愈合快。

sentence.English: A growing youth has a wolf in his belly.
sentence.Chinese: 年轻小伙子，吃饭象饿狼。

sentence.English: A guilty conscience needs no accuser.
sentence.Chinese: 自己问心有愧,无需别人责备.

sentence.English: A handful of good life is better than a bushel of learning.
sentence.Chinese: 为善一时，赛过满腹经纶。

sentence.English: A handsaw is a good thing,but not to shave with.
sentence.Chinese: 手锯再好也不能用来剃胡须。

sentence.English: A hedge between keeps friendship green.
sentence.Chinese: 交友有度,友谊常青. / 君子之交淡如水.

sentence.English: A hero is nothing but a product of his time.
sentence.Chinese: 时势造英雄.

sentence.English: A holiday gives one a chance to look backward and forward,to reset oneself by an inner compass.
sentence.Chinese: 假期使你有机会回顾与前瞻，用心中的罗盘重新定好自已的方位。

sentence.English: A honey tongue,a heart of gall.
sentence.Chinese: 口如蜜甜者心似胆苦。

sentence.English: A horse stumbles that has four legs.
sentence.Chinese: 人有失足，马有失蹄。

sentence.English: A hungry man is an angry man.
sentence.Chinese: 饿汉易怒。

sentence.English: A king without learning is but a crowned ass.
sentence.Chinese: 无知的国王不过是一头戴着王冠的驴。

sentence.English: A kiss can bring either unrest or peace to one's heart.
sentence.Chinese: 一个吻既可给人的心灵带来不安,也可以使它得到安宁.

sentence.English: A knowing man is hot in arguing for truth's sake; an ignorant man for opinion's sake.
sentence.Chinese: 有知识的人激烈争论是为了辩明真理;无知的人激烈争论是为了固执己见.

sentence.English: A large part of virtue consists in good habits.
sentence.Chinese: 美德大多只是良好的习惯。

sentence.English: A lawyer never goes to law himself.
sentence.Chinese: 律师自己决不会打官司。

sentence.English: A lazy youth, a lousy age.
sentence.Chinese: 少时懒惰老来苦.

sentence.English: A lean dog shames his master.
sentence.Chinese: 狗瘦主人羞。

sentence.English: A learned man is not learned in everything.
sentence.Chinese: 有学问的人并非什么都懂.

sentence.English: A leopard and a goat can never live in the same flock.
sentence.Chinese: 豹子和山羊不同群。

sentence.English: A liar is not believed when he tells the truth.
sentence.Chinese: 惯说谎者说真话时也没人相信了。

sentence.English: A lie begets a lie.
sentence.Chinese: 谎言生谎言。

sentence.English: A light purse makes a heavy heart.
sentence.Chinese: 钱袋越空，心情越重。

sentence.English: A like every day makes a clout on Sunday./ If you always wear your best clothes they will soon wear out.
sentence.Chinese: 平时穿衣无好歹,假日出门无新衣.

sentence.English: A lion at home, a mouse abroad.
sentence.Chinese: 在家象狮子，出外成老鼠。

sentence.English: A little body doth often harbour a great soul.
sentence.Chinese: 伟大的心灵常寓于矮小的身躯之中.

sentence.English: A little credulity helps one on through life very smoothly.
sentence.Chinese: 如果你有点轻信别人,你的生活就会更如意.

sentence.English: A little help is worth a deal of pity.
sentence.Chinese: 一点帮助胜于一车同情.

sentence.English: A little kiss while you are sleeping, to give you sweeter dreams.
sentence.Chinese: 睡时一个吻,美梦到天明.

sentence.English: A little labour, much health.
sentence.Chinese: 适量的劳动有益于健康。

sentence.English: A little learning is a dangerous thing,but a lot of ignorance is just as bad.
sentence.Chinese: 知识浅薄是危险的,而无知是同样糟糕.

sentence.English: A little learning is a dangerous thing.
sentence.Chinese: 浅学误人.

sentence.English: A little neglect may breed great mischief.
sentence.Chinese: 细小的疏忽会酿成大祸。

sentence.English: A little of everything, and nothing at all.
sentence.Chinese: 什么都来一点,什么也得不到.

sentence.English: A little pot is soon hot.
sentence.Chinese: 壶小易沸,量小易怒.

sentence.English: A long dispute means that both parties are wrong.
sentence.Chinese: 持久的争论意味着双方都是错的。

sentence.English: A love that could die was not real love.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的爱情不会死亡.

sentence.English: A maiden with many wooers often chooses the worst.
sentence.Chinese: 求婚者多的少女往往选中最差的郎君.

sentence.English: A man among children will be long a child, a child among men will be soon a man.
sentence.Chinese: 成年人和儿童在一起童心常驻,儿童和成年人在一起容易老成.

sentence.English: A man at sixteen will prove a child at sixty.
sentence.Chinese: 十六岁不成人,六十岁不成器.

sentence.English: A man becomes learned by asking questions.
sentence.Chinese: 要长学问,就得多问.

sentence.English: A man can die but once.
sentence.Chinese: 人无二死.

sentence.English: A man can do no more than he can.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事应量力而行.

sentence.English: A man can fail many times, but he isn't a failure until he begins to blame somebody else.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人可以失败许多次,但是只要他没有责怪旁人,他还不是一个失败者.

sentence.English: A man can succeed at almost anything for which he has unlimited enthusiasm.
sentence.Chinese: 只要有无限的热情,一个人几乎可以在任何事情上取得成功.

sentence.English: A man can't ride your back unless it's bent.
sentence.Chinese: 你的腰不弯，别人就不能骑在你背上。

sentence.English: A man cannot spin and reel at the same time.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人不能同时又纺又绕. /一心不能二用.

sentence.English: A man is known by the company he keeps.
sentence.Chinese: 从其交友知其为人.

sentence.English: A man is not old as long as he is seeking something. A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.
sentence.Chinese: 只要一个人还有所追求,他就没有老.直到后悔取代了梦想,一个人才算老.

sentence.English: A man is only as good as what he loves.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人要用他所爱的东西有多好来衡量.

sentence.English: A man is weal or woe as he thinks himself so.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人命运好坏,全看自己如何想.

sentence.English: A man knows his companion in a long journey and a little inn.
sentence.Chinese: 长途同行,逆旅共处,伴侣品格,洞察如烛.

sentence.English: A man may build himself a throne of bayonets, but he canot sit upon it.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人可以用刺刀为自己建造一个宝座，但却无法坐在上面。

sentence.English: A man may have a just esteem of himself without being proud.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人虽对自己有恰当的尊敬，也无需骄傲。

sentence.English: A man may woo where he will, but he will wed where his hap is.
sentence.Chinese: 向谁求爱由自己,与谁结婚靠机遇.

sentence.English: A man must not be judged by his appearance,just as the ocean cannot be measured in gallons.
sentence.Chinese: 凡人不可貌相,海水不可斗量.

sentence.English: A man never discloses his own character so clearly as when he describes another's.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人在描述别人的性格时最能暴露出自己的性格。

sentence.English: A man of great talents will surely be given important assignments.
sentence.Chinese: 大才必有大用.

sentence.English: A man of moral integrity does not fear any slanderous attack.
sentence.Chinese: 人正不怕影子斜。

sentence.English: A man of words and not of deeds is like a garden full of weeds.
sentence.Chinese: 光说不做的人,就象长满杂草的院子.

sentence.English: A man usually falls in love with the woman who asks the kind of questions he is able to answer.
sentence.Chinese: 男人往往会爱上向他提出问题,而他又能回答得出的女人.

sentence.English: A man who fears suffering is already suffering from what he fears.
sentence.Chinese: 害怕痛苦的人已经在承受他所害怕的痛苦了。

sentence.English: A man who finds no satisfaction in himself, seeks for it in vain elsewhere.
sentence.Chinese: 在自己身上找不到满足的人，在别的地方也找不到满足。

sentence.English: A man who knows two languages is worth two men.
sentence.Chinese: 懂得两种语言的人抵得上两个人.

sentence.English: A man who neglects his studies in youth will regret it in later years.
sentence.Chinese: 在青年时代轻率地对待学习的人,将来会感到痛苦和难过的.

sentence.English: A man without a smiling face must not open a shop.
sentence.Chinese: 没有笑脸的人不能开店。

sentence.English: A man without knowledge is like a house without a foundation.
sentence.Chinese: 人没有知识犹如房子没有地基.

sentence.English: A man's character is like a fence--it cannot be strengthened by whitewashing.
sentence.Chinese: 人的名誉犹如一道篱笆——粉刷并不能使之坚固。

sentence.English: A man's home is his castle.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人的家就是他的城堡.

sentence.English: A man's life is limited, but there is no limit to serving the people. I will dedicate my limited life to the limitless job of serving the people.
sentence.Chinese: 人的生命是有限的,可是,为人民服务是无限的,我要把有限的生命,投入到无限的为人民服务之中去......

sentence.English: A man's own good-breeding is his best security against other people's ill manners.
sentence.Chinese: 自身教养好是抵制他人无礼的最好保证.

sentence.English: A man's vanity is actually in proportion to ignorance.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人的虚荣心实际上和他的愚蠢程度成正比。

sentence.English: A man,a horse,and a dog are never weary of each others company.
sentence.Chinese: 人、马、狗可以永远相伴不厌倦。

sentence.English: A mill cannot grind with the water that is past.
sentence.Chinese: 磨轮不能用已经流走的水来转动。

sentence.English: A mind all logic is like a knife all blade. It makes the hand bleed that uses it.
sentence.Chinese: 只有逻辑的头脑象只有刃的刀，它会割破使用它的手。

sentence.English: A mirror can only help you see the stain on your face; and to wipe it off, you have to rely on yourself.
sentence.Chinese: 镜子只能帮助你找到脸上的污点，要擦掉污点还要靠自己。

sentence.English: A miss is as good as a mile.
sentence.Chinese: 差之毫厘,失之千里.

sentence.English: A modest man frequently ponders over his mistakes; a conceited man only gossips about other's errors.
sentence.Chinese: 谦虚者常思己过，骄傲者只论人非。

sentence.English: A money lender serves you in the present tense, lends you in the conditional mood, keeps you in the subjuctive,and ruins you in the future.
sentence.Chinese: 放债的人为你服务时用现在时态,借钱给你时用条件语气,使你常处于虚拟语气之中,并于将来时态中毁掉你.

sentence.English: A mother is not a person to lean on but a person to make leaning unnecessary.
sentence.Chinese: 母亲不是籍以依赖的人，而是使依赖成为不必要的人。

sentence.English: A nation reveals itself not only by the men it produces but also by the men it honors. the men it remembers.
sentence.Chinese: 一个民族不仅通过它所造就的人，也通过它给以荣誉的人和它所铭记的人展示 自己。

sentence.English: A near friend is better than a far-dwelling kinsman.
sentence.Chinese: 远亲不如近友.

sentence.English: A nice wife and a back door, do often make a rich man poor.
sentence.Chinese: 妻子气派仆人偷,百万富翁也变穷.

sentence.English: A number of small streams converge into a vast ocean.
sentence.Chinese: 涓涓之流,汇成大海.

sentence.English: A painter leaves his emotions behind him for his posterity to share.
sentence.Chinese: 画家把自己的感情留下来，与后人共享。

sentence.English: A paradise that you cannot leave is hell.
sentence.Chinese: 不能离开的天堂等于是地狱。

sentence.English: A past mistake of one serves as a good lesson to all.
sentence.Chinese: 一人之失，百人之师。

sentence.English: A penny saved is a penny gained.
sentence.Chinese: 省一文等于挣一文.

sentence.English: A penny soul never came to twopence.
sentence.Chinese: 志小者成不了大事./心胸狭窄,一事无成.

sentence.English: A person who is imperious and tries to gloss over his fault is bound to suffer in the end.
sentence.Chinese: 专横跋扈，文过饰非的人到头来总是要吃亏的。

sentence.English: A pessimist? That's a person who has been intimately acquainted with an optimist.
sentence.Chinese: 悲观主义者吗?那是曾和乐观主义者过从甚密的人。

sentence.English: A place for everything, and everything in its place.
sentence.Chinese: 物应各有其所，亦应各在其所。

sentence.English: A plant may produce new flowers; man is young but once./ Flowers will bloom again in due time,but man can never regain his youth.
sentence.Chinese: 花有重开日,人无再少年.

sentence.English: A poet is , before anything else, a person who is passionately in love with language.
sentence.Chinese: 一个诗人，首先应当是一个非常热爱语言的人。

sentence.English: A poet is a man who puts up a ladder to a star and climbs it while playing a violin.
sentence.Chinese: 诗人是这样的人，他把梯子架到星星上，一边爬梯子一边拉提琴。

sentence.English: A poet is born,not made.
sentence.Chinese: 诗人靠天成。

sentence.English: A poor spirit is poorer than a poor purse.
sentence.Chinese: 精神空虚比钱包空虚更可怜.

sentence.English: A proud man hath many crosses.
sentence.Chinese: 骄傲者挫折多。

sentence.English: A quiet conscience sleeps in thunder.
sentence.Chinese: 心里坦然，打雷也照样入睡。

sentence.English: A real friend never gets in your way, unless you happen to be on the way down.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的朋友绝不会挡住你的去路,除非在你走下坡路时.

sentence.English: A rolling eye, a roving heart.
sentence.Chinese: 眼活情不专.

sentence.English: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
sentence.Chinese: 滚动的石头上不长青苔. /见异思迁,终无所获.

sentence.English: A selfless man is upright and high-minded.
sentence.Chinese: 人不自私，顶天立地。

sentence.English: A ship in harbour is safe-but that is not what ships are for.
sentence.Chinese: 船停泊在港中固然安全，可是这并非造船的目的。

sentence.English: A shy cat makes a proud mouse.
sentence.Chinese: 猫儿胆小耗子闹。

sentence.English: A single spark can start a prairie fire.
sentence.Chinese: 星星之火,可以燎原

sentence.English: A small leak will sink a great ship.
sentence.Chinese: 小漏能沉大船.

sentence.English: A smile is a curve that sets a lot of things straight.
sentence.Chinese: 微笑是一条曲线,它能使许多东西变直.

sentence.English: A smooth sea never made a skillful mariner.
sentence.Chinese: 平静的大海决不能造就出熟练的水手.

sentence.English: A snob has to spend so much time being a snob that he has little time left to meddle with you.
sentence.Chinese: 势利的人要在势利上花许多时间，不会剩许多时间来管你的闲事。

sentence.English: A snow year,a rich year.
sentence.Chinese: 瑞雪兆丰年。

sentence.English: A sober man may become a drunkard through being a coward. A brave man may be come a coward through being a drunkard.
sentence.Chinese: 清醒的人胆小时会变成醉汉。勇敢的人喝醉时会变得懦弱。

sentence.English: A still tongue makes a wise head.
sentence.Chinese: 沉默者有智慧。

sentence.English: A stitch in time saves nine.
sentence.Chinese: 不洞不补,大洞尺五. /及时处理,事半功倍.

sentence.English: A straw shows which way the wind blows.
sentence.Chinese: 草动知风向。 / 见微知著。

sentence.English: A strong climbing-rope,made by twisting together confidence,determination and perseverance, can help you scale the summits of knowledge and science.
sentence.Chinese: 信心, 决心和恒心拧成一根坚实的攀绳,能助你达到知识和科学的高峰.

sentence.English: A stupid person always tries to justify himself for his mistakes; but a wise man tries his best to correct his errors.
sentence.Chinese: 愚蠢的人总是为自己的错误辩护，聪明的人则力求改正自己的错误。

sentence.English: A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops.
sentence.Chinese: 教师的影响是永恒的；无法估计他的影响会有多深远。

sentence.English: A thing of beauty is a joy for ever.
sentence.Chinese: 美的事物永远令人喜悦.

sentence.English: A thing you don't want is dear at any price.
sentence.Chinese: 不需要的东西,无论买价多少都贵.

sentence.English: A thousand-li journey is started by taking the first step.
sentence.Chinese: 千里之行,始于足下.

sentence.English: A trouble shared is a trouble halved.
sentence.Chinese: 两人分担,困难减半.

sentence.English: A trout in the pot is better than a salmon in the sea.
sentence.Chinese: 锅里一条小鱼胜过海里一条大鱼.

sentence.English: A true jest is no jest.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的笑语决非笑话。

sentence.English: A watched pot never boils.
sentence.Chinese: 心急锅不开.

sentence.English: A waterfront pavilion gets the moonlight first;the flowers and trees on the sunny side meet spring earlier.
sentence.Chinese: 近水楼台先得月，向阳花木早逢春。

sentence.English: A wedding anniversary is the celebration of love, trust, partnership, tolerance and tenacity. The order varies for any given year.
sentence.Chinese: 结婚纪念日所庆祝的是恩爱,信赖,合作,容忍和坚毅.其顺序则年年不同.

sentence.English: A well-Prepared mind hopes in adversity and fears in prosperity.
sentence.Chinese: 遇事有准备的人逢逆境不失望，处顺境不大意。

sentence.English: A wilful man will have his way.
sentence.Chinese: 顽强者定会成功.

sentence.English: A wise man cares not for what he cannot have.
sentence.Chinese: 智者不为自己得不到的东西而烦恼.

sentence.English: A wise man changes his mind, a fool never will.
sentence.Chinese: 智者通权达变，愚者坚持己见。

sentence.English: A wise man is never less alone than when alone.
sentence.Chinese: 智者独处不寂寞.

sentence.English: A wise man never loses anything if he has himself.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明的人只要能掌握自己,便什么也不会失去.

sentence.English: A woman never loafs; she shops, entertains, and visits.
sentence.Chinese: 女人从来不闲逛;购物,待客,串门总有事可忙.

sentence.English: A wonder lasts but nine days.
sentence.Chinese: 奇闻只存在九天。

sentence.English: A word is enough to the wise.
sentence.Chinese: 智者不用多告诫.

sentence.English: A word once spoken cannot be taken back even by a team of four horses.
sentence.Chinese: 一言既出，驷马难追。

sentence.English: A work ill done must be twice done.
sentence.Chinese: 工作没做好,就应当重新做.

sentence.English: A young man should not marry yet, an old man not at all.
sentence.Chinese: 男子如年轻,还不该结婚.男子如年老,根本不该结婚.

sentence.English: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
sentence.Chinese: 越是不见越想念.

sentence.English: Accidents will happen in the best regulated families.
sentence.Chinese: 家规再严，事端难免。

sentence.English: Achievement is founded on diligence and wasted upon recklessness.
sentence.Chinese: 业精于勤,荒于嬉.

sentence.English: Achievement provides the only real pleasure in life.
sentence.Chinese: 有所成就乃是人生唯一的真正乐趣.

sentence.English: Action is the proper fruit of knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 行动是知识的佳果.

sentence.English: Actions speak louder than words.
sentence.Chinese: 行动胜于言辞.

sentence.English: Actual practice builds up genuine knowledge; a strict master brings up accomplished disciples. / From actual practice comes sound knowledge; from a strict master, a brilliant disciple.
sentence.Chinese: 实践出真知, 严师出高徒.

sentence.English: Adopt the pace of nature: Her secret is patience.
sentence.Chinese: 采用大自然的步伐：她的秘密在于耐心。

sentence.English: Adventure is just a romantic name for trouble.
sentence.Chinese: 冒险是自找麻烦的浪漫说法。

sentence.English: Adversity is a good discipline.
sentence.Chinese: 逆境磨练人.

sentence.English: Adversity is a great schoolmaster.
sentence.Chinese: 逆境是好老师.

sentence.English: Adversity makes a man wise,not rich.
sentence.Chinese: 逆境不能使人致富,却能使人聪明.

sentence.English: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
sentence.Chinese: 我们请别人给以忠告时，说明我们已经知道解决问题的答案却希望并不知道它 。

sentence.English: Advice should always be consumed to between two thick slices of doubt.
sentence.Chinese: 对任何劝告都该三思而后行。

sentence.English: Affairs that are done by due degress are soon ended.
sentence.Chinese: 按部就班,只快不慢.

sentence.English: After a certain number of years.our faces become our biographies.
sentence.Chinese: 经过若干年之后,我们的面貌就成了我们的传记.

sentence.English: After a storm comes a calm.
sentence.Chinese: 雨过天晴,苦尽甘来.

sentence.English: After dinner comes the reckoning.
sentence.Chinese: 要吃饭就得付帐. /要享乐就得付代价.

sentence.English: After dinner sit awhile; after supper walk a mile.
sentence.Chinese: 午餐后稍坐片刻，晚餐后步行一里。

sentence.English: After wind comes rain.
sentence.Chinese: 风是雨的头。

sentence.English: Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand.
sentence.Chinese: 无人能抵御嘲笑的进攻。

sentence.English: Age is a matter of feeling, not of years.
sentence.Chinese: 年纪只是感觉如何的问题,而不是年岁的问题.

sentence.English: Agood horse should be seldom spurred.
sentence.Chinese: 好马无需用鞭抽。

sentence.English: All are not friends that speak us fait.
sentence.Chinese: 当面说好话的并不都是朋友.

sentence.English: All are not hunters that blow the horn.
sentence.Chinese: 吹号角的未必都是猎人。

sentence.English: All are not saints that go to church.
sentence.Chinese: 上教堂的未必都是圣人。

sentence.English: All are not thieves that dogs bark at.
sentence.Chinese: 狗咬的不见得都是小偷。

sentence.English: All bread is not baked in one oven.
sentence.Chinese: 面包不都是一个炉灶里烤出来的。/ 不应强求一律。

sentence.English: All fellows at football./ On the playing-field, all are on equality.
sentence.Chinese: 运动场上人人平等。

sentence.English: All for one, one for all.
sentence.Chinese: 人人为我,我为人人.

sentence.English: All good things are cheap, all bad things are very dear.
sentence.Chinese: 一切好的东西都是便宜的,所有坏的东西都是非常贵的.

sentence.English: All great truths are obvious truths. But not all obvious truths are great truths.
sentence.Chinese: 伟大的真理都是明摆着的事实.但不见得所有明摆着的事实都是伟大的真理.

sentence.English: All his geese are swans.
sentence.Chinese: 自己的鹅都是天鹅。

sentence.English: All human wisdom is summed up in two words-wait and hope.
sentence.Chinese: 人类所有的智慧可以归结为两个----等待和希望.

sentence.English: All is fair in love and war.
sentence.Chinese: 情场战场，不择手段。

sentence.English: All is not at hand that helps.
sentence.Chinese: 世间没有唾手可得之事.

sentence.English: All is not gain that is got into the purse.
sentence.Chinese: 装进钱包里的不一定都是收益.

sentence.English: All is well with him who is beloved of his neighbours.
sentence.Chinese: 邻里和气,万事如意.

sentence.English: All men can't be first.
sentence.Chinese: 不可能人人得冠军。

sentence.English: All men have a reason,but not all men can give a reason.
sentence.Chinese: 所有的人都有理由，但并非所有的人都能讲出理由。

sentence.English: All people in the revolutionary ranks must care for each other,must love and help each other.
sentence.Chinese: 一切革命队伍的人都要互相关心,互相爱护,互相帮助.

sentence.English: All readers can be divided into two classes:those who read to remember and those who read to forget.
sentence.Chinese: 所有的读者都可分为两类:有人为了记住而读,有人为了忘却而读.

sentence.English: All rivers run into the sea.
sentence.Chinese: 条条江河归大海.

sentence.English: All roads lead to Rome.
sentence.Chinese: 条条大路通罗马.

sentence.English: All that glitters is not gold.
sentence.Chinese: 闪烁者不尽是金。

sentence.English: All that you do, do with your might; things done by halves are never done right.
sentence.Chinese: 做一切事都应尽力而为,半途而废永远不行.

sentence.English: All the mistakes I ever made in my life were when I wanted to say ”NO”,and said ”Yes”.
sentence.Chinese: 我一生中所犯的错误都是在本想说“不”的时候说了“是”。

sentence.English: All the weapons of war will not arm fear.
sentence.Chinese: 任何武器都武装不了恐惧。

sentence.English: All theory, dear friend,is grey; but the precious tree of life is green.
sentence.Chinese: 亲爱的朋友,所有的理论都是灰色的;而宝贵的生活之树却是绿色的.

sentence.English: All things are attained by diligence and toil.
sentence.Chinese: 一切都是通过勤劳获得的.

sentence.English: All things are difficult before they are easy.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事皆先难后易.

sentence.English: All things in their being are good for something.
sentence.Chinese: 天生我才必有用.

sentence.English: All true love is founded on esteem.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的爱基于尊重.

sentence.English: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
sentence.Chinese: 只工作，不玩耍，聪明小伙也变傻。

sentence.English: Alms never make poor.
sentence.Chinese: 施舍穷不了人.

sentence.English: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any thing.
sentence.Chinese: 永远记住:你争取成功的决心才是头等重要的.

sentence.English: Ambition is the germ from which all growth of nobleness proceeds.
sentence.Chinese: 抱负是一切高尚操行的萌芽.

sentence.English: Among the blind the one-eye man is king.
sentence.Chinese: 瞎子国里，独眼称王。

sentence.English: An Englishman is never happy but when he is miserable, a Scotchman never at home but when he is abroad, and an Irishman never at peace but when he is fighting.
sentence.Chinese: 英格兰人只有在受苦时才幸福，苏格兰人只有在他乡时才舒适，爱尔兰人只有 在打架时才安宁。

sentence.English: An ague in the spring is physic for a king.
sentence.Chinese: 春天一场病，一年不服药。

sentence.English: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
sentence.Chinese: 每天一只苹果，无需医生进门。

sentence.English: An artist lives everywhere.
sentence.Chinese: 一技在身，走遍天下。

sentence.English: An educated man is not necessarily a learned man or a university man,but a man with certain subtle spiritual qualities which make him calm in adversity, happy when alone, just in his dealings,rational and sane in all the affairs of life
sentence.Chinese: 有教养的人不一定有学问，也不一定上过大学，而是具有一种微妙的气质的人，他处逆境能镇定，虽孤独也快乐，待人公正，处世稳健明理。

sentence.English: An empty sack cannot stand upright.
sentence.Chinese: 空袋难站立. /有理走遍天下,无理寸步难行.

sentence.English: An energetic middle life is, I think, the only safe precursor of a vitally happy old age.
sentence.Chinese: 我认为,精力旺盛的中年生活是生气勃勃的幸福晚年的唯一可靠预兆.

sentence.English: An eye for an eye,a tooth for (a) tooth.
sentence.Chinese: 以眼还眼，以牙还牙。

sentence.English: An honest man doesn't do anything underhand.
sentence.Chinese: 明人不做暗事。

sentence.English: An honest man's word is as good as his bond.
sentence.Chinese: 诚实人说的话等于契约。

sentence.English: An hour in the morning is worth two in the evening.
sentence.Chinese: 一日之计在于晨

sentence.English: An idea isn't responsible for the people who believe in it.
sentence.Chinese: 一个思想对信仰它的人并不负有责任。

sentence.English: An ignorant man is like a piece of barren land.
sentence.Chinese: 不学习的人,象不长谷物的荒地.

sentence.English: An irritable man is like a hedgehog rolled up the wrong way, tormenting himself with his own prickles.
sentence.Chinese: 易怒的人象一只反过来蜷缩的刺猬，用自己的刺折磨自己。

sentence.English: An old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop a thousand li-an old hero still cherishes high aspirations.
sentence.Chinese: 老骥伏枥,志在千里. 烈士暮年,壮心不已.

sentence.English: An onion will not produce a rose.
sentence.Chinese: 洋葱里长不出玫瑰。/ 乌鸦里飞不出金凤凰。

sentence.English: An open enemy is better than a hollow friend.
sentence.Chinese: 宁有公开的敌人,不要虚伪朋友.

sentence.English: An optimist sees opportunity in every calamity; a pessimist sees a calamity in every opportunity.
sentence.Chinese: 乐观者在每一场灾难中都看到机遇,悲观者在每个机遇中都看到灾难.

sentence.English: An optimist sees the rose; a pessimist the thorn.
sentence.Chinese: 乐观的人看到玫瑰,悲观的人只看到它的刺.

sentence.English: An ounce of discretion is worth a pound of wit.
sentence.Chinese: 一盎司慎重等于一磅机智。

sentence.English: An ounce of mother-wit is worth a pound of clergy(=learning).
sentence.Chinese: 一分天资抵得上十分学问.

sentence.English: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
sentence.Chinese: 一分预防胜过十分治疗。

sentence.English: An ounce of prudence is worth a pound of gold.
sentence.Chinese: 一盎司谨慎抵得上一磅黄金。

sentence.English: An unambitious man is easily carried away by victory; a short-sighted man would have an exaggerated opinion of his abilities after being praised a little.
sentence.Chinese: 胸无大志的人容易被胜利冲昏头脑；鼠目寸光的人稍受表扬就不知天高地厚。

sentence.English: An undeserved success is like a medal that is found lying in the street.
sentence.Chinese: 有名无实的功绩, 就象在街上拾到的奖章.

sentence.English: And though the soul sail leagues and leagues beyond-- still leagues beyond those leagues,there is more sea.
sentence.Chinese: 尽管你的灵魂航行了千万里,再过千万里之外还是大海.

sentence.English: Anger begins with folly, and ends in repentance.
sentence.Chinese: 愤怒以愚蠢开始，以后悔告终。

sentence.English: Anger is a brief madness.
sentence.Chinese: 愤怒是短暂的疯狂。

sentence.English: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
sentence.Chinese: 愤怒是吹灭心中之灯的风。

sentence.English: Anger is not only inevitable, it is necessary. Its absence means indifference, the most disastrous of all human failings.
sentence.Chinese: 愤怒不仅无可避免，而且有必要。没有愤怒表示你漠不关心，那才是人类最可怕的弱点。

sentence.English: Anger is seldom without an argument, but seldom with a good one.
sentence.Chinese: 生气很少没有理由，不过很少有一个很好的理由。

sentence.English: Animals are such agreeable friends-they ask no questions,they pass no criticisms.
sentence.Chinese: 动物是极容易相处的朋友，它们从不提问，也从不会批评。

sentence.English: Any help is better than no help.
sentence.Chinese: 任何帮助都胜于没有帮助.

sentence.English: Anything for a quiet life.
sentence.Chinese: 悠然自在最难求.

sentence.English: Anything will give up its secrets if you love it enough.
sentence.Chinese: 不论什么东西,只要你爱它够深,它就会倾吐它的秘密.

sentence.English: Appearances are deceptive.
sentence.Chinese: 外表是靠不住的。

sentence.English: April and May are the key of the year.
sentence.Chinese: 一年之计在于春.

sentence.English: Arrogance causes nothing but trouble. It is wiser to ask for advice.
sentence.Chinese: 妄自尊大只会带来麻烦.聪明的作法是虚心问人.

sentence.English: Art is long, but life is short.
sentence.Chinese: 人生有限,艺术无穷.

sentence.English: Art is long,life is short.
sentence.Chinese: 人生短暂，艺术长存。

sentence.English: Art lies in concealing art.
sentence.Chinese: 艺术在于使人看不见艺术。

sentence.English: Artists who have won fame are embarrassed by it; thus their first works are often their best.
sentence.Chinese: 成名的艺术家仅为盛名所累,所以他们最早的作品往往是最好的.

sentence.English: As a man sows so he shall reap.
sentence.Chinese: 种瓜得瓜,种豆得豆.

sentence.English: As a tree falls, so shall it lie.
sentence.Chinese: 树倒在何处，就躺在何处。

sentence.English: As devotion unites lovers so perfidy estranges friends.
sentence.Chinese: 忠诚是爱情的桥梁,欺诈是友谊的敌人.

sentence.English: As every thread of gold is valuable, so every moment of time.
sentence.Chinese: 一寸光阴一寸金.

sentence.English: As good lost as found.
sentence.Chinese: 有得必有失. /得失同喜.

sentence.English: As in the Changjing River waves urge waves, so the younger generation excels the older generation.
sentence.Chinese: 长江后浪推前浪,一代更比一代强.

sentence.English: As is the workman so is the work.
sentence.Chinese: 什么匠人出什么活儿.

sentence.English: As it is the mark of great minds to say many things in a few words, so it is the mark of little minds to use many words to say nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 大智者聊聊数语,即能达意,寡智者口若悬河,仍言之无物.

sentence.English: As land is improved by sowing it with various seeds, so is the mind by exercising it with different studies.
sentence.Chinese: 土壤因播种不同的种籽而改良,智力用各科的学习来提高.

sentence.English: As long as the green hills last,there'll always be wood to burn.
sentence.Chinese: 留得青山在,不怕没柴烧.

sentence.English: As long as you keep a person down, some part of you has to be down there to hold him down,so it means you can not soar as you otherwise might.
sentence.Chinese: 你要把别人压着不放,自己就不可能腾身起来.

sentence.English: As long as you live,you should be man useful to the people./ Be useful to the people all your life.
sentence.Chinese: 活着就要做一个对人民有用的人.

sentence.English: As man sows, so he shall reap.
sentence.Chinese: 善有善报，恶有恶报。

sentence.English: As soon as you feel too old to do a thing,do it.
sentence.Chinese: 一旦你觉得做某件事太老了,赶紧做它.

sentence.English: As the call, so the echo.
sentence.Chinese: 发什么声音，有什么回声。

sentence.English: As the old cock crows, so does the young.
sentence.Chinese: 老公鸡怎样叫,小公鸡怎样学.

sentence.English: As the tree,so the fruit.
sentence.Chinese: 什么树结什么果。

sentence.English: As the wind blows, you must set your sail.
sentence.Chinese: 挂帆得随风向.

sentence.English: As truth is like the sun, it cannot be shadad up by one's palm.
sentence.Chinese: 真理象太阳,一手难遮挡.

sentence.English: As you make your bed so you must lie on it.
sentence.Chinese: 自己铺的床必须自己去躺。/ 自作则自受。

sentence.English: As your wedding-ring wears, your cares will wear away.
sentence.Chinese: 结婚戒指戴旧了,烦恼也就消除了.

sentence.English: Ask no questions and you will be told no lies.
sentence.Chinese: 少问就听不到假话。

sentence.English: Ask the common folk if you want to know how the country is faring.
sentence.Chinese: 要知朝中事,乡间问老农.

sentence.English: At Easter let your clothes be new,or else be sure you will it rue.
sentence.Chinese: 复活节不穿新衣裳,日后不免要懊丧.

sentence.English: At a round table there's no dispute of place.
sentence.Chinese: 圆桌上没有座次之争。

sentence.English: At court,everyone for himself.
sentence.Chinese: 在法庭上人人都要为自己。

sentence.English: At need one sees who his friend is.
sentence.Chinese: 处于困境时可以看出谁是自己的朋友.

sentence.English: At the touch of love,everyone becomes a poet.
sentence.Chinese: 一经爱的触摸,人人能当诗人.

sentence.English: At times, although one is perfectly right, one's legs tremble; at other times, althouth one is completely in the wrong, birds sing in one's soul.
sentence.Chinese: 有时，我们虽然理直气壮，双腿却不免颤抖；另有些时候，我们虽然完全错了 但却内心欢畅。

sentence.English: At twenty years of age, the will reigns; at thirty, the wit; and at forty, the judgment.
sentence.Chinese: 二十岁时起支配作用的是意志,三十岁时是机智,四十岁时是判断.

sentence.English: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
sentence.Chinese: 秋季是第二个春天，每片树叶都是花朵。

sentence.English: Bacchus hath drowned more men than Neptune.
sentence.Chinese: 在酒里淹死的人比在海里淹死的人多。

sentence.English: Bad times make a good man.
sentence.Chinese: 艰难困苦出能人.

sentence.English: Barking dogs don't bite.
sentence.Chinese: 吠犬不咬人。

sentence.English: Be able to be alone.Lose not the advantage of solitude.
sentence.Chinese: 要有单独自处的能力，不要放过孤寂的好处。

sentence.English: Be as careful of the books you read, as of the company you keep; for your habits and character will be as much influenced by the former as by the latter.
sentence.Chinese: 选书应和交友一样谨慎,因为你的习惯和性格受书籍的影响不亚于受朋友的影响.

sentence.English: Be concerned about the affairs of state before others,and enjoy comfort after others.Be the first to feel concern about state affairs and the last to enjoy yourself.
sentence.Chinese: 先天下之忧,后天下之乐而乐.

sentence.English: Be it ever so humble, there is no place like home.
sentence.Chinese: 休嫌它寒微贫贱,天涯无处似家园.

sentence.English: Be just before you are generous.
sentence.Chinese: 要慷慨必先求公正。

sentence.English: Be like the sun and the meadow, which are not in the least concerned about the coming winter.
sentence.Chinese: 要象阳光和草地那样对寒冬的来临全不在乎.

sentence.English: Be modest in learning,for complacency is the enemy of study.
sentence.Chinese: 学习要虚心,自满是敌人.

sentence.English: Be not angry that you connot make others as you wish them to be ,since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.
sentence.Chinese: 不要由于别人不能成为你所希望的人而恼怒，因为你自己也不能成为自已所希望的人。

sentence.English: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
sentence.Chinese: 选择朋友要慢,换朋友更要慢.

sentence.English: Be slow to promise and quick to perform.
sentence.Chinese: 允诺宜缓，履行宜速。

sentence.English: Be steady in doing your work; be resolute in correcting your mistakes.
sentence.Chinese: 做事要稳，改错要狠。

sentence.English: Be still,and have the will.
sentence.Chinese: 不动声色,事方有成.

sentence.English: Be sure before you marry of a house where in to tarry.
sentence.Chinese: 先立业,后成家.

sentence.English: Be swift to hear,slow to speak. / Give every man your ear, but few your voice.
sentence.Chinese: 多听少讲.

sentence.English: Be wisely worldly, be not worldly wise.
sentence.Chinese: 要聪明地世故，不要世故地聪明。

sentence.English: Bear this in mind: Scientific research costs a man his energies of a lifetime.
sentence.Chinese: 要记住:科学需要一个人付出他毕业的精力.

sentence.English: Bear wealth, poverty will bear itself.
sentence.Chinese: 耐得富的人也耐得穷.

sentence.English: Bear with evil,and expect good.
sentence.Chinese: 坏事要忍，好事要等。

sentence.English: Beauty and folly are often companies.
sentence.Chinese: 漂亮与愚蠢常为伴侣。

sentence.English: Beauty in things exist in the mind which contemplates them.
sentence.Chinese: 事物的美存在于仔细观察者的心目中.

sentence.English: Beauty is but skin-deep.
sentence.Chinese: 美只是外表, /不能以貌取人.

sentence.English: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
sentence.Chinese: 情人眼里出西施.

sentence.English: Beauty is potent,but morality is omnipotent.
sentence.Chinese: 美貌固有力，道德力无穷。

sentence.English: Beauty will buy no beef.
sentence.Chinese: 漂亮不能当饭吃。

sentence.English: Before friends all is common.
sentence.Chinese: 朋友之间应不分彼此.

sentence.English: Before you make a friend eat a bushel of salt with him.
sentence.Chinese: 交友前先和他共吃一蒲式耳盐. /不深知,不结交.

sentence.English: Beggars cannot be choosers.
sentence.Chinese: 乞丐不能挑肥拣瘦.

sentence.English: Beggars do not envy millionaires, though of course they will envy other beggars who are more successful.
sentence.Chinese: 乞丐并不羡慕百万富翁,尽管他们会羡慕比他们乞讨得多的乞丐.

sentence.English: Being a well-dressed man is a career, and he who goes in for it has no time for anything else.
sentence.Chinese: 穿着整齐本身就是一种职业,一味追求穿着就没有时间做别的了.

sentence.English: Believe not all that you see nor half what you hear.
sentence.Chinese: 虽眼见亦不能全信,道听途说更不足信.

sentence.English: Benefits please,like flowers, while they are fresh.
sentence.Chinese: 没有开不败的鲜花，也没有永远使人感激的恩惠。

sentence.English: Best to bend while it's a twig.
sentence.Chinese: 树当从小修整.

sentence.English: Better a fortune in a wife than with a wife.
sentence.Chinese: 娶个富家女不如讨个巧媳妇.

sentence.English: Better a frank denial than unwilling compliance.
sentence.Chinese: 勉强应允不如坦诚拒绝.

sentence.English: Better a glorious death than a shameful life.
sentence.Chinese: 宁求光荣死,不可耻辱生.

sentence.English: Better a witty fool than a foolish wit.
sentence.Chinese: 宁要机智的傻子，不要愚蠢的机智人。

sentence.English: Better an egg today than a hen tomorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 今天一只蛋,胜过明天一只鸡.

sentence.English: Better be a poor man's darling than a rich man's warling.
sentence.Chinese: 与其遭富人厌弃,不如嫁给穷人为妻.

sentence.English: Better be blamed by our kith and kin,than be kissed by the enemy.
sentence.Chinese: 宁可让亲人责备，切勿让敌人亲吻。

sentence.English: Better be sure than sorry.
sentence.Chinese: 稳当总比后悔好。

sentence.English: Better be the head of a dog than the tail of a lion.
sentence.Chinese: 宁为鸡口，毋为牛后。

sentence.English: Better be unmannerly than troublesome.
sentence.Chinese: 宁可有失礼貌,也不打扰别人.

sentence.English: Better deny at once than promise long.
sentence.Chinese: 与其答应而不履行，不如马上拒绝。

sentence.English: Better do more daily,trivial,ordinary and practical work that is needed by the people,than say a thousand empty words that may be sweet to the ear.
sentence.Chinese: 多做一些人民需要的,日常的,细小的,平凡而实际的工作,胜过说一千句漂亮动听的话语.

sentence.English: Better drink the water given by a friend,than eat the honey offered by the enemy.
sentence.Chinese: 宁喝朋友水，不吃敌人蜜。

sentence.English: Better go to bed supperless than rise in debt.
sentence.Chinese: 与其醒来负债,不如忍饿上床.

sentence.English: Better late than never.
sentence.Chinese: 迟做总比不做好.

sentence.English: Better leave than lack.
sentence.Chinese: 有余胜过不足.

sentence.English: Better lose a jest than a friend.
sentence.Chinese: 宁可少说俏皮话,也不开罪朋友.

sentence.English: Better master one than engage with ten.
sentence.Chinese: 十事半通,不如一事精通.

sentence.English: Better never to begin than never to make an end.
sentence.Chinese: 没有决心干到底不如不开始.

sentence.English: Better one's house too little one day than too big all the year after.
sentence.Chinese: 一日嫌屋子小,胜过一年嫌屋子大.

sentence.English: Better pay the butcher than the doctor.
sentence.Chinese: 花钱看病不如出钱买肉。

sentence.English: Better rely on yourself than look to others for help.
sentence.Chinese: 与其求人,不如求已.

sentence.English: Better sense in the head than cents in the pocket.
sentence.Chinese: 口袋里有钱不如头脑里有知识.

sentence.English: Better spare to have of thine own than ask of other men.
sentence.Chinese: 求人不如自己省.

sentence.English: Better the devil you know than the devil you don't know.
sentence.Chinese: 明枪易躲，暗箭难防。

sentence.English: Better the foot slip than the tongue trip.
sentence.Chinese: 宁可失足，不可失言。

sentence.English: Better the last smile than the first laughter.
sentence.Chinese: 宁可最后微笑,不要首先狂喜.

sentence.English: Better to ask the way than go astray.
sentence.Chinese: 问路总比迷路好.

sentence.English: Better to be alone than in bad company.
sentence.Chinese: 宁可孤单也不交坏朋友.

sentence.English: Better to do well than to say well.
sentence.Chinese: 说得好不如做得好.

sentence.English: Better to light one candle than to curse the darkness.
sentence.Chinese: 与其诅咒黑暗,不如燃起蜡烛.

sentence.English: Better to read little with thought than much with levity and quickness.
sentence.Chinese: 读书与其多而草率,不如少而精研.

sentence.English: Better to reign in hell than serve in heaven.
sentence.Chinese: 宁在地狱为王，不到天堂当差。

sentence.English: Better unlearned than ill-learned.
sentence.Chinese: 学而不化,不如无学.

sentence.English: Better wear out shoes than sheets.
sentence.Chinese: 宁愿把鞋子穿漏，不愿把床单磨破。

sentence.English: Better without gold than without friends.
sentence.Chinese: 宁可没有金钱,不可没有朋友.

sentence.English: Between two stools you fall to the ground.
sentence.Chinese: 欲坐双凳必坠地.

sentence.English: Beware beginning.
sentence.Chinese: 慎始为上。

sentence.English: Beware of a silent dog and still water.
sentence.Chinese: 提防不吠的狗，小心平静的水。/ 不叫的狗咬人痛，无浪的水淹死人。

sentence.English: Beware of the fury of a patient man.
sentence.Chinese: 要小心脾气好的人发火。

sentence.English: Beware the flatterer:he feeds you with an empty spoon./ He who gives fair words feeds you with an empty spoon.
sentence.Chinese: 提防谄媚者:他用空匙喂你.

sentence.English: Bigotry may be roughly defined as the anger of men who have no opinions.
sentence.Chinese: 可以给偏执下一个粗略的定义：没有观点的人的愤怒。

sentence.English: Birds in their little nests agree.
sentence.Chinese: 鸟巢虽小,夫妻不吵.

sentence.English: Birds of a feather flock together.
sentence.Chinese: 物以类聚,人以群分.

sentence.English: Birth is much, but breeding is more.
sentence.Chinese: 教养重于出身。

sentence.English: Blessed is the person who is too busy to worry in the daytime,and too sleepy to worry at night.
sentence.Chinese: 白天忙得没有时间发愁，夜里困得来不及发愁的人是真正有福的。

sentence.English: Blind men can judge no colours.
sentence.Chinese: 盲者不辨色。

sentence.English: Blood is thicker than water.
sentence.Chinese: 血比水浓.

sentence.English: Blow first and sip afterwards.
sentence.Chinese: 喝茶防烫，吃饭防噎。

sentence.English: Blushing is virtue's color.
sentence.Chinese: 脸红是美德的颜色。

sentence.English: Books and friends should be few but good.
sentence.Chinese: 书与友,贵精不贵多.

sentence.English: Books are the ever-burning lamps of accrmulated wisdom.
sentence.Chinese: 好书乃积累智慧之长明灯.

sentence.English: Bought wit is best, but may cost too much.
sentence.Chinese: 亲身的体验最好,只不过有时代价太高.

sentence.English: Boys will be boys.
sentence.Chinese: 男孩子总是男孩子.

sentence.English: Bread is the staff of life.
sentence.Chinese: 民以食为天。

sentence.English: Bread nourishes the body, and books enrich the mind.
sentence.Chinese: 面包滋养身体,书本充实头脑.

sentence.English: Brevity is the soul of wit.
sentence.Chinese: 言以简为贵.

sentence.English: Burn not your house to fright the mouse away.
sentence.Chinese: 别为吓跑耗子而去烧房子。

sentence.English: Business before pleasure.
sentence.Chinese: 先工作,后娱乐./干完正事再玩儿.

sentence.English: By doing nothing we learn to do ill.
sentence.Chinese: 游手好闲是万恶之源.

sentence.English: By his claw, you may know the lion.
sentence.Chinese: 要知狮子看脚爪。

sentence.English: By the side of sickness health becomes sweet.
sentence.Chinese: 不生病不知道健康的快乐。

sentence.English: By the street of ”Bye-and-bye”one arrives at the house of ”Never”.
sentence.Chinese: 迁延因循,一事无成.

sentence.English: Calf love,half love; old love, cold love.
sentence.Chinese: 童年相爱,半是稚气; 老年相爱,爱得深沉.

sentence.English: Call a spade a spade.
sentence.Chinese: 是啥说啥，难听不怕。

sentence.English: Call me cousin, but cozen me out.
sentence.Chinese: 与我攀亲可以,欺骗我可不行.

sentence.English: Call no man happy till he dies.
sentence.Chinese: 人在死以前称不上幸福.

sentence.English: Can man be free if woman is a slave?
sentence.Chinese: 妇女当牛做马,男子焉能自由?

sentence.English: Capacity without education is pitiful; education without capacity is throw away.
sentence.Chinese: 有才干缺教育令人可惜; 有教育缺才干被人抛弃.

sentence.English: Care is no cure.
sentence.Chinese: 忧虑治不了病。

sentence.English: Care killed a cat.
sentence.Chinese: 忧虑能杀人。

sentence.English: Carve your name on hearts and not on marbles.
sentence.Chinese: 把你的姓名刻在人们的心上,而不是刻在大理石上.

sentence.English: Cast not out the foul water till you bring in the clean.
sentence.Chinese: 端来清水以前,别把浊水泼掉.

sentence.English: Catch not at the shadow and lose the substance.
sentence.Chinese: 勿抓影子而失去本质。

sentence.English: Catch your bear before you sell its skin.
sentence.Chinese: 抓到熊再卖皮.

sentence.English: Chains do not hold a marriage together, It is threads, hundreds of tiny threads, which sew people together through the years.
sentence.Chinese: 锁链系不住婚姻;是线 无数的细线经年累月把人们缝合在一起.

sentence.English: Chance generally favours the prudent.
sentence.Chinese: 运气通常照顾深思熟虑者.

sentence.English: Chance is a word void of sense; nothing can exist without a cause.
sentence.Chinese: 机会是个没有意义的词;任何事物都不会无缘无故地存在.

sentence.English: Character is the first and last word in the success circle.
sentence.Chinese: 品德好是成功的先决条件和最终衡量.

sentence.English: Character is what you are in the dark.
sentence.Chinese: 品格是你在暗室中的为人.

sentence.English: Charity begins at home.
sentence.Chinese: 仁爱先施于亲友.

sentence.English: Cheapest is the dearest.
sentence.Chinese: 最便宜的也就是最贵的.

sentence.English: Cheerfulness is health; its opposite, melancholy, is disease.
sentence.Chinese: 欢乐就是健康，忧郁就是病痛。

sentence.English: Chiefly the mold of a man's fortune is in his own hands.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人的命运主要由他自己塑造.

sentence.English: Children are poor men's riches.
sentence.Chinese: 儿女是穷人的财富.

sentence.English: Children learn to creep ere they can go.
sentence.Chinese: 小孩走路先学爬.

sentence.English: Choose a life of action,not one of ostentation.
sentence.Chinese: 要选择行动的一生,而不是炫耀的一生.

sentence.English: Choose a wife rather by your ear than your eye.
sentence.Chinese: 选择妻子,用耳比用眼可靠.

sentence.English: Choose an author as you choose a friend.
sentence.Chinese: 择书如择友.

sentence.English: Choose neither a woman nor linen by candlelight.
sentence.Chinese: 不要在烛光下选妻子或内衣.

sentence.English: Christmas comes but once a year,But when it comes it brings good cheer.
sentence.Chinese: 圣诞节一年只来一次，但每次来临却都带来喜悦。

sentence.English: Civility costs nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 礼貌不费分文.

sentence.English: Civilization is a limitless multiplication of unnecessary necessities.
sentence.Chinese: 文明是不必要的必需品的无限增加。

sentence.English: Cleanliness is next to godliness.
sentence.Chinese: 清洁仅次于圣洁。

sentence.English: Clever all one's life, but stupid this once./ Smart as a rule, but this time a fool.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明一世，糊涂一时。

sentence.English: Cleverness does not take the place of knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明不能代替知识.

sentence.English: Clothes do not make the man.
sentence.Chinese: 人不在衣装.

sentence.English: Cloudy mornings turn to clear evenings.
sentence.Chinese: 早见云雾晚见晴。

sentence.English: Co-operation is doing with a smile what you have to do anyhow.
sentence.Chinese: 所谓合作，就是面带笑容去做非做不可的事。

sentence.English: Cold broth hot again, that loved I never; Old love renewed again, that loved I ever.
sentence.Chinese: 冷汤回锅味不鲜,旧情复燃更缠绵.

sentence.English: Comfort is better than pride.
sentence.Chinese: 华美不如舒适.

sentence.English: Coming events cast their shadows before.
sentence.Chinese: 未来之事，必有征兆。

sentence.English: Command your man and do it yourself.
sentence.Chinese: 要求部下做到,自己也要做到.

sentence.English: Community of purpose makes friendship.
sentence.Chinese: 目标一致生友谊.

sentence.English: Complete sincerity can affect even metal and stone.
sentence.Chinese: 精诚所至,金石为开.

sentence.English: Compromise is simply changing the question to fit the anwser.
sentence.Chinese: 妥协只不过是修改问题以迁就答案.

sentence.English: Comrade Bethune's spirit, his utter devotion to others without any thought of self,was shown in his boundless sense of responsibility in his work and his boundless warm-heartedness towards all comrades and the people.
sentence.Chinese: 白求恩同志毫不利已专门利人的精神,表现在他对工作的极端负责任,对同志对人民的极端热忱.

sentence.English: Conceit comes from shallowness; arrogance is due to ignorance.
sentence.Chinese: 骄傲来自浅薄，狂妄出于无知。

sentence.English: Conceit is the most incurable disease that is known to the human soul.
sentence.Chinese: 骄傲自满是精神上最不可救药的顽症。

sentence.English: Conceit is the quicksand of success.
sentence.Chinese: 自负是成功的流沙。

sentence.English: Conceit may puff a man up, but it can never prop him up.
sentence.Chinese: 自高自大可以使一个人膨胀起来，但并不能支撑住他。

sentence.English: Conceited [=ingenious] goods are quickly spent.
sentence.Chinese: 花哨货,不经用.

sentence.English: Conditions are changing all the time,and to adapt one's thinking to the new conditions. one must study.
sentence.Chinese: 情况是在不断地变化,要使自己的思想适应新的情况就得学习.

sentence.English: Confidence is a plant of slow growth.
sentence.Chinese: 信任是一棵难长的树.

sentence.English: Conquer the fear of death and you are put into possession of your life.
sentence.Chinese: 征服对死的恐惧,你就占有了生命.

sentence.English: Constant dropping wears away a stone.
sentence.Chinese: 滴水可以穿石.

sentence.English: Content is the philosopher's stone, that turns all it touches into gold.
sentence.Chinese: 知足好比点金术.

sentence.English: Content lodges oftener in cottages than palaces.
sentence.Chinese: 满足常在村舍,而不在王宫.

sentence.English: Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
sentence.Chinese: 知足是天然的财富,奢侈是人为的贫困.

sentence.English: Cornered beasts will still fight.
sentence.Chinese: 困兽犹斗,狗急跳墙.

sentence.English: Correct the mistakes if you have committed them, and avoid them if you have not.
sentence.Chinese: 有则改之,无则加勉.

sentence.English: Couch hard arguments in soft words.
sentence.Chinese: 理要硬而话要软。

sentence.English: Could we see when and where we are to meet again, we would be more tender when we bid our friends goodbye.
sentence.Chinese: 假如我们能预知何时何地重逢,和朋友话别时就会更情真.

sentence.English: Counsel breaks not the head.
sentence.Chinese: 忠告不会打破头.

sentence.English: Counsel is no command.
sentence.Chinese: 劝告不是命令.

sentence.English: Courage and resolution are the spirit and soul of virtue.
sentence.Chinese: 勇敢和坚定是美德的灵魂.

sentence.English: Courage consists, not in the ability of overlooking danger, but in seeing and conquering it.
sentence.Chinese: 勇敢不在于能够忽视危险,而在于认清危险,战胜危险.

sentence.English: Courage is a virtue only so far as it is directed by prudence.
sentence.Chinese: 勇敢只有由审慎指导才能成为美德.

sentence.English: Courage is that virtue which champions the cause of right.
sentence.Chinese: 勇敢是支持正义事业的美德.

sentence.English: Courage is the ladder on which all the other virtues mount.
sentence.Chinese: 勇气是一架梯子,其它美德全靠它爬上去.

sentence.English: Courage without conscience is a wild beast.
sentence.Chinese: 不计道德的勇敢与野兽无异.

sentence.English: Courtesy is the inseparable companion of virtue.
sentence.Chinese: 礼貌和美德是分不开的伴侣.

sentence.English: Courtesy on one side only lasts not long.
sentence.Chinese: 礼貌靠双方维持.

sentence.English: Cowards die many times before their deaths.
sentence.Chinese: 胆怯者在真正死亡前已死过多次.

sentence.English: Craft must have clother,but truth loves to go naked.
sentence.Chinese: 诡计定然披着外衣,真理却不爱装饰.

sentence.English: Credit keeps the crown of the causeway.
sentence.Chinese: 守信誉的人不怕走在大街中央。

sentence.English: Creditors have better memories than debtors.
sentence.Chinese: 放债的比借债的记性好.

sentence.English: Critics are like brushers of noblemen's clothes.
sentence.Chinese: 批评家好比男仆，为大人物刷去衣服上的灰尘。

sentence.English: Cross the stream where it is shallowest.
sentence.Chinese: 渡河要挑最浅处. /从易处着手.

sentence.English: Cross your t's and dot your i's.
sentence.Chinese: 办事要一丝不苟.

sentence.English: Curiosity is ill manners in another's house.
sentence.Chinese: 在别人家里显得好奇是没礼貌的表现。

sentence.English: Custom is second nature.
sentence.Chinese: 习惯是第二天性。/ 习惯成自然。

sentence.English: Custom makes all things easy.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事成习惯就容易做。/ 熟能生巧。

sentence.English: Custom reconciles us to everything.
sentence.Chinese: 习惯则不怨。

sentence.English: Cut your coat according to your cloth.
sentence.Chinese: 看布裁衣.

sentence.English: Dare and diligence bring luck.
sentence.Chinese: 大胆又勤奋,定能交好运.

sentence.English: Dare and the world always yields. If it beats you sometimes.dare it again and again and it will succumb.
sentence.Chinese: 大胆挑战,世界总会让步.如果有时候你被它打败了,不断地挑战,它总会屈服的.

sentence.English: Dawted [= petted] daughters make daidling [= silly ]wives.
sentence.Chinese: 娇生惯养的姑娘,只会成为傻里傻气的婆娘.

sentence.English: Deal with a man as he deals with you. / Pay a person back in his own coin.
sentence.Chinese: 以其人之道,还治其人之身.

sentence.English: Death is the only pure,beautiful conclusion of a great passion.
sentence.Chinese: 死是伟大的激情的唯一纯洁,美丽的终结.

sentence.English: Death is the privilege of human nature, and life without it were not our taking.
sentence.Chinese: 死亡是人类天然的特权,没有死的生非人类所能有.

sentence.English: Deceiving those that trust us is more than a sin.
sentence.Chinese: 欺骗信任自己的人是罪上加罪.

sentence.English: Deeds are fruits,words are but leaves.
sentence.Chinese: 行动是果实,言论不过是叶子.

sentence.English: Deeds, not words.
sentence.Chinese: 行动胜于空谈.

sentence.English: Delays are dangerous.
sentence.Chinese: 因循出危险.

sentence.English: Deliberate slowly, execute promptly.
sentence.Chinese: 思谋要慢,行动要快.

sentence.English: Deliberating is not delaying.
sentence.Chinese: 深思熟虑不误事.

sentence.English: Democracy means not”I'm as good as you are”but”you're as good as Iam.”
sentence.Chinese: 民主的含义不是“我跟你一样好”，而是“你跟我一样好”。

sentence.English: Desires are nourished by delays.
sentence.Chinese: 欲望迟迟得不到满足，而愈来愈强烈。

sentence.English: Destiny: A tyrant's authority for crime,and a fool's excuse for failure.
sentence.Chinese: 命运是暴君施虐的权威,傻瓜失败的借口.

sentence.English: Dexterity comes by experience.
sentence.Chinese: 换取经验要付出代价.

sentence.English: Diamond cuts diamond.
sentence.Chinese: 强中自有强中手.

sentence.English: Diet cures more than doctors.
sentence.Chinese: 自己饮食有节，胜过上门求医。

sentence.English: Difficult circumstances serve as a textbook of life for people.
sentence.Chinese: 困难坎坷是人们的生活教科书.

sentence.English: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labour does the body.
sentence.Chinese: 困难磨练意志,劳动增强身体.

sentence.English: Diffidence is the poison of friendship.
sentence.Chinese: 踌躇是友谊的毒药.

sentence.English: Diligence bring about fruitful results. / Hard work brings bumper harvest.
sentence.Chinese: 勤劳出硕果.

sentence.English: Diligence is the mother of success.
sentence.Chinese: 勤勉是成功之母.

sentence.English: Diligence overcomes difficulties. Sloth makes them.
sentence.Chinese: 勤劳克服困难,懒惰制造困难.

sentence.English: Diligence redeems stupidity.
sentence.Chinese: 勤能补拙.

sentence.English: Discontent is the first step in progress of a man or a nation.
sentence.Chinese: 不满足是一个人或一个民族进步的第一步。

sentence.English: Discussion is an exchange of intelligence. Argument is an exchange of ignorance.
sentence.Chinese: 讨论是交换智慧.争辩是交换无知.

sentence.English: Diseases are the interests of pleasures.
sentence.Chinese: 疾病是为享乐付出的债息。

sentence.English: Dispatch is the soul of business.
sentence.Chinese: 迅速是商事之本.

sentence.English: Distrust all in whom the impules to punish is powerful.
sentence.Chinese: 不要信任任何有强烈惩罚欲的人.

sentence.English: Do as you would be done by.
sentence.Chinese: 己所不欲，勿施于人。

sentence.English: Do business,but be not a slave to it.
sentence.Chinese: 应为事之主,勿为事之奴.

sentence.English: Do not all you can;spend not all you have;believe not all you hear;and tell not all you know.
sentence.Chinese: 做事别逞能，用钱莫用尽，人言勿全信，说话留三分。

sentence.English: Do not buy what you want, but what you need; what you do not need is dear at a farthing.
sentence.Chinese: 不要买你想要的,要买你需要的;你不需要的东西哪怕一分钱也是贵的.

sentence.English: Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
sentence.Chinese: 己所不欲，勿施于人。

sentence.English: Do not look each of you to your things, but each of you also to the things of others.
sentence.Chinese: 不要只顾自己的事,也要顾别人的事.

sentence.English: Do not pick the sesame seeds but overlook the watermelons.
sentence.Chinese: 勿拣了芝麻，丢了西瓜。

sentence.English: Do not put all your eggs in one basket.
sentence.Chinese: 不要把全部鸡蛋放在一只篮子里。

sentence.English: Do not put new wine into old bottles.
sentence.Chinese: 不要旧瓶装新酒。

sentence.English: Do not try to live for ever.you will not succeed.
sentence.Chinese: 不要幻想永远活下去,你不会成功的.

sentence.English: Do not, for one repulse, forgo the purpose that you resolved to effort.
sentence.Chinese: 不要只因一次挫败,就放弃你原来决心想达到的目的.

sentence.English: Do what is right, come what may.
sentence.Chinese: 不管会发生什么,对的就要去做.

sentence.English: Do you know that those who run in a race run all, but only one receives the prize? Even so run,that you may attain.
sentence.Chinese: 岂不知在场上赛跑的都在跑，但得奖赏的只有一人?即使如此，也只有这样跑，你们才有可能得到奖赏。

sentence.English: Don't be afraid of making mistakes,but it is harmful to let them remain uncorrected.
sentence.Chinese: 不怕有过，就怕不改。

sentence.English: Don't believe that winning is really everything. It's more important to stand for something. If you don't stand for something,what do you win?
sentence.Chinese: 不要认为取胜就是一切,更重要的是要有信念,倘若你没有信念,那胜利又有什么意义呢?

sentence.English: Don't carry coals to Newcastle.
sentence.Chinese: 别往纽卡斯尔(英煤都)运煤。/ 多此一举，徒劳无益。

sentence.English: Don't count your chickens before they are hatched.
sentence.Chinese: 蛋未孵，别先数鸡。

sentence.English: Don't deck yourself up with fine clothes, but enrich your mind with profound knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 不要用衣服装饰躯壳,而要用智慧丰富头脑.

sentence.English: Don't expect anything original form an echo.
sentence.Chinese: 不要期望从回声中找到独创的东西.

sentence.English: Don't halloo till you are out of the wood.
sentence.Chinese: 未出险境，莫先高兴。

sentence.English: Don't have too many irons in the fire.
sentence.Chinese: 不要把太多的熨斗放到火炉上。/ 不要同时要办的事太多。

sentence.English: Don't have your cloak to make when it begins to rain.
sentence.Chinese: 别等下雨再做雨衣。/ 宜未雨绸缪。

sentence.English: Don't make mountains out of molehills.
sentence.Chinese: 勿把苍蝇说成大象。

sentence.English: Don't meet trouble half-way.
sentence.Chinese: 不要自寻烦恼。

sentence.English: Don't put the cart before the horse.
sentence.Chinese: 不要把车套在马前头. /不要本末倒置.

sentence.English: Don't regret about your past as it's useless,but prevent the same mistakes in the future.
sentence.Chinese: 往者不可谏,来者犹可追.

sentence.English: Don't run with the hare and hunt with the hounds.
sentence.Chinese: 不要既陪野兔奔跑，又随猎狗追捕。

sentence.English: Don't teach your grandmother to suck eggs.
sentence.Chinese: 不要班门弄斧。

sentence.English: Don't tell me how hard you work. Tell me how much you get done.
sentence.Chinese: 不必告诉我你多么勤奋,只要告诉我你做了多少事.

sentence.English: Don't throw out the baby with the bath water.
sentence.Chinese: 不要将小孩与洗澡水一起倒掉。

sentence.English: Don't trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
sentence.Chinese: 麻烦没有来找你，不要去找麻烦。

sentence.English: Don't waste life in doubts and fears.
sentence.Chinese: 不要把生命浪费于怀疑与恐惧中。

sentence.English: Don't waste your precious time, for youth, once spent, will never come again./ Seize the day, for fleeting youth never returns.
sentence.Chinese: 光阴勿虚度,青春不再来.

sentence.English: Doubt is the key of knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 怀疑是知识的钥匙.

sentence.English: Drawn wells are seldom dry.
sentence.Chinese: 水井常用不枯竭.

sentence.English: Drift is as bad as unthrift.
sentence.Chinese: 花钱凭冲动,等于无底洞.

sentence.English: Dry bread at home is better than roast meat abroad.
sentence.Chinese: 在外吃烤肉不如在家啃面包.

sentence.English: Each man is the architect of his own fate.
sentence.Chinese: 每个人都是自己命运的建筑师.

sentence.English: Each of us is the accumulation of our memories.
sentence.Chinese: 我们每个人都是我们记忆的累积。

sentence.English: Early sow,early mow.
sentence.Chinese: 种得早,收得早.

sentence.English: Early start makes easy stages.
sentence.Chinese: 早动身,易从容,早开始,早成功.

sentence.English: Early to bed and early to rise, Makes a man healthy, wealthy and Wise.
sentence.Chinese: 睡得早，起得早，富裕，聪明，身体好。

sentence.English: East is East and West is West,and never the twain shall meet.
sentence.Chinese: 东是东来西是西，两者永远要分离。

sentence.English: East or West, home is best.
sentence.Chinese: 无论在何处,家园最美好.

sentence.English: Easy and success are fellows.
sentence.Chinese: 从容与成功是伙伴。

sentence.English: Easy come, easy go.
sentence.Chinese: 来得容易去得 . /悖入悖出.

sentence.English: Eat at pleasure,drink with measure.
sentence.Chinese: 随意吃饭，适度饮酒。

sentence.English: Eating and scratching wants but a beginning.
sentence.Chinese: 吃饭和搔痒只需开个头。

sentence.English: Economy is itself a great income.
sentence.Chinese: 节约本身就是一大笔收入.

sentence.English: Economy is the art of making the most of life.
sentence.Chinese: 节约是把生活尽量巧安排的艺术.

sentence.English: Education begins a gentleman,conversation completes him.
sentence.Chinese: 培养一个人，教育打基础，完美靠交谈。

sentence.English: Education is a progressive discovery of ourown ignorance.
sentence.Chinese: 教育是一个逐步发现自己无知的过程。

sentence.English: Education makes a people easy to lead,but difficult to drive; easy to govern but impossible to slave.
sentence.Chinese: 教育使一个国家的人民容易领导，但是难于驱使；容易治理，却不可以奴役。

sentence.English: Egotists do not see the world with themselves in it,but see themselves with the world around them.
sentence.Chinese: 自高自大的人看到的不是自己存在于这个世界上，而是世界围绕着他们而存在.。

sentence.English: Empty vessels make the most sound.
sentence.Chinese: 满瓶不响,半瓶响叮当.

sentence.English: England expects every man to do his duty.
sentence.Chinese: 祖国望每个国民恪尽职守。

sentence.English: Envy assails the noblest, the winds howl around the highest peak.
sentence.Chinese: 峰高招风，位高人妒。

sentence.English: Envy is a most terrible thing,and would spoil anybody's nature.
sentence.Chinese: 忌妒是很可怕的东西，它会毁损一切人的天性。

sentence.English: Envy may dissatisfy us with our lot.
sentence.Chinese: 嫉妒可使我们对自己的命运不满意。

sentence.English: Envy never enriched any man.
sentence.Chinese: 嫉妒从未使人得益。

sentence.English: Envy shoots at others and wounds herself.
sentence.Chinese: 忌妒之箭,射向别人,伤害自己.

sentence.English: Equivocation is first cousin to a lie.
sentence.Chinese: 模棱两可是谎话的近亲。

sentence.English: Error is often the precursor of what is correct, but conceit is the prelude to a fall.
sentence.Chinese: 错误往往是正确的先导，骄傲往往是跌跤的前奏。

sentence.English: Establishing goals is all right if your don't let them deprive you of interesting detours.
sentence.Chinese: 不妨订立目标,只要你不让它阻挡你兜有趣的圈子.

sentence.English: Eternal vigilance is the price of liberty.
sentence.Chinese: 自由的代价是永远警惕。

sentence.English: Even Homer sometimes nods.
sentence.Chinese: 即使荷马也会打盹. /智者千虑,必有一失.

sentence.English: Even a black hen lays a white egg.
sentence.Chinese: 黑鸡生白蛋，丑妇生俊儿。/草窝里飞出金凤凰。

sentence.English: Even a small star shines in the darkness.
sentence.Chinese: 星星再小,也会发光.

sentence.English: Even after victory is won, you should tighten the belts on your helmet and coat of mail.
sentence.Chinese: 在胜利之后,也要扣紧盔甲上的带子.

sentence.English: Even reckoning makes long friends.
sentence.Chinese: 帐目清楚,友情久长.

sentence.English: Even the emperor has straw-sandaled relatives.
sentence.Chinese: 皇帝也有穿草鞋的亲戚.

sentence.English: Even the weariest river winds somewhere safe to sea.
sentence.Chinese: 河流虽历尽险阻,也能蜿蜓流入大海.

sentence.English: Every Jack has his Jill.
sentence.Chinese: 人均有其偶.

sentence.English: Every bean hath its black.
sentence.Chinese: 每粒蚕豆都长黑嘴。 / 人都有缺点。

sentence.English: Every bird likes its own nest.
sentence.Chinese: 鸟均爱其巢;人皆爱其家.

sentence.English: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
sentence.Chinese: 每个孩子都是艺术家,问题在一旦长大后如何仍不失为艺术家.

sentence.English: Every cloud has a silver lining.
sentence.Chinese: 乌云后面有光明。

sentence.English: Every dog has his day.
sentence.Chinese: 瓦块也有翻身日，人人都有运来时。

sentence.English: Every flow has its ebb.
sentence.Chinese: 潮有涨落日,人有盛衰时.

sentence.English: Every generation finds it hard to hear what its children need---because its own childhood is still ringing in its ears.
sentence.Chinese: 每一代人都难听到下一代的需要----因为他自己的童年仍然萦绕耳际.

sentence.English: Every horse thinks its own pack heaviest.
sentence.Chinese: 每匹马都认为自己的负载最重。

sentence.English: Every kingdon divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divied against itself shall not stand.
sentence.Chinese: 一国自相纷争,就会成为荒场;一城一家自相纷争,必站立不住.

sentence.English: Every little helps.
sentence.Chinese: 点滴都有用.

sentence.English: Every man at forty is a fool or a physician.
sentence.Chinese: 人到四十，如果不是傻子，就该知道保养身体。

sentence.English: Every man can rule a shrew but he who has her.
sentence.Chinese: 泼妇人人都能制服,只有她的丈夫例外.

sentence.English: Every man desires to live long but no man would be old.
sentence.Chinese: 人人都想活得长久,可是谁也不愿意老.

sentence.English: Every man for himself,and God for us all.
sentence.Chinese: 人人为自己，上帝为大家。

sentence.English: Every man has a fool in his sleeve.
sentence.Chinese: 人人都有当傻瓜的可能.

sentence.English: Every man has a right to be wrong in his opinions. But no man has a right to be wrong in his facts.
sentence.Chinese: 人人都有权持有错误的见解.但没有人有权把事实弄错.

sentence.English: Every man has his faults.
sentence.Chinese: 人都有缺点.

sentence.English: Every man has the defects of his own virtues.
sentence.Chinese: 人皆有与其优点并存的缺点。

sentence.English: Every man is a fool sometimes,and none at all times.
sentence.Chinese: 人都有糊涂的时候,但谁都不会糊涂一生.

sentence.English: Every man is best known to himself.
sentence.Chinese: 自己最了解自己./知已莫若已.

sentence.English: Every man is his own enemy.
sentence.Chinese: 人都有与自己为敌的时候. /败事全由已.

sentence.English: Every man loves what he is good at.
sentence.Chinese: 人人都喜欢自己擅长的事物。

sentence.English: Every man must eat a peck of dirt before he dies.
sentence.Chinese: 人生在世总会受点委屈.

sentence.English: Every medal has two sides.
sentence.Chinese: 每个勋章都有两面。/ 每个问题都有正反两面。

sentence.English: Every new sovereign brings his own courtiers.
sentence.Chinese: 一朝天子一朝臣。

sentence.English: Every oak must be an acorn.
sentence.Chinese: 每棵橡树都曾是一粒橡子.

sentence.English: Every one can keep house better than her mother till she trieth.
sentence.Chinese: 姑娘都说自己比妈妈会当家.

sentence.English: Every one is witty for his own goal.
sentence.Chinese: 为达到自己的目标，人人都很聪明。

sentence.English: Every one of us has in him a continent of undiscovered character. Blessed is he who acts the Columbus to his own soul.
sentence.Chinese: 每个人都有未经发现的品性,能够象哥伦布那样探索自己灵魂的新大陆的人,是有福气的.

sentence.English: Every one that does sin does alos lawlessness;and sin is lawlessness.
sentence.Chinese: 凡犯罪的，就是违背律法，违背律法就是罪。

sentence.English: Every shoe fits not every foot.
sentence.Chinese: 不可只用一种尺度衡量一切。

sentence.English: Every time I close the door on reality, it comes in through the window.
sentence.Chinese: 我每次闭门不纳现实，它都从窗口进来。

sentence.English: Every tub must stand on its own bottom.
sentence.Chinese: 人须自立.

sentence.English: Every white has its black,and sweet its sour.
sentence.Chinese: 月白必有黑，有甜必有苦。

sentence.English: Every why has a wherefore.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事必有因.

sentence.English: Everybody is ignorant, only on different subjects.
sentence.Chinese: 所有的人都是无知的,只是对不同的题材无知而已.

sentence.English: Everybody's business is nobody's business.
sentence.Chinese: 人人负责,无人负责. /龙多四靠.

sentence.English: Everyone is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day. Wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人每天至少有五分钟是个大傻瓜，明智者在于不超过这个时限。

sentence.English: Everyone must die; let me but leave a loyal heart shining in the pages of history.
sentence.Chinese: 人生自古谁无死,留取丹心照汗青.

sentence.English: Everything can be bought except time.
sentence.Chinese: 什么都能买,唯有时间买不到.

sentence.English: Everything comes to him who waits.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事要肯等待; 久等必有一得.

sentence.English: Everything is good for something.
sentence.Chinese: 每物必有其用.

sentence.English: Everything must have a beginning.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事必有始.

sentence.English: Everything ought to be beautiful in a human being:face,and dress,and soul,and ideas.
sentence.Chinese: 人的一切----面貌,衣着,心灵和思想,都应该是美好的.

sentence.English: Evil communications corrupt good manners.
sentence.Chinese: 与坏人交往，好人也变坏。 / 近朱者赤，近墨者黑。

sentence.English: Example is better than precept.
sentence.Chinese: 身教胜于言教.

sentence.English: Experience is the father of wisdom and memory the mother.
sentence.Chinese: 经验是知识之父,记忆是知识之母.

sentence.English: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
sentence.Chinese: 人人都把自己的错误美其名为经验。

sentence.English: Experience is the teacher of fools.
sentence.Chinese: 经验为愚人之父.

sentence.English: Experience keeps a dear school, but fools learn in no other.
sentence.Chinese: 经验学校学费高,愚人旁处学不到.

sentence.English: Experience keeps no school; she teachs her pupils singly.
sentence.Chinese: 经验不由学校教,亲身实践才得到.

sentence.English: Experience without learning is better than learning without experience.
sentence.Chinese: 有经验而无学问,胜过有学问无而经验.

sentence.English: Extreme heat gives rise to wind;poverty gives rise to a desire for change.
sentence.Chinese: 热极生风，穷则思变。

sentence.English: Extreme right is extreme wrong.
sentence.Chinese: 极端正确即极端错误。/过犹不及。

sentence.English: Extremes meet.
sentence.Chinese: 两极相通，有无相生。

sentence.English: Eyes are as eloquent as lips.
sentence.Chinese: 眼睛会和嘴一样说话.

sentence.English: Face the fearful with no fears, and its fearfulness dissapears.
sentence.Chinese: 见怪不怪，其怪自败。

sentence.English: Facts are stubborn things.
sentence.Chinese: 事实都是顽强的. /事实是掩盖不住的.

sentence.English: Failure is the mother of success.
sentence.Chinese: 失败乃成功之母.

sentence.English: Failure is the only high road to success.
sentence.Chinese: 失败是通往成功的唯一康庄大道.

sentence.English: Failure teaches success.
sentence.Chinese: 失败乃成功之母.

sentence.English: Fair and softly goes far.
sentence.Chinese: 谦和者致远。

sentence.English: Fair and softly to far in a day.
sentence.Chinese: 从容不慌,办事顺当.

sentence.English: Fair play's a jewel.
sentence.Chinese: 比赛风格好,胜过珠宝.

sentence.English: Fair words fill not the belly.
sentence.Chinese: 甜言蜜语填不饱肚子。

sentence.English: Fair words make fools fain [=pleased].
sentence.Chinese: 甜言蜜语会使愚者得意忘形。

sentence.English: Faith is like the radar that sees through the fog-the reality of things at a distance that the human eye cannot see.
sentence.Chinese: 信仰象透视迷雾的雷达,能够洞悉肉眼难辨的远景.

sentence.English: Fall not out with a friend for a trifle.
sentence.Chinese: 别为小事与朋友争吵.

sentence.English: False friends are worse than open enemise.
sentence.Chinese: 口是心非的朋友比公开的敌人更坏.

sentence.English: False with one can be false with two.
sentence.Chinese: 能对一个人虚伪，就能对两个人奸诈。

sentence.English: Falsehood like a nettle stings those who meddle with it.
sentence.Chinese: 谎言似荨麻，谁玩谁被扎。

sentence.English: Fame is but the breath of the people.
sentence.Chinese: 名誉不过是众人口中的一句话而已.

sentence.English: Fame is the chastisement of merit and the punishment of talent.
sentence.Chinese: 盛名殊誉乃德才之忌.

sentence.English: Fame like a river is narroest at its source and broadest afar off.
sentence.Chinese: 名誉象条河,源头最狭窄,愈流愈宽阔.

sentence.English: Fame usually comes to those who are thinking about something else.
sentence.Chinese: 通常是没想到成名的人反而成了名。

sentence.English: Familiarity breeds contempt.
sentence.Chinese: 亲密生侮心。

sentence.English: Far fowls have fair feathers.
sentence.Chinese: 远方的鸟羽毛美。/弄不到手的东西是最好的。

sentence.English: Fat sorrow is better than lean sorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 富而有愁总强似穷愁无计.

sentence.English: Fate leads the willing but drives the stubborn.
sentence.Chinese: 顺从者被命运领着走，执拗者被命运赶着走。

sentence.English: Faults are thick where love is thin.
sentence.Chinese: 一朝情义淡,样样不顺眼.

sentence.English: Fear has many eyes and can see things underground.
sentence.Chinese: 恐惧有许多眼睛，能看见地下的事物。

sentence.English: Fear not that the life shall come to an end,but rather fear that it shall never have a beginning.
sentence.Chinese: 不要害怕你的生活将要结束,应该担心你的生活永远不会真正开始.

sentence.English: Fearless courage is the foundation of victory.
sentence.Chinese: 勇敢无畏是胜利的基础.
