sentence.English: Feed by measure and defy the physician.
sentence.Chinese: 饮食有节，医生失业。

sentence.English: Few rich men own their property.The property owns them.
sentence.Chinese: 没有多少富人拥有他们的财产;是财产拥有他们.

sentence.English: Fields have eyes,and woods have ears.
sentence.Chinese: 地有眼，树有耳。/ 没有不透风的墙。

sentence.English: Fierce-browed, I coolly defy a thousand pointing fingers; head bowed,like a willing ox I serve the children.
sentence.Chinese: 横眉冷对千夫指,俯首甘为孺子牛.

sentence.English: Fine feathers make fine birds.
sentence.Chinese: 好的衣装只能打扮出个好外表。

sentence.English: Fine words butter no parsnips.
sentence.Chinese: 花言巧语没有用.

sentence.English: Fire is the test of gold, adversity of friendship.
sentence.Chinese: 烈火试真金,苦难试友情.

sentence.English: First catch your hare,than cook him.
sentence.Chinese: 先得兔而后烹之. /到手东西才算数.

sentence.English: First deserve and then desire.
sentence.Chinese: 先做到受之无愧，而后再邀功请赏。

sentence.English: First impressions are most lasting.
sentence.Chinese: 最初的印象最难忘

sentence.English: First think, then speak.
sentence.Chinese: 熟思而后言.

sentence.English: First thrive and then wive.
sentence.Chinese: 先立业,后成家.

sentence.English: Five hours sleepeth a traveller, seven a scholar, eight a merchant, and eleven every knave.
sentence.Chinese: 旅行者睡五小时,学者睡七小时,商人睡八小时,穷汉睡十一小时.

sentence.English: Folk rhymes are the mirrors that show the feelings of the people.
sentence.Chinese: 民谣是人心的镜子。

sentence.English: Follow love and it will flee,Flee love and it will follow thee.
sentence.Chinese: 求爱爱避开,躲爱被爱缠.

sentence.English: Follow the river and you'll get to the sea.
sentence.Chinese: 沿着河走, 一定能走到海边.

sentence.English: Fool's haste is no speed.
sentence.Chinese: 急急忙忙, 欲速反慢.

sentence.English: Fools learn nothing from wise men,but wise men learn much form fools.
sentence.Chinese: 傻瓜从聪明人那儿什么也学不到,而聪明人却能从傻瓜那儿学到不少东西.

sentence.English: Fools look to tomorrow,and wise men use tonight.
sentence.Chinese: 蠢人指望明天,智者利用今晚.

sentence.English: Fools never know when they are well off.
sentence.Chinese: 愚人总是身在福中不知福。

sentence.English: Footprints on the sands of time are not made by sitting down.
sentence.Chinese: 千古之业非坐守可得.

sentence.English: For a lost thing care nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 物已丢失，勿再烦恼。

sentence.English: For a man to become a poet he must be in love, or miserable.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人要恋爱或潦倒才可成为诗人。

sentence.English: For a modest man,achievements serve as a vaulting-pole, with which he surmounts a new height in his future endeavour; for a conceited man,achievements serve as a slide,along which he falls far behind in his self-complancency.
sentence.Chinese: 成绩——是谦虚者的撑杆，促使他在新的努力中，跃进更高的境界。 成绩——是骄傲者的滑梯，使他在沾沾自喜中，跌倒到最后面。

sentence.English: For a morning rain leave not your journey
sentence.Chinese: 不要因为早晨下了一场雨就不去旅行。

sentence.English: For age and want,save while you may! No burning sun lasts a whole day.
sentence.Chinese: 幼时防老，有时防无；朝阳虽好，难以终日。

sentence.English: For every able person there is always one still abler.
sentence.Chinese: 能人背后有能人.

sentence.English: For every evil under the sun, There is a remedy or there is none; If there be one, try and find it; If there be none,never mind it.
sentence.Chinese: 世间的一切弊病， 有的可以救药，有的不可救药；有救药，努力去找；无救药，就别放在心上。

sentence.English: For every one that does ill hates the light,and comes not to the light,lest his works should be reproved.
sentence.Chinese: 凡作恶 的便恨光并躲避光，唯恐他的行为受到责备。

sentence.English: For man is man and master of his fate.
sentence.Chinese: 人就是人,是自己命运的主人.

sentence.English: For one good deed a hundred ill deeds should be overlooked.
sentence.Chinese: 一善足以消百恶。

sentence.English: Forbidden fruit is sweet.
sentence.Chinese: 禁果分外甜。

sentence.English: Force can never destroy right.
sentence.Chinese: 武力决不能摧毁正义。

sentence.English: Forewarned is forearmed.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事预则立。

sentence.English: Forgive and forget.
sentence.Chinese: 恢弘大度，勿念旧恶。

sentence.English: Forgiving and being forgiven are two names for the same thing. The important thing is that a discord has been resolved.
sentence.Chinese: 饶恕人和被饶恕是同一件事的两面.重要的是嫌隙得到冰释.

sentence.English: Fortune and misfortune are two baskets in a well.
sentence.Chinese: 福与祸是一个井里打水的两个吊桶。

sentence.English: Fortune favours the bold.
sentence.Chinese: 天助勇者。

sentence.English: Fortune favours the brave.
sentence.Chinese: 天佑勇士。

sentence.English: Fortune is easily found,but hard to be kept.
sentence.Chinese: 找到福分易，保持福分难。

sentence.English: Fortune is good to him who knows to make good use of her.
sentence.Chinese: 知道用福的人才有福。

sentence.English: Fortune knocks at every man's door once in a life, but in a good many cases, the man is in a neighboring saloon and does not hear her.
sentence.Chinese: 每个人的一生中，幸运女神都来敲过门，可是，许多人竟在隔壁的酒馆里，听 不见她的敲门。

sentence.English: Fortune knocks once at least at every man's gate.
sentence.Chinese: 幸运之神至少在每人的门上敲一次.

sentence.English: Fortune never helps the man whose courage fails.
sentence.Chinese: 运气永远不会帮助没有勇气的人.

sentence.English: Four eyes see more than two.
sentence.Chinese: 两人总比一人看得周到.

sentence.English: Freedom is the right to be wrong, not the right to do wrong.
sentence.Chinese: 自由是无意而犯错误的权利，而不是故意做错事的权利。

sentence.English: Freedom lies in being bold.
sentence.Chinese: 自由在于勇敢.

sentence.English: Friends are like fiddle-strings, they must not be screwed too tight.
sentence.Chinese: 琴弦不可太紧,朋友不可太亲.

sentence.English: Friends are thieves of time.
sentence.Chinese: 朋友是时间的浪费者. / 浪费朋友的时间,就是谋财害命.

sentence.English: Friends may meet, but mountains never greet.
sentence.Chinese: 山与山不会点头,人与人却能交友.

sentence.English: Friends that desert us in the hour of need are friends in name,not in reality.
sentence.Chinese: 在困难时刻背弃我们的是有名无实的朋友.

sentence.English: Friends tie their purses with a cobweb thread.
sentence.Chinese: 朋友之间,不应扎紧钱袋.

sentence.English: Friendship is a plant which must be often watered.
sentence.Chinese: 友谊之树要常浇水.

sentence.English: Friendship is like wine---the older the better.
sentence.Chinese: 友谊象美酒,越陈越醇厚.

sentence.English: Friendship is to be strengthened by truth and devotion.
sentence.Chinese: 友谊要以真实和忠诚来巩固.

sentence.English: Friendship is, at any rate, a relation of perfect equality.
sentence.Chinese: 友谊无论如何都是一种完全平等的关系.

sentence.English: Friendship multiply joys, and divide griefs.
sentence.Chinese: 友谊能添乐,也能分忧.

sentence.English: From a choleric man withdraw a little; form him that says nothing,for ever.
sentence.Chinese: 同易动气的人离远点；同不开口的人别打交道。

sentence.English: From saving comes having.
sentence.Chinese: 富有来自节俭.

sentence.English: From small profits and many expenses comes whole life of sad consequences.
sentence.Chinese: 嫌得少,花得多,一世日子不好过.

sentence.English: From the ravening monster's jaw,should the diver pause and gasp, he'd never hold the precious pearl,the bright pearl, in his grasp.
sentence.Chinese: 采珠人如果被海中怪物吓住,怎能得到宝贵的珍珠.

sentence.English: From words to deeds is a good space.
sentence.Chinese: 从言到行,相距甚远.

sentence.English: Gather ye rosebuds while ye may.
sentence.Chinese: 有花堪折直须折,莫待花无空折枝.

sentence.English: Gear is easier gained than guided.
sentence.Chinese: 生财容易理财难.

sentence.English: Genius formed in quiet, character in the stream of life.
sentence.Chinese: 天才形成于平静中,性格来自于生活的激流.

sentence.English: Genius is one per cent inspiration and ninety nine per cent perspiration.
sentence.Chinese: 天才是百分之一的天赋加上百分之九十九的勤奋.

sentence.English: Genius is the ability to put into effect what is in your mind.
sentence.Chinese: 天才是将心里想到的东西付诸实施的能力.

sentence.English: Genius is the gold in the mine; talent is the miner who works and brings it out.
sentence.Chinese: 天赋是埋藏在矿里的黄金;才能是挖掘矿藏的矿工.

sentence.English: Genius only means hard-working all one's life.
sentence.Chinese: 天才只意味着终生不懈的努力.

sentence.English: Gentility is but ancient riches.
sentence.Chinese: 出身高贵，只不过是其祖辈有钱。

sentence.English: Gifts from enemies are dangerous.
sentence.Chinese: 敌人的礼物收不得。

sentence.English: Give a dog a bad name and hang him.
sentence.Chinese: 一旦加入以恶名，他永远洗刷不清。

sentence.English: Give a lie twenty-four hours start,and you can never overtake it.
sentence.Chinese: 让谎言早跑一天，你就别想追上。

sentence.English: Give a thief enough rope and he'll hang himfelf.
sentence.Chinese: 多行不义必自毙。

sentence.English: Give bairn his will,and a whelp his fill,and none of these two will thrive.
sentence.Chinese: 纵容溺爱，子不成材。

sentence.English: Give credit where credit is due.
sentence.Chinese: 有功则赏。

sentence.English: Give losers leave to speak.
sentence.Chinese: 要允许失败者讲话。

sentence.English: Give me a child for the first seven years and you may do what you like with him afterwards.
sentence.Chinese: 让我把小孩带到七岁，以后随你怎么都可以。

sentence.English: Give me liberty or give me death.
sentence.Chinese: 不自由,毋宁死.

sentence.English: Give me the benefit of your convictions. if you have any; but keep your doubts to yourself. for I have enough of my own.
sentence.Chinese: 如果你有什么信念,请和我分享;但请保留你的疑惑,因为我自己的疑惑已经够多了.

sentence.English: Give us the tools, and we will finish the job.
sentence.Chinese: 给我们适当的工具,我们就能完成任何工作./ 干什么活使什么家伙.

sentence.English: Giving much to the poor doth increase a man's store.
sentence.Chinese: 给穷人大量馈赠必定会增加自己的库存。

sentence.English: Glasses and lasses are brittle ware.
sentence.Chinese: 玻璃易碎，姑娘易毁。

sentence.English: Glory is the shadow of virtue.
sentence.Chinese: 荣誉是美德的影子.

sentence.English: Gluttony kills more than the sword.
sentence.Chinese: 暴食比刀剑伤人。

sentence.English: Go not for every grief to the physician,for every quarrel to the lawyer, nor for every thirst to the pot.
sentence.Chinese: 不要一有病痛就求医，一有争吵就请律师，稍觉口渴就找水壶。

sentence.English: Go to bed with the lamb, and rise with the lark.
sentence.Chinese: 日出而作,日入而息.

sentence.English: Goals determine what you are going to be.
sentence.Chinese: 目标决定你将成为什么样的人.

sentence.English: God defend me from my friends, from my enemies I can defend myself.
sentence.Chinese: 愿上帝助我防备朋友，我自己能抵御敌人。

sentence.English: God gives the milk, but not the pail.
sentence.Chinese: 上帝赐牛奶,桶要自己买.

sentence.English: God help the poor, for the rich can help themselves.
sentence.Chinese: 愿上帝帮助穷人，因为富人无需帮助。

sentence.English: God made the country; man made the town.
sentence.Chinese: 上帝创造了乡村，人类建造了城镇。

sentence.English: God send me a friend that may tell me of my faults; if not, an enemy, and he will.
sentence.Chinese: 愿上帝赐给我一个能指出我的过错的朋友;要不,赐给我敌人,敌人准会挑错.

sentence.English: Gold does not belong to the miser,but the miser to gold.
sentence.Chinese: 财富并不属于守财奴，而是守财奴属于财富。

sentence.English: Good acts are better than good intentions.
sentence.Chinese: 好的行动胜过好的意向.

sentence.English: Good advice is beyond price.
sentence.Chinese: 忠告是无价之宝.

sentence.English: Good art is not what it looks like,but what it does to us .
sentence.Chinese: 好的艺术不在于它象什么，而在于它引起我们什么感受。

sentence.English: Good clothes open all doors.
sentence.Chinese: 门不挡衣着华丽的人。

sentence.English: Good company on the road is the shortest cut.
sentence.Chinese: 良伴同行路不遥.

sentence.English: Good counsel does no harm.
sentence.Chinese: 忠言有利无害。

sentence.English: Good is good, but better carries it.
sentence.Chinese: 精益求精,善益求善.

sentence.English: Good masters make good servants.
sentence.Chinese: 主人好，仆人坏不了。

sentence.English: Good order is the foundation of all things.
sentence.Chinese: 良好的秩序是一切的基础。

sentence.English: Good riding at two anchors,men have told. For if one breaks the other may hold.
sentence.Chinese: 停泊要抛两只锚, 断了一只船不漂.

sentence.English: Good steel should be used for the making of the sword's cutting edge.
sentence.Chinese: 好钢要用在刀刃上.

sentence.English: Good take-heed doth surely speed.
sentence.Chinese: 谨慎是成功的保证。

sentence.English: Good temper is like a sunny day; it sheds its brightness everywhere.
sentence.Chinese: 好情绪犹如明媚的阳光，普照四方。

sentence.English: Good things are worth waiting for.
sentence.Chinese: 好事值得等待。

sentence.English: Good ware makes quick markets.
sentence.Chinese: 货好销得快。

sentence.English: Good watch prevents misfortune.
sentence.Chinese: 谨慎小心就不会遇到灾祸。

sentence.English: Good will be rewarded with good, and evil with evil; if the reward is not forthcoming, it is because the time has not arrived yet; and when the time arrives, one will get all the rewards he deserves.
sentence.Chinese: 善有善报，恶有恶报，不是不报，时候未到，时候一到，一切都报。

sentence.English: Good will should be taken for part payment.
sentence.Chinese: 善意应该被看作是部分报偿。

sentence.English: Good wine needs no bush.
sentence.Chinese: 酒好无需挂幌子。

sentence.English: Goods are theirs who enjoy them.
sentence.Chinese: 爱物者有物用.

sentence.English: Gossip is that which no one claims to like-but everybody enjoys.
sentence.Chinese: 没人自称喜欢听闲话，可是闲话人人都爱听。

sentence.English: Gossiping and lying go hand in hand.
sentence.Chinese: 流言蜚语和谎言总是连一起。

sentence.English: Grasp all, lose all.
sentence.Chinese: 贪多必失.

sentence.English: Grasp the nettle and it won't sting you.
sentence.Chinese: 大胆抓荆棘,荆棘不刺手. /你不怕困难,困难就怕你.

sentence.English: Gratitude is the least of virtues; ingratitude the worst of vices.
sentence.Chinese: 感恩是小德；忘恩是大恶。

sentence.English: Gratitude is the sign of noble souls.
sentence.Chinese: 感恩是精神高尚的标志.

sentence.English: Gratitude takes three forms—a feeling in the heart, an expression in words, and giving in return.
sentence.Chinese: 感恩有三种形式：藏在心里，说在嘴上，见于行动。

sentence.English: Great ideas need landing gear as well as wings.
sentence.Chinese: 伟大的思想需要起落架，也需要双翼。

sentence.English: Great men are rarely isolated mountainpeaks; they are the summits of ranges.
sentence.Chinese: 伟人很少是突 兀的山峰;他们是众山中的最高峰.

sentence.English: Great men's sons soldom do well.
sentence.Chinese: 伟人的儿子有出息的不多。

sentence.English: Great minds think alike.
sentence.Chinese: 英雄所见略同。

sentence.English: Great trees keep down little ones.
sentence.Chinese: 大树底下，小树难长。

sentence.English: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
sentence.Chinese: 大业成于百折不挠,不论力量大小.

sentence.English: Habit is habit,and not to be flung out of the window by any man,but coaxed downstairs a step at a time.
sentence.Chinese: 习惯就是习惯，谁也不能将其扔出窗外，只能一步一步地引它下楼。

sentence.English: Habit is the fly-wheel of civilization.
sentence.Chinese: 习惯是文明的飞轮。

sentence.English: Habour no ill intention against others, but never relax vigilance against evil-doers.
sentence.Chinese: 害人之心不可有，防人之心不可无。

sentence.English: Half a tale is enough for a wise man.
sentence.Chinese: 智者一说就领会. /响鼓不用重棰敲.

sentence.English: Half the pleasure of life consists of the opportunities one has neglected.
sentence.Chinese: 生活的一半乐趣由一切被忽略掉的机遇 组成.

sentence.English: Handsomee is that handsome does.
sentence.Chinese: 心美貌亦美.

sentence.English: Happiness is a butterfly,which, when pursued, is always just beyond your grasp,but which, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
sentence.Chinese: 幸福有如蝴蝶，你追逐它时永远捉不到，你静坐下来，它却可能落在你身上。

sentence.English: Happiness is a form of courage.
sentence.Chinese: 幸福是勇气的一种形式。

sentence.English: Happiness is a way station between too much and too little.
sentence.Chinese: 幸福是太多和太少之间的一站.

sentence.English: Happiness is being married to your best friend.
sentence.Chinese: 同自己最好的朋友结婚是谓幸福.

sentence.English: Happiness is not a goal,it is a by-product.
sentence.Chinese: 幸福不是目的,而是一种副产品.

sentence.English: Happiness is not always annexed to wealth.
sentence.Chinese: 幸福并不一定是财富的附属物。

sentence.English: Happiness is the interval between periods of unhappiness.
sentence.Chinese: 幸福是两段不幸福时期之间的间歇.

sentence.English: Happiness lies first of all in health.
sentence.Chinese: 幸福首先在于健康。

sentence.English: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.
sentence.Chinese: 快乐往往从你忘记关好的门溜进来。

sentence.English: Happiness, I have discovered, is nearly always a rebound from hard work.
sentence.Chinese: 我发现,辛勤工作的报酬几乎总是幸福.

sentence.English: Happy is he who only desires what he may and does what he ought.
sentence.Chinese: 不作非分之想又能尽本分的人是快乐的。

sentence.English: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.
sentence.Chinese: 求知者快乐，被理解者幸福。

sentence.English: Happy is the man who learns from the misfortunes of others.
sentence.Chinese: 吸取别人教训，自然就会走运。

sentence.English: Hardship disposes man to meet adversity.
sentence.Chinese: 艰苦的生活使人能面对逆境。

sentence.English: Haste and wisdom are things far odd.
sentence.Chinese: 轻率与智慧相距遥远。

sentence.English: Haste trips over its own heels.
sentence.Chinese: 匆忙会被自己的脚后跟绊倒. /忙中有错.

sentence.English: Have a horse of thine own and thou mayest borrow another.
sentence.Chinese: 自己有马后,才可向别人借马.

sentence.English: Have an aim in life,or your energies will all be wasted.
sentence.Chinese: 人生应该树立目标,否则你的精力会白白浪费.

sentence.English: Have but few friends, though many acquaintances.
sentence.Chinese: 交游宜广,知心宜稀.

sentence.English: Have high aspirations and adopt a practical attitude.
sentence.Chinese: 既要有雄心壮志,也要有实事求是的精神.

sentence.English: Have no fear of perfection---you'll never reach it.
sentence.Chinese: 不要为十全十美担心----你永远也做不到十全十美.

sentence.English: Having half-baked knowledge is worse than knowing nothing at all.
sentence.Chinese: 一知半解,不如不知不解.

sentence.English: He best can pity who has felt the woe.
sentence.Chinese: 曾历忧伤者方知怜悯他人.

sentence.English: He commands enough that obeys a wise man.
sentence.Chinese: 听从智者意见的人无需多问别人.

sentence.English: He dances well to whom fortune pipes.
sentence.Chinese: 运来事事顺.

sentence.English: He deserves not the sweet that will not taste the sour. He dwells far from neighbours that is fain to praise himself.
sentence.Chinese: 不愿吃苦的人，不配享乐；爱炫耀自己的人，没有人愿与他为邻。

sentence.English: He devoted himself entirely to the service off the people until his death./Give one's all till one's heart stops beating.
sentence.Chinese: 鞠躬尽瘁,死而后已.

sentence.English: He give twice who gives quickly.
sentence.Chinese: 给得爽快，等于给了两次。

sentence.English: He gives twice who gives quickly.
sentence.Chinese: 及时帮助效益大.

sentence.English: He goes far that never turns.
sentence.Chinese: 不回头的人走得远.

sentence.English: He has a fault of a wife that marries mam's pet.
sentence.Chinese: 娶娇惯的姑娘是找错了对象.

sentence.English: He has not lost all who has one card left.
sentence.Chinese: 手里还有一张牌就没有输尽.

sentence.English: He hath ill neighbours that is fain to praise himself.
sentence.Chinese: 爱自夸的人没有好邻居。

sentence.English: He is a good physician who cures himself.
sentence.Chinese: 能给自己看病的才是好医生。

sentence.English: He is an ill guest that never drinks to his host.
sentence.Chinese: 不知道为主人干杯的客人，不会作客。

sentence.English: He is born in a good hour who gets a good name.
sentence.Chinese: 生逢其时,美誉自至.

sentence.English: He is eloquent enough for whom truth speaks.
sentence.Chinese: 事实本身就是雄辩. /掌握了真理,就是雄辩者.

sentence.English: He is happy that thinks himself so.
sentence.Chinese: 自乐者常乐。

sentence.English: He is lifeless that is faultless.
sentence.Chinese: 只有死人才无错误。 /人孰无过。

sentence.English: He is most free from danger, who even when safe,is on guard.
sentence.Chinese: 居安思危者最平安.

sentence.English: He is not a wise man who cannot play the fool on occasion.
sentence.Chinese: 不会偶尔装傻的人算不得聪明.

sentence.English: He is not fit to command others that cannot command himself.
sentence.Chinese: 不能指挥自己，就不能指挥别人。

sentence.English: He is not laughed at that laughs at himself first.
sentence.Chinese: 先自嘲的人，不会见笑于人。

sentence.English: He is not to be subdued by force nor swerved by poverty.
sentence.Chinese: 威武不能屈,贫贱不能移.

sentence.English: He is not wise that is not wise for himself.
sentence.Chinese: 没有自知之明的人算不得聪明.

sentence.English: He is only bright that shines by himself.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的漂亮靠自身的光彩.

sentence.English: He is rich that has few wants.
sentence.Chinese: 寡欲者富。

sentence.English: He is the best general who makes the fewest mistakes.
sentence.Chinese: 错误犯得最少的将军就是最好的将军.

sentence.English: He is unworthy to live who lives only for himself.
sentence.Chinese: 只为自己活着的人,不值得活在世上.

sentence.English: He is wise that is ware in time.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明人防患于未然。

sentence.English: He is wise that knows when he is well enough.
sentence.Chinese: 知足为智者。

sentence.English: He keeps putting off till tomorrow, for he thinks another tomorrow follows tomorrow; he keeps waiting day after day, and surely no achievement he can make.
sentence.Chinese: 明日复明日,明日何其多; 我生待明日, 万事成蹉跎.

sentence.English: He knows much who knows how to hold his tongue.
sentence.Chinese: 慎言为智。

sentence.English: He knows not what love is that has no children.
sentence.Chinese: 没有子女的人不知道什么是爱.

sentence.English: He knows the water the best who has waded through it.
sentence.Chinese: 要知水深浅,须问过河人.

sentence.English: He laughs best who laughs last.
sentence.Chinese: 谁笑在最后,谁笑得最好.

sentence.English: He lives long that lives well.
sentence.Chinese: 活得好等于活得久.

sentence.English: He lives unsafely that looks too near on things.
sentence.Chinese: 人无远虑,必有近忧.

sentence.English: He may freely receive courtesies that knows how to requite them.
sentence.Chinese: 知道如何还礼的人才可随意收礼.

sentence.English: He must have iron nails that scratches a bear.
sentence.Chinese: 搔熊者必具铁爪. / 要干危险事,先得有本事.

sentence.English: He that believes all, misseth; he that believes nothing,hits not.
sentence.Chinese: 全信必有所失，全不信一无所得。

sentence.English: He that boasts of his knowledge proclaims his ignorance.
sentence.Chinese: 吹嘘自己的知识的人,等于宣扬他自己的无知.

sentence.English: He that can read and meditate will not find his evenings long or life tedious.
sentence.Chinese: 会读书思索的人不会感到长夜无聊或者生活乏味.

sentence.English: He that cannot obey cannot command.
sentence.Chinese: 不服从命令者不能指挥。

sentence.English: He that desires honour is not worthy of honour.
sentence.Chinese: 渴求荣誉的人不值得有荣誉。

sentence.English: He that doth most at once doth least.
sentence.Chinese: 越想一次做完最多,越是做得最少. /欲速则不达.

sentence.English: He that doth nothing doth ever amiss.
sentence.Chinese: 什么都不做,本身就是错.

sentence.English: He that eats till he is sick must fast till he is well.
sentence.Chinese: 吃出病来的人，反而要饿到病好才能再吃。

sentence.English: He that falls today may rise tomorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 今天跌倒的人,明天可能会站起来.

sentence.English: He that fears death lives not.
sentence.Chinese: 害怕死亡的人，活着也没有快乐。

sentence.English: He that fights and runs away may live to fight another day.
sentence.Chinese: 会战斗会退却的人,才有可能保存自己,他日再战.

sentence.English: He that gains time gains all things.
sentence.Chinese: 赢得时间就赢得了一切.

sentence.English: He that gains well and spends well needs no account book.
sentence.Chinese: 挣得多花得恰当的人用不着帐本.

sentence.English: He that goeth far hath many encounters.
sentence.Chinese: 走得远,见得多.

sentence.English: He that has a great nose thinks everybody is speaking of it.
sentence.Chinese: 鼻子长得大，总怕有人说。/ 做贼心虚。

sentence.English: He that has much prayer, has but little devotion.
sentence.Chinese: 祷告多的人心不诚。

sentence.English: He that has patience may compass anything.
sentence.Chinese: 有耐心的人事事做得到。

sentence.English: He that hears much and speaks not a all. shall be welcome both in bower and hall.
sentence.Chinese: 多听不多言，里外人不嫌。

sentence.English: He that is a master must serve.
sentence.Chinese: 一家之主必为全家操劳.

sentence.English: He that is angry without a cause, must be pleased without amends.
sentence.Chinese: 不要给无故生气的人赔不是。

sentence.English: He that is foolish in the fault, let him be wise in the punishment.
sentence.Chinese: 因愚蠢而犯错误的人，应使受惩罚而聪明起来。

sentence.English: He that is full of himself is very empty.
sentence.Chinese: 人若十分自恃,必定十分无知.

sentence.English: He that is ill to himself will be good to nobody.
sentence.Chinese: 不能自爱，焉能爱人。

sentence.English: He that is master of himself will soon be master of others.
sentence.Chinese: 能自制者方能制人.

sentence.English: He that is not handsome at twenty, nor strong at thirty, nor rich at forty, nor wise at fifty,will never be handsome, strong, rich, or wise.
sentence.Chinese: 二十不俊一生丑,三十不强一生弱,四十不富一生穷,五十不智一生愚.

sentence.English: He that labours and thrives spins gold.
sentence.Chinese: 劳动聚财如聚金.

sentence.English: He that leaves a name behind him does not die.
sentence.Chinese: 身后留名的人万世永存.

sentence.English: He that lies down with dogs must rise up with fleas.
sentence.Chinese: 与狗同卧,跳蚤上身. /近朱者赤,近墨者黑.

sentence.English: He that lives in hope danceth without music.
sentence.Chinese: 生活在希望中的人,没有音乐照样跳舞.

sentence.English: He that loseth his due gets not thanks.
sentence.Chinese: 失去应得的东西，别人不感谢。

sentence.English: He that makes a good war makes a good peace.
sentence.Chinese: 正义的战争创造持久的和平。

sentence.English: He that makes a thing too fine, breaks it.
sentence.Chinese: 做事过于苟求，反把事情弄坏。

sentence.English: He that makes himself a sheep shall be eaten by the”wolf”.
sentence.Chinese: 甘为羔羊，定膏狼吻。

sentence.English: He that mischie hatches, mischief catches.
sentence.Chinese: 害人者终将害己。

sentence.English: He that never climbed,never fell.
sentence.Chinese: 只有从不攀登的人才不会跌交.

sentence.English: He that plants trees loves others besides himself.
sentence.Chinese: 植树的人,不但爱已,而且爱人.

sentence.English: He that praiseth himself spattereth himself.
sentence.Chinese: 自我标榜，等于自我诽谤。

sentence.English: He that promises too much means nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 许诺过多等于零。

sentence.English: He that puts on a public gown must put off a private person.
sentence.Chinese: 担任公职的人，就要不徇私情。

sentence.English: He that regards not a penny, will lavish a pound.
sentence.Chinese: 小钱不节省,大钱必乱花.

sentence.English: He that respects not is not respected.
sentence.Chinese: 你不敬人,人不敬你.

sentence.English: He that returns good for evil obtains the victory.
sentence.Chinese: 胜利属于以善报恶的人.

sentence.English: He that runs fastest gets the ring.
sentence.Chinese: 谁跑得快谁得奖. /捷足者先登.

sentence.English: He that saveth his dinner will have the more for his supper.
sentence.Chinese: 午餐节省,晚餐丰盛.

sentence.English: He that serves well need not be afraid to ask his wages.
sentence.Chinese: 只要工作干得好,理直气壮把报酬要.

sentence.English: He that shoots oft shall at last hit the mark.
sentence.Chinese: 常练射击的人,总会命中靶子. /功到自然成.

sentence.English: He that shows his purse longs to be rid of it.
sentence.Chinese: 夸财招祸.

sentence.English: He that spares th bad injures the good.
sentence.Chinese: 纵容坏人必伤害好人。

sentence.English: He that speaks me fair and loves me not, I'll speak him fair and trust him not.
sentence.Chinese: 讲我好话而不真心爱我的人,我用好话回敬,但不予以信任.

sentence.English: He that speaks sows, and he that holds his peace gathers.
sentence.Chinese: 滔滔不绝者播下种子，闭口不言者收割庄稼。

sentence.English: He that stumbles and falls not mends his pace.
sentence.Chinese: 绊了一脚而未跌倒的人,一定会走得更快.

sentence.English: He that talks much errs much.
sentence.Chinese: 语多必失。

sentence.English: He that talks much lies much.
sentence.Chinese: 言多必妄。

sentence.English: He that tells a secret is another's servant.
sentence.Chinese: 泄漏机密的人，就成为别人的奴仆。

sentence.English: He that thinks too much of his virtues bids others think of his vice.
sentence.Chinese: 念念不忘自己长处的人，使别人想起他的缺点。

sentence.English: He that travels far knows much.
sentence.Chinese: 广游者,见识多.

sentence.English: He that wiill thrive must rise at five.
sentence.Chinese: 五点起床,家业兴旺.

sentence.English: He that will thrive must ask leave of his wife.
sentence.Chinese: 要想发家致富,就得妻子同意.

sentence.English: He that would be well needs not go from his own house.
sentence.Chinese: 要找幸福,不必离家远寻.

sentence.English: He that would eat the fruit must climb the tree.
sentence.Chinese: 想吃果子就得上树.

sentence.English: He that would eat the kernel must crack the nut.
sentence.Chinese: 欲食果仁先破其壳.

sentence.English: He that would govern others. first should be the master of himself.
sentence.Chinese: 要管好别人，先管好自己。

sentence.English: He that would have eggs must endure the cackling of hens.
sentence.Chinese: 想吃鸡蛋就不要讨厌母鸡咯咯叫.

sentence.English: He that wrestles with us strengthens our nerves and sharpens our skill. Our antagonist is our helper.
sentence.Chinese: 和我们搏斗的人增强我们的神经，磨砺我们的技巧。敌手即是助手。

sentence.English: He was a bold man that first ate on oyster.
sentence.Chinese: 第一个吃牡蛎的人是勇士。

sentence.English: He was like a cock who thought the sunhad risen to hear him crow.
sentence.Chinese: 有的人就象公鸡一样，以为太阳因为要听它啼叫才升起。

sentence.English: He who allows himself to be insulted,deserves to be.
sentence.Chinese: 自己甘愿受辱的人，受污辱也活该。

sentence.English: He who buys what he does not want will soon want what he cannot buy.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人常买不想要的东西, 很快会发现他买不起想要的东西.

sentence.English: He who cannot dance puts the blame on the floor.
sentence.Chinese: 不会跳舞的人怪地板不平。

sentence.English: He who commences many things finishes but few.
sentence.Chinese: 样样都搞, 完成者少.

sentence.English: He who does not honour his wife, dishonours himself.
sentence.Chinese: 不尊重自己妻子的人,使自己不受尊重.

sentence.English: He who does not rise early never does a good day's work.
sentence.Chinese: 不愿早起的人，做不好一天的工作。

sentence.English: He who does not work neither shall he eat
sentence.Chinese: 不劳动者不得食.

sentence.English: He who fears to venture as far as his heart urges and reason permits is a coward.
sentence.Chinese: 有道理的事想做而不敢做的人是懦夫。

sentence.English: He who goes against the fashion is himfelf its slave.
sentence.Chinese: 反对时尚的人自己也是时尚的奴隶。

sentence.English: He who has a mind to beat his dog will easily find his stick.
sentence.Chinese: 要想打狗，找棍不难。/欲加之罪，何患无辞。

sentence.English: He who has an art has everywhere a part.
sentence.Chinese: 手艺在手,走遍天下能糊口.

sentence.English: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
sentence.Chinese: 有想象力而无学问的人,等于有翅无脚.

sentence.English: He who has never hoped can never despair.
sentence.Chinese: 从来没有抱过什么希望的人也永远不会失望.

sentence.English: He who has no shame has no conscience.
sentence.Chinese: 不知羞耻的人不知自疚。

sentence.English: He who hath good health is young,and he is rich who owes nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 健康葆青春，无债即富足。

sentence.English: He who hesitates is lost.
sentence.Chinese: 当断不断,反受其乱.

sentence.English: He who is first come is first served.
sentence.Chinese: 先到的先得。

sentence.English: He who is great need not inflate himself.
sentence.Chinese: 伟大的人不需要自吹自擂。

sentence.English: He who is not in charge of governing does not interfere in its business.
sentence.Chinese: 不在其位，不谋其政。

sentence.English: He who knows most knows best how little he knows.
sentence.Chinese: 知识愈多就愈了解自己懂得太少.

sentence.English: He who knows nothing but pretends to know everything,is indeed a good-for-nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 不懂装懂,永世饭桶.

sentence.English: He who knows useful things,not many things is wise.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明人不是懂得多,而是懂得有用的东西.

sentence.English: He who laughs at crooked men should need walk very straight.
sentence.Chinese: 讥笑别人驼背的人，自己先得挺直身子。

sentence.English: He who likes borrowing dislikes paying.
sentence.Chinese: 爱借的人往往不爱还。

sentence.English: He who lives with his memories becomes old. He who lives with plans for the future remains young.
sentence.Chinese: 终日怀旧催人老，计划未来葆青春。

sentence.English: He who mistrusts most should be trusted least.
sentence.Chinese: 最不信任别人的人最不应该得到信任.

sentence.English: He who peeps through a hole may see what will vex him.
sentence.Chinese: 偷窥者会看到使自己烦恼的事。

sentence.English: He who questions nothing learns nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 对什么都不怀疑就什么也学不到.

sentence.English: He who refuses nothing will soon have nothing to refuse.
sentence.Chinese: 对什么都不拒绝的人很快会没有东西可拒绝。

sentence.English: He who says what he likes, shall hear what he does not like.
sentence.Chinese: 想怎么说就怎么说的人早晚会听到他不中意的话。

sentence.English: He who seeks only for applause from without has all his happiness in another's keeping.
sentence.Chinese: 追求别人的赞赏，就是将自己的快乐委诸别人手中。

sentence.English: He who trusts all things to chance makes a lottery of his life.
sentence.Chinese: 一切都指望机会的人使自己的生活变得象赌彩票一样.

sentence.English: He who will not learn when he is young will regret it when he is old.
sentence.Chinese: 少时不学,老来后悔.

sentence.English: He who will not reason,is a bigot;he who cannot is a fool;and he who dares not is a slave.
sentence.Chinese: 不愿说理是偏执者；不会说理是愚人；不敢说理是奴隶。

sentence.English: He who will not when he may, when he will he shall have nay.
sentence.Chinese: 可为时不想为,想为时已不可为.

sentence.English: He who would climb the ladder must begin at the bottom.
sentence.Chinese: 欲登梯者从底始.

sentence.English: He who would search pearls dive below.
sentence.Chinese: 不潜深水则不得珠.

sentence.English: He will shoot higher who shoots at the moon than he who aims at a tree.
sentence.Chinese: 瞄准月亮的人总比瞄准树的人射得高. /目标远大,效果必佳.

sentence.English: He works best who knows his trade.
sentence.Chinese: 万事怕行家.

sentence.English: Health and money go far.
sentence.Chinese: 有了健康和钱财，就能走遍天下。

sentence.English: Health and wealth create beauty.
sentence.Chinese: 健康和财富能创造美丽。

sentence.English: Health is better than wealth./ Good health is above wealth.
sentence.Chinese: 健康胜过财富。

sentence.English: Health is not valued till sickness comes.
sentence.Chinese: 病时方知健康可贵。

sentence.English: Hear much, speak little./ Speak less and listen more.
sentence.Chinese: 少说多听.

sentence.English: Hesitation signifies wavering of will.
sentence.Chinese: 犹豫说明意志的动摇。

sentence.English: Hide not your light under a bushel.
sentence.Chinese: 不要把你的烛光藏在笆斗下。/ 勿过分谦虚，隐藏才能。

sentence.English: Hide nothing from thy physician.
sentence.Chinese: 不要对医生隐瞒。

sentence.English: His bashful mind hinders his good intent.
sentence.Chinese: 害羞使好意无法表现.

sentence.English: Histories make men wise; poets witty; the mathematics subtile; natural philosophy deep; moral grave; logic and rhetoric able to contend.
sentence.Chinese: 读史使人明智,读诗使人灵秀,数学使人周密,科学使人深刻,伦理学使人庄重,逻辑修辞学使人善辨.

sentence.English: History repeats itself.
sentence.Chinese: 历史往往重演。

sentence.English: History tells us that modesty leads to success and conceit, to failure.
sentence.Chinese: 历史告诫我们,谦逊使人成功,骄傲使人失败.

sentence.English: Hitch your wagon to a star.
sentence.Chinese: 把你的马车拴到星星上. /要胸怀大志.

sentence.English: Hold fast when you have it.
sentence.Chinese: 在手之物应紧握.

sentence.English: Home is home,be it never so homely.
sentence.Chinese: 金窝银窝,不如自家的草窝.

sentence.English: Honesty is the best policy.
sentence.Chinese: 诚实为上策.

sentence.English: Honesty may be dear bought, but can never be an ill pennyworth.
sentence.Chinese: 诚实代价高,换来即是宝.

sentence.English: Honour and ease are seldom bedfellows.
sentence.Chinese: 荣誉和舒适难成伴侣。

sentence.English: Honour and profit lie not sack.
sentence.Chinese: 荣誉和私利不能睡在一起。

sentence.English: Honour lies in honest toil.
sentence.Chinese: 光荣在于诚恳地劳动.

sentence.English: Hope and courage are two bright diamonds in the crown of success.
sentence.Chinese: 希望和勇敢是成功之冕上两颗明亮的钻石.

sentence.English: Hope for the best and prepare for the worst.
sentence.Chinese: 抱最好的希望,做最坏的打算.

sentence.English: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.
sentence.Chinese: 希望是美好的早餐,却是糟糕的晚餐.

sentence.English: Hope is a lover's staff.
sentence.Chinese: 希望是爱者的手扶之杖.

sentence.English: Hope is bad for the happy man,and good for the unhappy.
sentence.Chinese: 希望对幸福的人是不好的事,对不幸福的人是好事.

sentence.English: Hope is itself a species of happiness,and perhaps the chief happiness which this world affords.
sentence.Chinese: 希望本身是一种幸福,也许是这个世界能提供的主要的幸福.

sentence.English: Hope is life and life is hope
sentence.Chinese: 希望就是生活,生活也就是希望.

sentence.English: Hope springs eternal in the human breast.
sentence.Chinese: 人生永远满怀希望. /只要有人,就有希望.

sentence.English: Hope well and have well.
sentence.Chinese: 善寄希望于未来,又善保有现在.

sentence.English: Hospitality consists in a little fire, a little food and an immense quiet.
sentence.Chinese: 款客之道不外是一点炉火,一些肴馔和无边的宁静.

sentence.English: Hot love is soon cold.
sentence.Chinese: 过热的爱情冷得快.

sentence.English: Hothouse plants do not possess exuberant vitality.
sentence.Chinese: 温室里的花草不会有强大的生命力.

sentence.English: How can you catch tiger cubs withour entering the tiger's lair?
sentence.Chinese: 不入虎穴,焉得虎子.

sentence.English: How do you understand happiness? ----Struggle.
sentence.Chinese: 你对幸福的理解是什么?-----斗争.

sentence.English: How do you understand misfortune?----Giving in.
sentence.Chinese: 你对不幸的理解是什么?---屈服.

sentence.English: How sharper than a serpent's tooth it is to have a thankless child.
sentence.Chinese: 逆子无情甚于蛇蝎.

sentence.English: Hsitory is bunk.
sentence.Chinese: 历史是一堆废话。

sentence.English: Human pride is human weakness.
sentence.Chinese: 人类的骄傲即是人类的弱点。

sentence.English: Humility is the beginning of wisdom.
sentence.Chinese: 智慧源于谦逊.

sentence.English: Humility often gains more than pride.
sentence.Chinese: 谦逊往往比骄傲获益更多。

sentence.English: Humory has been well defined as ”thinking in fum while feeling in earnest”.
sentence.Chinese: 幽默被人正确地解释为“以诚挚表感受，寓深思于嬉笑。

sentence.English: Humour must have its background of seriousness.
sentence.Chinese: 幽默必须以严肃为背景。

sentence.English: Hunger is the best sauce.
sentence.Chinese: 饥者口中尽佳肴.

sentence.English: Husbands are in heaven whose wives scold not
sentence.Chinese: 妻子不絮烦,丈夫乐无边.

sentence.English: Hypocrisy is a homage that vice pays to virtue.
sentence.Chinese: 伪善是恶对善的敬重.

sentence.English: I am not a bit anxious about my battles. If I am anxious I don't fight them. I wait until I am ready.
sentence.Chinese: 对于要打的仗, 我一点儿也不担心.要是担心我就不打.我要等到准备好时才打.

sentence.English: I am not afraid of tomorrow for I have seen yesterday and I love today.
sentence.Chinese: 我不害怕明天,因为我见过昨天,又热爱今天.

sentence.English: I assure you that a learned fool is more foolish than an ingnorant fool.
sentence.Chinese: 我向你保证,一个有学问的傻瓜比无知的傻瓜更傻.

sentence.English: I can resist everything except temptation.
sentence.Chinese: 我什么都能抵制，只有诱惑除外。

sentence.English: I cannot afford to waste my time making money.
sentence.Chinese: 我浪费不起时间去赚钱.

sentence.English: I cannot be your friend and your flatterer too.
sentence.Chinese: 我不能既作你的朋友,又作你的阿谀者.

sentence.English: I cannot undertake to be impartial as between the fire brigade and the fire.
sentence.Chinese: 在消防队和大火之间，我不能同意不偏不倚。

sentence.English: I disapprove of what you say,but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
sentence.Chinese: 我不同意你说的话，但是我愿意誓死捍卫你说话的权利。

sentence.English: I eat merely to put food out of my mind.
sentence.Chinese: 我吃东西只是为了不再去想食物.

sentence.English: I had rather do and not promise, than promise and not do.
sentence.Chinese: 宁愿多做事少许诺,不愿多许诺而不做事.

sentence.English: I had six serving men--they taught me all I know; their names are WHERE, WHAT, WHEN, WHY, HOW,and WHO.
sentence.Chinese: 我的知识全来自六名仆人,他们的名字是:”何地”,”何物”,”何时”,”为何”,”如何”和”何人”.

sentence.English: I have but one counsel for you-be your own master.
sentence.Chinese: 我只有一个忠告给你——做你自己的主人。

sentence.English: I have seen the sea when it is stormy and wild. when it is quiet and serene, when it is dark and moody. And in all its moods, I see myself.
sentence.Chinese: 我见过汹涌澎湃的海，风平浪静的海，阴郁易怒的海。我在它的种种变化中见到了我自己。

sentence.English: I have yet to be bored by someone paying me a compliment.
sentence.Chinese: 人家恭维我，我还没觉得厌烦过。

sentence.English: I know how to be abased ,and I know also how to abound:in everything and in all things have I learned the secret both to be filled and to be hungry,both to abound and to be in want.
sentence.Chinese: 我知道怎样对待窘迫，也知道怎样对待富有：凡事均既饱足又饥饿，既有余又匮乏，这是我学到的秘诀。

sentence.English: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
sentence.Chinese: 我不缅怀过去的历史,而致力于未来的梦想.

sentence.English: I love myself well, but my countrymen better.
sentence.Chinese: 我爱自己，但更爱自己的同胞。

sentence.English: I myself have become a Gaullist only little by little.
sentence.Chinese: 我自己也只是一点一点地才成为一个戴高乐主义者的。

sentence.English: I never consider ease and joyfulness as the purpose of life itself.
sentence.Chinese: 我从不认为安逸和快乐就是生活本身的目的.

sentence.English: I only regret that I have but one life to lose for my country.
sentence.Chinese: 我唯一遣憾的是我只有一次生命可以献给祖国.

sentence.English: I slept and dreamt that life was beauty; I woke and found that life was duty.
sentence.Chinese: 梦里见到人生无比美丽,醒时发现义务即是人生.

sentence.English: I tell you hopeless grief is passionless.
sentence.Chinese: 我告诉你,没有希望的悲伤是没有感情的.

sentence.English: I think of music as a menu. I can't eat the same thing everyday.
sentence.Chinese: 我把音乐比作菜单。我不能每天吃同样的菜。

sentence.English: I think,therefore I am.
sentence.Chinese: 我思考，所以我存在。

sentence.English: I want to bring out the secrets of nature and apply them for the happiness of man.I don't know of any better service to offer for the short time we are in the world.
sentence.Chinese: 我想揭示大自然的秘密,用来造福人类.我认为,在我们的短暂一生中,最好的贡献莫过于此了.

sentence.English: I wept when I was born,and every day shows why.
sentence.Chinese: 人生道路艰难困苦,难怪婴儿出世就哭. /我方出世,哭泣不止,为何如此,日月自知.

sentence.English: I will not keep a dog and bark myself.
sentence.Chinese: 既然养了狗，何必自己叫?

sentence.English: I would rather be right than President.
sentence.Chinese: 我宁可正确而不愿当总统。

sentence.English: I would rather have my people laugh at my economies than weep for my extravagance.
sentence.Chinese: 我宁可让我的人民笑我的节省,也不愿让他们为我的奢侈而哭泣.

sentence.English: I would rather see a young man blush than turn pale.
sentence.Chinese: 我宁可看到青年人脸红，也不愿看到他脸色变得苍白。

sentence.English: I've never any pity for conceited people,because Ithink they carry their comfort about with them.
sentence.Chinese: 我从不怜惜自负的人们，因为我觉得他们无处不能自我安慰。

sentence.English: Ice and live charcoal cannot be placed in the same furnace; the enemy and ourselves do not go the same way.
sentence.Chinese: 冰炭不同炉； 敌我不同路。

sentence.English: Ideals are like the stars--we never reach them, but like mariners,we chart our course by them.
sentence.Chinese: 理想就象是星星--我们永远够不着星星,但是我们象水手一样,用它们指引航程.

sentence.English: Idle folk have the least leisure.
sentence.Chinese: 懒人没空闲.

sentence.English: Idleness is the root of all evils.
sentence.Chinese: 懒惰是万恶之源.

sentence.English: Idleness makes the wit rust.
sentence.Chinese: 懒惰使脑筋生锈.

sentence.English: Idleness rusts the mind.
sentence.Chinese: 懒散使头脑衰退.

sentence.English: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent Him.
sentence.Chinese: 如果上帝不存在，也有必要造出一个来。

sentence.English: If I have done the public any service, it is due to patient thought.
sentence.Chinese: 如果我为公众做了点事,那要归功于耐心的思考.

sentence.English: If Jack's in love, he's no judge of Jill's beauty.
sentence.Chinese: 要是杰克爱上了吉尔,吉尔再丑他也说俊俏.

sentence.English: If Winter comes, can Spring be far behind?
sentence.Chinese: 严冬既已至,春天即不远.

sentence.English: If a jewel falls into the mire, it remains as precious as before; and though dust should ascend to heaven, its former worthlessness will not be altered.
sentence.Chinese: 宝石即使落在泥潭里,仍是一样可贵;尘土纵然扬到天上,还是没有价值.

sentence.English: If a man deceives me once, shame on him; if he deceives me twice, shame on me.
sentence.Chinese: 人欺我一次，他羞耻，欺我两次，我羞耻。

sentence.English: If a man empties his purse into his head, no man can take it away from him. An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
sentence.Chinese: 倾囊求知,无人能夺. 投资知识,得益最多.

sentence.English: If a man will not seek knowledge, it will not seek him.
sentence.Chinese: 你若不去找知识,知识不会来找你.

sentence.English: If a nag travels a thousand li,it's only through perseverance.
sentence.Chinese: 驽马千里,功在不舍.

sentence.English: If a person refuses to hear other's advice, this will do him no good; but if he follows whatever advice people might offer him,this will do him even greater harm.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人不听劝告不好，但若任何劝告都听，则是更加不好。

sentence.English: If anyone among the officials breaks the law,he, too should be punished.
sentence.Chinese: 长官犯了法，也要受处罚。

sentence.English: If at first you don't succeed, try,try,try again.
sentence.Chinese: 再接再厉,终会成功.

sentence.English: If children grew up according to early inclination,we should have nothing but geniuses.
sentence.Chinese: 儿童如按其早期倾向成长,则个个都会成为天才.

sentence.English: If dogs could talk,it would take a lot of fun out of owning one.
sentence.Chinese: 如果狗能讲话，那养狗就无多少乐趣了。

sentence.English: If each would sweep before his own door,we should have a clean city.
sentence.Chinese: 若家家动手扫清门前,整个城市就清洁了.

sentence.English: If it is a dog that bites people, Ishould think it must be beaten, no matter whether it is on shore or in the water.
sentence.Chinese: 倘是咬人之狗，我觉得都在可打之列，无论它在岸上或在水中。

sentence.English: If it were not for hope,the heart would break.
sentence.Chinese: 人靠希望活着.

sentence.English: If it weren't for the rocks in its bed, the stream would have no song.
sentence.Chinese: 溪床如果无石块，溪流就不会潺潺歌唱。

sentence.English: If money be not the servant,it will be the master.
sentence.Chinese: 不做金钱的主人,便沦为金钱的奴隶.

sentence.English: If moral behavior were simply following rules, we could program a computer to be moral.
sentence.Chinese: 道德行为如果只是循规蹈矩办事，我们就可以编制一套程序使电脑有道德。

sentence.English: If necessity is the mother of invention,discontent is the father of progress.
sentence.Chinese: 如果需要是发明之母,不满足就是进步之父.

sentence.English: If one receives a plun,one must return a peach.
sentence.Chinese: 投桃报李.

sentence.English: If one sheep leaps over the ditch, all the rest will follow.
sentence.Chinese: 一只羊跳过水沟，其他羊都会跟着跳。

sentence.English: If the blind lead the blind,both shall fall into the ditch.
sentence.Chinese: 盲人领盲人,双双掉沟里.

sentence.English: If the brain sows not corn, it plants thistles.
sentence.Chinese: 思想象田野,不播粮食就长荆棘.

sentence.English: If the cap fits,wear it.
sentence.Chinese: 帽子合适，你就戴上；如说的符合你的情况，你就接受。

sentence.English: If the ruler is personally upright,all will go well even though he does not give orders. But if he is not personally upright,even though he gives orders, they will not be obeyed.
sentence.Chinese: 其身正，不令而行； 其身不正，虽令不从。

sentence.English: If the tiller is industrious, the farmland is productive.
sentence.Chinese: 人勤地不懒.

sentence.English: If then you are not able to do even that which is least ,why are you anxious concerning the rest?
sentence.Chinese: 最小的事，你们尚且不能作，为什么还要去操心其余的事呢?

sentence.English: If there is no future for our country, where can we look for our individual love and happiness.
sentence.Chinese: 如果没有国家的前途命运,哪有个人的爱情和幸福.

sentence.English: If there were less sympathy in the world, there would be less trouble in the world.
sentence.Chinese: 如果世界上少一些同情，世界上也就会少一些麻烦。

sentence.English: If there were no clouds, we should not enjoy the sun.
sentence.Chinese: 没有阴云不觉阳光可爱。

sentence.English: If things were to be done twice all would be wise.
sentence.Chinese: 假如凡事都可以重新做一次,人人都可成为聪明人.

sentence.English: If thou dealest with a fox, think of his tricks.
sentence.Chinese: 与狐狸周旋，要谨防上当。

sentence.English: If two parties fight, a third party will benefit./ Two dogs strive for a bone, and a third runs away with it./ When shepherds quarrel, the wolf has a winning game.
sentence.Chinese: 鹬蚌相争,渔人得利.

sentence.English: If we are bound to forgive an enemy,we are not bound to trust him.
sentence.Chinese: 敌人可恕不可信。

sentence.English: If we can't do as we would, we must do as we can.
sentence.Chinese: 如不能如愿而行,定须尽力而为.

sentence.English: If we command our wealth,we shall be rich and free;if our wealth commands us,we are poor indeed.
sentence.Chinese: 如果我们能支配财富,就会富裕而自由;如果我们听任财富支配,我们就会真正贫穷.

sentence.English: If we have a correct theory but merely prate about it, pigeonhole it and do not put it into practice,then that theory, however good, is of no significance.
sentence.Chinese: 如果有了正确的理论,只是把它空谈一阵,束之高阁,并不实行,那末,这种理论再好也是没有意义的.

sentence.English: If wise man play the fool, they do it with a vengeance.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明人做傻事，傻得格外离奇。

sentence.English: If wishes were horses,beggars might ride.
sentence.Chinese: 如果愿望是马,乞丐也有马骑.

sentence.English: If you always say no, you'll never be married.
sentence.Chinese: 常说”不”的人,永远难成婚.

sentence.English: If you are too fortunate,you will not know voruself; if you are too unfortunate,nobody will know you.
sentence.Chinese: 运气太好，忘乎所以； 运气不好，无人搭理。

sentence.English: If you cannot bite, never show your teeth.
sentence.Chinese: 不能咬人就别龇牙。

sentence.English: If you cannot have the best, make the best of what you have.
sentence.Chinese: 没有更好的,用好现有的.

sentence.English: If you command wisely, you'll be obeyed cheerfully.
sentence.Chinese: 指挥有方则人人乐从。

sentence.English: If you cut the weeds without digging up their roots,they'll grow again when the spring breeze blows.
sentence.Chinese: 斩草不除根，春风吹又生。

sentence.English: If you do not exert yourself in youth,you will regret it in old age./
sentence.Chinese: 少壮不努力,老大徒伤悲.

sentence.English: If you do not learn to think when you are young, you may never learn.
sentence.Chinese: 如果你年轻时不学会思考,那就永远学不会.

sentence.English: If you don't like it ,you can lump it.
sentence.Chinese: 纵不喜欢，也要容忍。

sentence.English: If you don't want people to know about it, don't do it.
sentence.Chinese: 若要人不知,除非己莫为.

sentence.English: If you doubt yourself, then indeed you stand on shaky ground.
sentence.Chinese: 如果你怀疑自己,那你的立足点确实不稳固了.

sentence.English: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.
sentence.Chinese: 如果你有一块园地和一个图书馆,那么你就拥有了你所需要的一切.

sentence.English: If you have a job without any aggravations, you don't have a job.
sentence.Chinese: 如果你的工作一点都不使你烦恼,那就不配称为工作.

sentence.English: If you have great talents, industry will improve them; if you have but moderate abilities, industry will supply their deficiency.
sentence.Chinese: 如果你很有天赋,勤勉会使你完善;如果你能力一般,勤勉能补足你的缺陷.

sentence.English: If you have wit and learning, add to it wisdom and modesty.
sentence.Chinese: 有了才能与学识,还要加上智慧与谦虚.

sentence.English: If you let a tiger escape back to the mountain,you'll cause calamity for the future.
sentence.Chinese: 纵虎归山，必有后患。

sentence.English: If you live with a lame person you will learn to limp./ Who keeps company with the wolf will learn to howl.
sentence.Chinese: 近朱者赤,近墨者黑.

sentence.English: If you make a jest, you must take a jest.
sentence.Chinese: 爱开玩笑的人,也要经得住别人开玩笑.

sentence.English: If you read the Bible to the wolf, it'll certainly say:”Stop reading at once! A flock of sheep have just passed by!”
sentence.Chinese: 如果对狼读《圣经》，狼一定会说：“快停止吧!一群羊刚过去了!”

sentence.English: If you run after two hares, you will catch neither.
sentence.Chinese: 同时追二免,全都抓不住.

sentence.English: If you save a drowning dog, it'll bite you after getting back on shore.
sentence.Chinese: 救了落水狗，反咬你一口。

sentence.English: If you swear you will catch no fish.
sentence.Chinese: 咒骂解决不了问题。

sentence.English: If you want a thing well done, do it yourself.
sentence.Chinese: 要想真正做好一件事,就得亲手去做.

sentence.English: If you want knowledge, you must toil for it.
sentence.Chinese: 求知必须刻苦.

sentence.English: If you want people to think well of you,do not speak well of yourself.
sentence.Chinese: 要想人们对你有好感，就不要说自己的好话。

sentence.English: If you want to acquire profound knowledge, you must start from the A B C.
sentence.Chinese: 要想造就高深学问,就得从字母学起.

sentence.English: If you want to be sure that you never forget your wife's birthday, just try forgetting it once.
sentence.Chinese: 要想永远记住妻子的生日,就忘记一次试试.

sentence.English: If you want your dreams to come true, don't sleep.
sentence.Chinese: 要想梦成真,少睡多用心.

sentence.English: If you wish for peace,be prepared for war.
sentence.Chinese: 欲求和平，必先备战。

sentence.English: If you wish good advice, consult an old man.
sentence.Chinese: 欲得忠告,请教长者.

sentence.English: If you would know the value of money, go and try to borrow some.
sentence.Chinese: 要想知道钱的价值,就想办法去借钱试试.

sentence.English: If you're never scared or embarrassed or hurt, it means you never take any chances.
sentence.Chinese: 假如你从来未曾害怕,受窘,受伤害,那就是说你从来没有冒过险.

sentence.English: If your ship does't come in,swim out to it!
sentence.Chinese: 如果你的船开不进来,那就向它游去!

sentence.English: If youth knew what age would crave, it would both get and save.
sentence.Chinese: 青年若知老来苦,勤俭两字永不丢.

sentence.English: Ignorance is the mother of impudence.
sentence.Chinese: 无知是鲁莽之源.

sentence.English: Ignorance of the law excuses no man.
sentence.Chinese: 不知法不能使任何人免罪.

sentence.English: Ill news hath wings, and with the wind doth go.Comfort's a cripple and comes very slow.
sentence.Chinese: 坏消息长有翅膀，随风飞扬。安慰却是个跛子?跚跚来迟。

sentence.English: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 想象比知识更重要.

sentence.English: In a calm sea every man is a pilot.
sentence.Chinese: 在平静的海上,人人可以作舵手.

sentence.English: In a good house all is quickly ready.
sentence.Chinese: 治家有方,办事快当.

sentence.English: In any contest between power and patience, bet on patience.
sentence.Chinese: 在任何力量与耐心的比赛中，把宝押在耐心上。

sentence.English: In books are embalmed the greatest thoughts of all ages.
sentence.Chinese: 古今伟大思想均永载于书籍之中.

sentence.English: In doing we learn.
sentence.Chinese: 我们在干中学习.

sentence.English: In education we are striving not to teach youth to make a living, but to make a life.
sentence.Chinese: 教育不是为了教会青年人谋生，而是教会他们创造生活。

sentence.English: In every beginning think of the end.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事一开始就要想到结果.

sentence.English: In every country the sun rises in the morning.
sentence.Chinese: 无论在哪个国家都是早晨出太阳。

sentence.English: In important matters, we expose our best sides; in trivial matters, we disclose ourselves as we really are.
sentence.Chinese: 在重要的事件中我们显露出好的方面，在无关紧要的小事中我们才显露出本来的面目。

sentence.English: In love is no lack.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情不会感到缺乏.

sentence.English: In my own city my name, in a strange city my clother procure me respect.
sentence.Chinese: 在家乡，名字使人受到尊敬；在异地，衣服使人受到尊敬。

sentence.English: In our expenditure the item that costs most is time.
sentence.Chinese: 在我们的消费中,时间是最昂贵的一项.

sentence.English: In reality killing time is only the name for another of the multifarious ways by which time kills us.
sentence.Chinese: 实际上,消磨时间只是时间用以消磨我们的五花八门的又一种办法而已.

sentence.English: In settling on island,the first building erected by a Spaniard wil be a church; by a Frenchman,a fort; by a Dutchman,a warehouse; and by an Englishman, an alehouse.
sentence.Chinese: 在海岛定居时，西班牙人先造教堂；法国人先造要塞；荷兰人先造仓库而英 国人则先造酒店。

sentence.English: In shooting, aim your arrow at the target; in playing the violin, choose a tune that entertains your audience.
sentence.Chinese: 射箭看靶子,弹琴看对象.

sentence.English: In speaking well of others, you speak well of yourself.
sentence.Chinese: 称赞他人，如同称赞自己。

sentence.English: In sports and journeys men are known.
sentence.Chinese: 从体育和旅行中，可看出男子的品德。

sentence.English: In the coldest flint there is hot fire.
sentence.Chinese: 冰冷的燧石里有烈火.

sentence.English: In the end things will mend.
sentence.Chinese: 船到桥头自然直.

sentence.English: In the evening one may praise the day.
sentence.Chinese: 称誉白日须待夜来之时.

sentence.English: In the husband wisdom, in the wife gentleness.
sentence.Chinese: 丈夫贵在智慧,妻子贵在温柔.

sentence.English: In this world there is always danger for those who are afraid of it.
sentence.Chinese: 对于害怕危险的人，这个世界上总是有危险的。

sentence.English: In valour there is hope.
sentence.Chinese: 希望在于勇敢.

sentence.English: Industry is fortune's right hand, and frugality her left.
sentence.Chinese: 节俭和勤奋是幸运的左右手.

sentence.English: Industry is the soul of business and the keystone of prosperity.
sentence.Chinese: 勤劳是事业的灵魂,是成功的基石.

sentence.English: Inflation is being broken with a lot of money in your pocket.
sentence.Chinese: 通货膨胀是你的口袋有大量的钱，而你破产了。

sentence.English: Influence is like a savings account.The less you use it,the more you've got.
sentence.Chinese: 影响力犹如储蓄存款，用得愈少，积得愈多。

sentence.English: Ingratitude is a kind of weakness; clever men are not ungrateful.
sentence.Chinese: 忘恩负义是一种软弱的表现；明智的人不会忘记别人的恩德。

sentence.English: Injuring all of a man's ten fingers is not as effective as chopping off one.
sentence.Chinese: 伤其十指,不如断其一指.

sentence.English: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
sentence.Chinese: 无论何处的不公正,对于任何地方的公正都是一种威胁.

sentence.English: Interests are anchors, and I believe they will bring peace and even happiness in the end.
sentence.Chinese: 兴趣是锚,我相信它最终会带来和平,甚至幸福.

sentence.English: Is life so dear, or peace so sweet as to be purchased at the price of chains and slavery?
sentence.Chinese: 难道生命是如此珍贵,和平是如此甜美,以至于不惜为此戴锁链,当奴隶吗?

sentence.English: Is long as the world shall last there will be wrongs, and if no man rebelled, those wrongs would last forever.
sentence.Chinese: 只要世界还存在，就会有错误，如果没有人反叛，这些错误将永远存在下去。

sentence.English: It has been said that art is a tryst, for in the joy of it maker and beholder meet.
sentence.Chinese: 有人说艺术是一种幽会，因为艺术家和欣赏者可在幽会的乐趣中相遇在一起。

sentence.English: It is a bad cloth that will take no colour.
sentence.Chinese: 布再坏也能染色。

sentence.English: It is a foolish sheep that makes the wolf his confessor.
sentence.Chinese: 笨羊才向狼忏悔。

sentence.English: It is a good horse that never stumbles, And a good wife that never grumbles.
sentence.Chinese: 不失蹄的是好马,不唠叨的是贤妻.

sentence.English: It is a long lane that has no turning.
sentence.Chinese: 路长有弯，事长有变。

sentence.English: It is a silly fish that is caught twice with the same bait.
sentence.Chinese: 蠢人才上两回当。

sentence.English: It is an equal failing to trust everybody and to trust nobody.
sentence.Chinese: 轻信所有人和不相信一切人同样是缺点。

sentence.English: It is as futile as drawing water with a bamboo basket.
sentence.Chinese: 竹篮打水一场空。

sentence.English: It is as well to know which way the wind blows.
sentence.Chinese: 最好知道风吹往哪个方向。 / 识时务者为俊杰。

sentence.English: It is better to give than to take.
sentence.Chinese: 施比受更有福.

sentence.English: It is better to please a fool than to anget him.
sentence.Chinese: 若惹蠢人生气，不如使他欢喜。

sentence.English: It is better to see once than to hear a hundred times./ Seeing for oneself is better than hearing from others.
sentence.Chinese: 百闻不如一见.

sentence.English: It is better to trust to valour than to luck.
sentence.Chinese: 靠运气不如靠勇气.

sentence.English: It is but a step form the sublime to the ridiculous.
sentence.Chinese: 从崇高到荒谬只有一步之差.

sentence.English: It is discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.
sentence.Chinese: 令人沮丧的是，有那么多人对诚实感到吃惊，而对欺骗感到吃惊的人却那么少。

sentence.English: It is dogged that does it.
sentence.Chinese: 有志者事竞成.

sentence.English: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye ,than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
sentence.Chinese: 富人进天堂比骆驼穿过针眼还难。

sentence.English: It is easier to fight for principles than to live up to them.
sentence.Chinese: 为原则而斗争容易,按原则的要求活着难.

sentence.English: It is easier to make enemies than to make friends.
sentence.Chinese: 结怨易,交友难.

sentence.English: It is easy to be wise after the event.
sentence.Chinese: 事后聪明容易.

sentence.English: It is easy to swim if another holds up your head.
sentence.Chinese: 有人扶着头,容易学游泳.

sentence.English: It is fair to judge people and stained-glass windows only in their best light.
sentence.Chinese: 看人和看彩色玻璃窗,都要从他们最光彩之处着眼,才算公道.

sentence.English: It is good to be merry and wise.
sentence.Chinese: 乐不移智，娱不纵情。

sentence.English: It is good to have friends in trouble.
sentence.Chinese: 患难得友是幸事.

sentence.English: It is good to learn at another man's cost.
sentence.Chinese: 使人失败,自己学乖.

sentence.English: It is hard to laugh and cry both with a breath.
sentence.Chinese: 人很难同时即哭又笑。

sentence.English: It is hard to please all.
sentence.Chinese: 要使人人满意是件难事。

sentence.English: It is harder to conceal ignorance than to acquire knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 掩盖无知要比学到知识更难.

sentence.English: It is ill jesting with edged tools.
sentence.Chinese: 手持利器，不可打闹。

sentence.English: It is impossible to defeat an ignorant man in argument.
sentence.Chinese: 想要通过争论去战胜无知的人是不可能的.

sentence.English: It is lawful to learn even from an enemy.
sentence.Chinese: 向敌人学习不犯法.

sentence.English: It is love that makes the world go round.
sentence.Chinese: 爱是推动世界的力量.

sentence.English: It is madness for a sheep to treat of peace with a wolf.
sentence.Chinese: 羊跟狼讲和平，是羊发了疯。

sentence.English: It is man's duty to be courageous enough to seek for truth.
sentence.Chinese: 勇于探索真理是人的天职.

sentence.English: It is more pain to do nothing than something.
sentence.Chinese: 无事可干比有事可干更费劲.

sentence.English: It is much more difficult to judge oneself than to judge others.
sentence.Chinese: 判断自己比判断别人要难得多

sentence.English: It is never too late to learn.
sentence.Chinese: 学习从不嫌晚.

sentence.English: It is no sin to sell dear,but a sin to give ill measure.
sentence.Chinese: 高价出售不为过，缺斤少两才是罪。

sentence.English: It is no use crying over spilt milk.
sentence.Chinese: 牛奶已泼，哭也无用。

sentence.English: It is not by the grey of the hair that one knows the age of the heart.
sentence.Chinese: 白发多少并不能告诉你一个人心灵的年龄.

sentence.English: It is not easy to find happiness in ourselves,and it is not possible to find it elsewhere.
sentence.Chinese: 要在自身找到幸福是不容易的,要在别的地方找到幸福则是不可能的.

sentence.English: It is not enough to be industrious,so are the ants. What are you industrious about?
sentence.Chinese: 光勤劳是不够的,蚂蚁也是勤劳的.要看你为什么而勤劳.

sentence.English: It is not enough to have great qualities, we must also have the management of them.
sentence.Chinese: 有才能还不够,还要善用其才.

sentence.English: It is not lost that a friend gets.
sentence.Chinese: 东西给了朋友并不是损失.

sentence.English: It is not the fine coat that makes the gentleman.
sentence.Chinese: 使人成为君子的并不是讲究的衣着。

sentence.English: It is not the hood that makes the monk.
sentence.Chinese: 穿袈裟的不一定就是和尚。

sentence.English: It is not the lofty sails but the unseen wind that moves the ship.
sentence.Chinese: 推动船的不是高大的帆，而是无形的风。

sentence.English: It is not the place,nor the condition,but the mind alone that can make anyone happy or miserable.
sentence.Chinese: 决定人之苦乐的不是地点,也不是环境,而是思想

sentence.English: It is not the suffering, but the cause, that makes a martyr.
sentence.Chinese: 蒙受苦难而死不一定成为烈士,为正义的事业而死才是烈士.

sentence.English: It is not what is she,but what has she.
sentence.Chinese: 择妻看人品,切莫恋门第.

sentence.English: It is not wide reading but useful reading that tends to excellence.
sentence.Chinese: 读书要有成效不在于博览群书,而在于读有用的书.

sentence.English: It is not work that kills, but worry.
sentence.Chinese: 工作不损寿，忧虑才伤身。

sentence.English: It is only when the mind and character slumber that the dress can be seen.
sentence.Chinese: 只有一个人的心灵和品格熟睡的时候,人们才会注意到他的服饰.

sentence.English: It is right to be contented with what we have,never with what we are .
sentence.Chinese: 可以满足于所得，但不要满足于自己。

sentence.English: It is sweat, not dew, that helps the harvest.
sentence.Chinese: 丰收不靠露滴,而靠汗水.

sentence.English: It is the careless man that will suffer;never will the prudent man fall into a trap.
sentence.Chinese: 只有大意吃亏，没有小心上当。

sentence.English: It is the first step that costs the most.
sentence.Chinese: 万事开头难.

sentence.English: It is the last straw that breaks the camel's back.
sentence.Chinese: 骆驼负载过重时，加根草也能把它压倒。

sentence.English: It is to books that I owe everything that is good in me.
sentence.Chinese: 我身上所有优秀的品质都要归功于书籍.

sentence.English: It is too late to husband when all is spent.
sentence.Chinese: 囊空而后节俭,为时已晚.

sentence.English: It is while you are patiently toiling at the little tasks of life that the meaning and shape of great whole of life dawn on you.
sentence.Chinese: 在你耐心地操劳于生活的琐事的过程中,你才能领悟整个生活的伟大意义和形象.

sentence.English: It is with narrow-souled people as with narrow-necked bottles; the less they have in them the more noise they make in pouring out.
sentence.Chinese: 心胸狭隘的人就象小口瓶子;里面装的东西越少,倒出时噪音越大.

sentence.English: It matters not how a man dies,but how he lives.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人如何死是无关紧要的,重要的是如何生.

sentence.English: It never will rain roses. When we want to have more roses we must plant trees.
sentence.Chinese: 天上永远不会掉下玫瑰来,如果想要更多的玫瑰,必须自己种植.

sentence.English: It takes all sorts to make a world.
sentence.Chinese: 世界是由各式各样的人组成的. /世界之大,什么样的人都有.

sentence.English: It takes ten years grow trees,but a hundred to rear people.
sentence.Chinese: 十年树木,百年树人.

sentence.English: It takes two to make a quarrel.
sentence.Chinese: 一个巴掌拍不响.

sentence.English: It takes two to speak truth-one to speak and another to hear.
sentence.Chinese: 说真话要有两个人——一个说，一个听。

sentence.English: It's a day after the fair.
sentence.Chinese: 错过良机，为时已晚。

sentence.English: It's a poor heart that never rejoices.
sentence.Chinese: 不知世间有乐事者最可怜.

sentence.English: It's better to have fought and lost, Than never to have fought at all.
sentence.Chinese: 奋战过而失败,强于根本未战.

sentence.English: It's but little good you'll do a-watering the last year's crop.
sentence.Chinese: 为去年的庄稼浇水徒劳无功。

sentence.English: It's good to have money to buy things that money can buy, but it's better not to lose things money cannot buy.
sentence.Chinese: 有钱去买能买得到的东西当然不错,但不丢失用金钱买不到的东西更好.

sentence.English: It's great to be great, but it's greater to be human.
sentence.Chinese: 成为伟人是美好的,做一个真正的人更美好.

sentence.English: It's hard sailing when there is no wind.
sentence.Chinese: 无风难驶船.

sentence.English: It's just in time to rein in at the brink of the precipice; but it's too late to mend the ship's leak in the middle of the river.
sentence.Chinese: 悬崖勒马犹未晚，船到江心补漏迟。

sentence.English: It's never too late to mend.
sentence.Chinese: 改过不嫌晚。

sentence.English: It's no use pumping a dry well.
sentence.Chinese: 枯井抽水,徒劳无功.

sentence.English: It's not the gay coat that makes the gentleman.
sentence.Chinese: 君子在德不在衣.

sentence.English: It's only the idle will be tired.
sentence.Chinese: 只有闲人才会感到疲倦.

sentence.English: It's the hardest thing in the world to accept a little success and leave it that way.
sentence.Chinese: 世界上最难的事是获得一点成功而甘心到此为止.

sentence.English: Joy is found only is Love, Life is found only in loving.
sentence.Chinese: 只有在爱中才能找到欢乐,只有在爱别人中才能找到生活.

sentence.English: Joys shared with others are more enjoyed.
sentence.Chinese: 与众同乐,其乐更乐.

sentence.English: Judge not a book by its covers.
sentence.Chinese: 评价书不能看封面。

sentence.English: Judge not of men and things at first sight.
sentence.Chinese: 不要靠初次的印象来判断人或事。

sentence.English: Just a bit of a mouse's dropping will spoil a whole saucepan of broth.
sentence.Chinese: 一粒老鼠屎败坏一锅汤。

sentence.English: Just definitions either prevent or put an end to disputes.
sentence.Chinese: 正确的定义不但能避免争论,也能结束争论.

sentence.English: Justice is a machine that,when someone has given it a starting push,rolls on itself.
sentence.Chinese: 正义是一台机器，一旦有人推一下就会自己转下去。

sentence.English: Justice is all-conquering;truth is placed above anything.
sentence.Chinese: 正义战无不胜,真理高于一切.

sentence.English: Justifying a fault doubles it.
sentence.Chinese: 护短是加倍的错误。

sentence.English: Keep a thing seven years and you will find a use for it.
sentence.Chinese: 蓄艾三年,必有其用.

sentence.English: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry,the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
sentence.Chinese: 请使我远离没有眼泪的智慧，没有欢笑的哲学，和不肯向孩子低头的伟大。

sentence.English: Keep your fears to yourself, but share your courage.
sentence.Chinese: 把恐惧留给自己,把勇气分给别人.

sentence.English: Keep your mouth shut and your eyes open.
sentence.Chinese: 多看少讲.

sentence.English: Keeping is harder than winning.
sentence.Chinese: 创业难,守业更难.

sentence.English: Kill two birds with one stone.
sentence.Chinese: 一石二鸟. /一箭双雕. / 一举两得.

sentence.English: Kind hearts are more than coronets.
sentence.Chinese: 好心胜过高帽子.

sentence.English: Kind words bring life, but cruel words crush your spirit.
sentence.Chinese: 体贴的话语会给生活带来温暖,而刻薄的言辞能使人意志消沉.

sentence.English: Kindness cannot be bought for gear.
sentence.Chinese: 钱财买不到好意.

sentence.English: Kindness is the golden chain by which society is bound together.
sentence.Chinese: 仁爱是联结社会的金链.

sentence.English: Kindnesses,like grain, increase by sowing.
sentence.Chinese: 友情象庄稼,愈种就愈多.

sentence.English: Kitchen Physic is the best physic.
sentence.Chinese: 饮食有节，百药无缘。

sentence.English: Knavery may serve a turn,but honesty never fails.
sentence.Chinese: 欺诈或许暂时有用，诚实却永远有用。

sentence.English: Knock, and the door shall be opened.
sentence.Chinese: 只要敲门，就会有人来开。

sentence.English: Know something of everything and everything of something.
sentence.Chinese: 通百艺而精于一.

sentence.English: Know the enemy and know yourself. and you can fight a hundred battles with no danger of defeat.
sentence.Chinese: 知己知彼,百战不殆.

sentence.English: Knowledge advances by steps and not by leaps.
sentence.Chinese: 知识只能循序渐进,不能躐等以求.

sentence.English: Knowledge comes form diligence.
sentence.Chinese: 知识源于勤奋.

sentence.English: Knowledge comes form experience alone.
sentence.Chinese: 知识只能来自经验.

sentence.English: Knowledge is a matter of science,and no dishonesty or conceit whatsoever is permissible.What is required is definitely the reverse--honesty and modesty.
sentence.Chinese: 知识的问题是一个科学问题,来不得半点的虚伪和骄傲,决定地需要的倒是其反面--诚实和谦逊的态度.

sentence.English: Knowledge is a treasure. but practice is the key to it .
sentence.Chinese: 知识是一座宝库,而实践就是开启宝库的钥匙.

sentence.English: Knowledge is like the spring water underground----the deeper you dig, the clearer is the water.
sentence.Chinese: 知识好象地下的泉水,掘得越深越清澈.

sentence.English: Knowledge is no burden.
sentence.Chinese: 知识再多不压身.

sentence.English: Knowledge is power.
sentence.Chinese: 知识就是力量.

sentence.English: Knowledge is the antidote to fear.
sentence.Chinese: 知识是治疗恐惧的特效药.

sentence.English: Knowledge makes humble,ignorance makes proud.
sentence.Chinese: 知识使人谦虚,无知使人骄傲.

sentence.English: Knowledge makes one laugh, but wealth makes one dance.
sentence.Chinese: 知识使人笑逐颜开,财富使人手舞足蹈.

sentence.English: Knowledge requires repeated explorations, and farmland needs intensive cultivation.
sentence.Chinese: 知识需要反复探索,土地需要辛勤耕耘.

sentence.English: Knowledge without practice makes but half an artist.
sentence.Chinese: 有知识而无实践,只是半个能人.

sentence.English: Labour created man himself.
sentence.Chinese: 劳动创造人.

sentence.English: Labour is light where love doth pay.
sentence.Chinese: 以爱情作报酬,劳苦也轻松.

sentence.English: Labour is often the father of pleasure.
sentence.Chinese: 劳动常常是幸福之父.

sentence.English: Langhter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
sentence.Chinese: 笑是太阳，它从人们脸上赶走冬天。

sentence.English: Language is the dress of thought.
sentence.Chinese: 语言是思想的衣服。

sentence.English: Laugh and grow fat.
sentence.Chinese: 心宽体胖 。

sentence.English: Laugh and the world laughs with you,weep and you weep alone.
sentence.Chinese: 欢笑，则世界与你同乐；哭泣，则独自悲伤。

sentence.English: Laugh before breakfast and you'll cry before supper.
sentence.Chinese: 笑得早也会哭得早。

sentence.English: Law makers should not be law breakers.
sentence.Chinese: 立法者不可违法。

sentence.English: Laziness in youth spells regret in old age.
sentence.Chinese: 少壮不努力,老大徒伤悲.

sentence.English: Laziness is like a lock, which bolts you out of the storehouse of information and makes you an intellectual starveling.
sentence.Chinese: 懒惰是一把锁,锁住了聪明和智慧的仓库,使你在工作和学习上永远是个”缺粮户”.

sentence.English: Laziness makes you ill, labour makes you healthy.
sentence.Chinese: 懒散使人生病，劳动使人健壮。

sentence.English: Lazy folk take the most pains.
sentence.Chinese: 懒人躲懒最费力.

sentence.English: Leal heart lied never.
sentence.Chinese: 心诚无谎言。

sentence.English: Lean liberty is better than fat slavery.
sentence.Chinese: 宁自由而贫困,毋奴于人而富足.

sentence.English: Learn even from an enemy.
sentence.Chinese: 即使是敌人也可以向他学习.

sentence.English: Learn form the bee busy collecting honey; don't copy the example of the cicada hanging around doing nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 要学蜜蜂勤采蜜,不做悠闲的知了.

sentence.English: Learn to creep before you leap. Learn to walk before you run.
sentence.Chinese: 先学爬,再学跳. 先学走,再学跑.

sentence.English: Learn young, learn fair.
sentence.Chinese: 学习趁年少,而且要学好.

sentence.English: Learning is a bitter root, but it bears sweet fruit.
sentence.Chinese: 学习根苦果甜.

sentence.English: Learning is a sceptre to some, a bauble to others.
sentence.Chinese: 学识对某些人是权杖,对另一些人只是漂亮的装饰品.

sentence.English: Learning is the eye of the mind.
sentence.Chinese: 知识是心灵的慧眼.

sentence.English: Learning is the light that leads into everything lovely.
sentence.Chinese: 学识是照亮通往各种美好事物的道路的明灯.

sentence.English: Learning makes a good man better and an ill man worse.
sentence.Chinese: 知识使好人更好,也能使坏人更坏.

sentence.English: Learning without thought is labour lost.
sentence.Chinese: 学而不思,白费力气

sentence.English: Learning without thought is useless; thought without learning is dangerous.
sentence.Chinese: 学而不思则罔,思而不学则殆.

sentence.English: Leave off with an appetite.
sentence.Chinese: 吃得七分饱，就该离餐桌。

sentence.English: Lend your money and lose your friend.
sentence.Chinese: 钱财借出,友谊丧失.

sentence.English: Let another's shopwreck be your sea-mark.
sentence.Chinese: 别人的沉船,就是你的航标.

sentence.English: Let bygones be bygones.
sentence.Chinese: 既往宜不咎。

sentence.English: Let each one sweep the snow from his own doorstep and heed not the frost on his neighbour's roof.
sentence.Chinese: 各人自扫门前雪，莫管他人瓦上霜。

sentence.English: Let every man praise the bridge he goes over.
sentence.Chinese: 过桥不忘造桥人。

sentence.English: Let him that would be happy for a day,go to the barber; for a week,marry a wife; for a month, buy him a new horse; for a year,build him a new house; for all his lifetime,be an honest man.
sentence.Chinese: 理了发，乐一天；娶媳妇，乐一周；买匹马，乐一月；建新房，乐一年；做个老实人，足可乐一生。

sentence.English: Let him who knows the instrument play upon it.
sentence.Chinese: 让会干的人去干。

sentence.English: Let him who tied the bell on the tiger take it off--whoever started the trouble should end it.
sentence.Chinese: 解铃还须系铃人.

sentence.English: Let not the sun go down on your wrath.
sentence.Chinese: 不要在生气中让太阳下山。 / 今日气，今日息。

sentence.English: Let not they left hand know what thy right hand does.
sentence.Chinese: 右手所为，不让左手知道。

sentence.English: Let patience grow in your garden always.
sentence.Chinese: 让忍耐之心在你的花园里永不凋谢。

sentence.English: Let that which is lost be for God.
sentence.Chinese: 失去的东西就别想它了. /失去的东西就算献给上帝了.

sentence.English: Let the sleeping dogs lie.
sentence.Chinese: 莫惹是非。

sentence.English: Let the world slide.
sentence.Chinese: 人世沧桑,听其自然.

sentence.English: Let those who know the way go before.
sentence.Chinese: 让识途的人先行。

sentence.English: Let well alone.
sentence.Chinese: 不要画蛇添足. /事已成功,不必多弄.

sentence.English: Liberty is the only thing you cannot have unless you give it to others.
sentence.Chinese: 自由就是这样的东西,不给予别人你自己也无法得到.

sentence.English: Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth.
sentence.Chinese: 自由,一旦开始生根,就会成为一棵生长极快的树木.

sentence.English: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
sentence.Chinese: 只有向后看才能理解生活;但要生活好,则必须向前看.

sentence.English: Life consists not in holding good cards,but in playing well those you hold.
sentence.Chinese: 生活不在于握有一手好牌,而在于把手里的牌打好.

sentence.English: Life has taught me to think,but thinking has not taught me to live.
sentence.Chinese: 生活教会了我思考,但思考却没有教会我生活.

sentence.English: Life is a foreign language:All men mispronounce it.
sentence.Chinese: 生活是一种外语,谁都发不好它的音.

sentence.English: Life is a great big canvas,and you should throw all the paint on it you can.
sentence.Chinese: 人生是一幅大画布,你应该努力绘出绚丽多彩的画面.

sentence.English: Life is a horse, and either you ride it or it rides you.
sentence.Chinese: 人生象一匹马,你不驾驭它,它便驾驭你.

sentence.English: Life is a leaf of paper white,thereon each of us may write his word or two.
sentence.Chinese: 生活是一张白纸,每个人都在上面写上自己的一两句话.

sentence.English: Life is a test and this world a place of trial. Always the problems---or it may be the same problem---will be presented to every generation in different forms.
sentence.Chinese: 人生是一种考验,而这个世界就是考场,每一代都要面对一些问题---可能是相同的问题----只不过问题的形式不同.

sentence.English: Life is but a hard and tortuous journey.
sentence.Chinese: 人生即是一段艰难曲折的旅程. /人生无坦途.

sentence.English: Life is compared to a voyage.
sentence.Chinese: 人生好比是一次航程.

sentence.English: Life is fine and enjoyable,yet you must learn to enjoy your fine life.
sentence.Chinese: 人生是美好的,但要学会如何享用美好的生活.

sentence.English: Life is for one generation, a good name is forever.
sentence.Chinese: 生命只有一代之久,而美名永存于世.

sentence.English: Life is half spent before we know what it is.
sentence.Chinese: 我们认识到人生的意义时,已度过了半辈子.

sentence.English: Life is just a series of trying to make up your mind.
sentence.Chinese: 生活只是由一系列下决心的努力所构成.

sentence.English: Life is like an onion: You peel it off one layer at a time,and sometimes you weep.
sentence.Chinese: 生活就象洋葱头:你只能一层一层地把它剥开,有时你还得流泪.

sentence.English: Life is like music. It must be composed by ear,feeling and instinct,not by rule.
sentence.Chinese: 人生如一首乐曲,要用乐感,感情和直觉去谱写.不能只按乐律行事.

sentence.English: Life is long if you know how to use it.
sentence.Chinese: 只要你善于利用它,生命就是长久的.

sentence.English: Life is made up of little things.
sentence.Chinese: 生活是由许多小事构成的.

sentence.English: Life is measured by thought and action, not by time.
sentence.Chinese: 衡量生命的尺度是思想和行为,而不是时间.

sentence.English: Life is not all beer and skittles.
sentence.Chinese: 人生并非只是啤酒和九柱戏./ 人生并不全是吃喝玩乐.

sentence.English: Life is painting a picture,not doing a sum.
sentence.Chinese: 生活是绘画,不是做算术.

sentence.English: Life is real,life is earnest.
sentence.Chinese: 人生真实,人生诚挚.

sentence.English: Life is short and time is swift.
sentence.Chinese: 生命短暂,光阴飞逝.

sentence.English: Life is sweet.
sentence.Chinese: 人生是美好的.

sentence.English: Life is ten percent what you make it and ninety percent how you take it.
sentence.Chinese: 生活有百分之十在于你如何塑造它,有百分之九十在于你如何对待它.

sentence.English: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions form insufficient premises.
sentence.Chinese: 生活是一种艺术,要在不充足的前提下得出充足的结论.

sentence.English: Life is too short to waste.
sentence.Chinese: 生命短促,不容浪费.

sentence.English: Life lies not in living but in liking.
sentence.Chinese: 生活的意义并不在于活着,而在于爱好人生.

sentence.English: Life means struggle.
sentence.Chinese: 生活就是斗争.

sentence.English: Life without a friend is death without a witness.
sentence.Chinese: 没有朋友的生活等于孤独一人死去.

sentence.English: Life would be too smooth if it had no rubs in it.
sentence.Chinese: 生活若无波折险阻,就会过于平淡无奇.

sentence.English: Light not a candle to the sun.
sentence.Chinese: 不要对着太阳点蜡烛。/日既出矣，爝火可熄。

sentence.English: Like author, like book.
sentence.Chinese: 书如其人。

sentence.English: Like begets like.
sentence.Chinese: 龙生龙，凤生凤。

sentence.English: Like coral insects multitudinous. The minutes are whereof our life is made.
sentence.Chinese: 就象无以计数的珊瑚虫那样, 我们的一生是由分分秒秒构成的.

sentence.English: Like knows like
sentence.Chinese: 人识其类。

sentence.English: Lilies are whitest in a blackamoor's hand.
sentence.Chinese: 黑人手中的百合花最白。

sentence.English: Listen to both sides and you will be enlightened,heed only one side and you will be benighted.
sentence.Chinese: 兼听则明,偏信则暗.

sentence.English: Listen to the voice of experience, but also make use of your brain.
sentence.Chinese: 要听经验之谈,也要自己思考.

sentence.English: Little and often fills the purse.
sentence.Chinese: 多省小钱成大富.

sentence.English: Little chips light great fires.
sentence.Chinese: 星星之火,可以燎原.

sentence.English: Little goods little care.
sentence.Chinese: 钱财少,不烦恼.

sentence.English: Little intermeddling makes good friends.
sentence.Chinese: 朋友的事情不介入,友谊长存情谊深.

sentence.English: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune, but great minds rise above it.
sentence.Chinese: 渺小的人被不幸压倒,伟大的人则压倒不幸.

sentence.English: Little pigeons can carry great messages.
sentence.Chinese: 小小的信鸽能带重要的信息.

sentence.English: Little things please little minds.
sentence.Chinese: 小事满足小志者./胸无大志,事事称心.

sentence.English: Live and learn. /Keep on learning as long as you live.
sentence.Chinese: 活到老学到老.

sentence.English: Live as long as you may, the first twenty years are the longest half of your life.
sentence.Chinese: 不管你活得多久,头二十年都是你一生中最长的一半.

sentence.English: Live as though you intend to live forever,and word as though your strength were limitless.
sentence.Chinese: 要这样生活,仿佛你寿命永恒.要这样工作, 仿佛你精力无穷.

sentence.English: Live not to eat, but eat to live.
sentence.Chinese: 不要为了吃饭活着,而要为了活着吃饭.

sentence.English: Living well is the best revenge.
sentence.Chinese: 活得好就是对敌人最好的报复.

sentence.English: Living without an aim is like sailing without a compass.
sentence.Chinese: 生活没有目标就象航海没有罗盘.

sentence.English: Look on both sides of the shield.
sentence.Chinese: 看问题要从两面看。

sentence.English: Look on the bright side of things.
sentence.Chinese: 要看事物的光明面.

sentence.English: Loooking from this hill,you think the opposite hill is higher;but after climbing up there,you can't find wood to make a fire.
sentence.Chinese: 这山看来那山高，到了那山没柴烧。

sentence.English: Love and cough cannot be hid.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情象咳嗽,压也压不住.

sentence.English: Love asks faith, and faith firmness.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情要求信任,信任要求坚定.

sentence.English: Love begets love.
sentence.Chinese: 爱爱相生.

sentence.English: Love does not consist in gazing at each other but in looking outward together in the same direction.
sentence.Chinese: 相爱不表现在互相含情脉脉地对视,而表现在朝着同一个方向向外看.

sentence.English: Love endures only when the lovers love many things together and not merely each other.
sentence.Chinese: 情人不仅彼此相爱,而且有许多共同爱好时,爱才能持久.

sentence.English: Love is a dream; but after one kiss one awakens to find it the truth.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情是一场梦;但一吻之后你会醒悟到它是真实的.

sentence.English: Love is a symphony in which the sweetest notes are kisses.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情是一首交响曲,其中最美妙的音符是吻.

sentence.English: Love is all very well in its way, but friendship is much higher.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情自有其美好处,可是友谊更可贵.

sentence.English: Love is blind.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情是盲目的.

sentence.English: Love is neither bought nor sold.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情不能买卖.

sentence.English: Love is stronger than death.
sentence.Chinese: 爱的力量大于死亡./ 爱情能战胜死神.
