sentence.English: Love is the lodestone of life.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情是生活的磁石.

sentence.English: Love is the mother of love.
sentence.Chinese: 情生情,爱生爱.

sentence.English: Love is the reward of love.
sentence.Chinese: 爱是对爱的报答.

sentence.English: Love is the touchstone of virtue.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情是美德的试金石.

sentence.English: Love laughs at locksmiths.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情嘲笑锁匠. /爱情能克服困难.

sentence.English: Love lives in cottages as well as in courts.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情不分贫贱与富贵.

sentence.English: Love me little,love me long.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情应细水长流.

sentence.English: Love me,love my dog.
sentence.Chinese: 爱屋及乌.

sentence.English: Love victory, but despise the pride of triumph.
sentence.Chinese: 要爱胜利，但不要为胜利而骄傲。

sentence.English: Love will find a way.
sentence.Chinese: 爱心所至,金石为开.

sentence.English: Make hay while the sun shines.
sentence.Chinese: 趁着大晴天,赶紧晒饲草.

sentence.English: Make it a point to do something every day that you don't want to do. This is the golden rule for acquiring the habit of doing your duty without pain.
sentence.Chinese: 坚持每天做一点不愿意做的事。这是养成乐意尽职习惯的金科玉律。

sentence.English: Make the best of a bad bargain.
sentence.Chinese: 应善处逆境.

sentence.English: Make yourself necessary to someone.
sentence.Chinese: 使自己成为别人需要的人.

sentence.English: Man aspires after happiness and trees wait for the advent of spring.
sentence.Chinese: 人望幸福树望春.

sentence.English: Man can climb to the highest summit,but he cannot dwell there long.
sentence.Chinese: 人可以爬到最高峰，但他不能在那儿久住。

sentence.English: Man can only be free through mastery of himself.
sentence.Chinese: 只有通过掌握自己,才能使自己得到解放.

sentence.English: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has courage to lose sight of the shore.
sentence.Chinese: 人只有鼓起勇气,告别海岸,才能发现新的大洋.

sentence.English: Man is not made for defeat.
sentence.Chinese: 创造人不是为了让他遭受失败. /人不是为失败而生的.

sentence.English: Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps, for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are and what they ought bo be.
sentence.Chinese: 人是唯一会哭和笑的动物,因为他是唯一能区别事物的现状和事物应该有的状态的动物.

sentence.English: Man loves company even if it is only that of a small burning candle.
sentence.Chinese: 人喜欢伴侣,哪怕只是一根点着的小蜡烛也好.

sentence.English: Man proposes, God disposes.
sentence.Chinese: 谋事在人，戒事在天。

sentence.English: Man struggles upwards; water flows downwards.
sentence.Chinese: 人往高处走,水往低处流,

sentence.English: Man will become better only when you will make him see what he is like.
sentence.Chinese: 只有使一个人看清他自己的为人,他才能变得更好.

sentence.English: Man's extremity is God's opportunity.
sentence.Chinese: 逆境是上帝考验人的良机.

sentence.English: Manners make the man.
sentence.Chinese: 举止见人品。

sentence.English: Manners maketh man.
sentence.Chinese: 举止造人品.

sentence.English: Many a grain of sand piled up will make a pagoda.
sentence.Chinese: 聚沙成塔.

sentence.English: Many a little makes a mickle.
sentence.Chinese: 积少成多;集腋成裘.

sentence.English: Many a man's reputation would not know his character if they met on the street.
sentence.Chinese: 许多人的名声如果在街上遇到自己的品德会互相不认识。

sentence.English: Many hands make light work.
sentence.Chinese: 众擎易举. /人多好办事./ 众人拾柴火焰高.

sentence.English: Many people's tombstones should read:”Died at 30, buriied at 60.”
sentence.Chinese: 许多人的墓碑上应该刻上:”三十而死,六旬而葬.”

sentence.English: Many words hurt more than swords.
sentence.Chinese: 刀伤有法治, 舌伤无药医.

sentence.English: Many words will not fill a bushel.
sentence.Chinese: 空言无补于事。

sentence.English: Marriage is a covered dish.
sentence.Chinese: 婚姻是一道盖着的菜.

sentence.English: Marriage is like vitamins: we supplement each other's minimum daily requirements.
sentence.Chinese: 婚姻象维他命丸:我们彼此互相补充每天的最低需要.

sentence.English: Marriage makes or mars a man.
sentence.Chinese: 婚姻可使人成功,也可使人失败.

sentence.English: Marry in haste, and repent at leisure.
sentence.Chinese: 匆促结婚必后悔.

sentence.English: Marry thy like.
sentence.Chinese: 结婚须找同类人.

sentence.English: Mathematics possesses not only truth, but supreme beauty-a beauty cold and austere. like that of sculpture.
sentence.Chinese: 数学不仅拥有真理，而且拥有至上的美——一种冷静而严肃、犹如雕塑那样的 美。

sentence.English: Maturity is the ability to do a job whether or not you are supervised,to carry money without spending it and to bear an injustice without wanting to get even.
sentence.Chinese: 无论有没有人监督都能做好工作，身上有钱而不花，受到不公正的待遇而不求报复，这便是成熟。

sentence.English: May the best of this year be the worst of next.
sentence.Chinese: 但愿明年最坏的事也和今年最好的事那么好。

sentence.English: Mean men admire wealth; great men, glory.
sentence.Chinese: 庸人爱财富,伟人爱荣誉.

sentence.English: Medicines are not meant to live on.
sentence.Chinese: 药物可治病，不能当饭吃。

sentence.English: Mediocrities can explain everything,and are surprised at nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 庸人能解释一切,而且对什么都不会感到意外.

sentence.English: Men are afraid of becoming famous, just as pigs afraid of fattening. /Fame portends trouble for men just as fattening does for pigs./ A famed person and a fattened pig are alike in danger.
sentence.Chinese: 人怕出名猪怕壮.

sentence.English: Men are known by their companions.
sentence.Chinese: 观其友而知其人.

sentence.English: Men are not to be measured in inches.
sentence.Chinese: 人不可以寸量。 / 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量。

sentence.English: Men at some time are masters of their fates.
sentence.Chinese: 人有时是命运的主人.

sentence.English: Men leap over where the hedge is lowest.
sentence.Chinese: 欲跃篱笆者,必选低矮处.

sentence.English: Men learn by their sufferings more than by any other teaching.
sentence.Chinese: 从自己的苦难中学到的东西胜过别人的教导.

sentence.English: Men may doubt what you say,but they will believe what you do.
sentence.Chinese: 别人可能怀疑你说的话，但他们会相信你的行动。

sentence.English: Men may meet but mountains never.
sentence.Chinese: 人生何处不相逢.

sentence.English: Men only weep when deeply grieved.
sentence.Chinese: 男儿有泪不轻弹，皆因未到伤心处。

sentence.English: Miracles sometimes occur, but one has to work terribly for them.
sentence.Chinese: 奇迹有时候是会发生的,但是你得为之而拼命地努力.

sentence.English: Misfortunes tell us what fortune is.
sentence.Chinese: 不经灾难不知福.

sentence.English: Modesty helps one to make progress; conceit makes one lag behind.
sentence.Chinese: 谦虚使人进步，骄傲使人落后。

sentence.English: Money lost,little lost; time lost,everything lost.
sentence.Chinese: 失去金钱损失不大;失去时间则失去一切.

sentence.English: Money can buy off a mean person, but it can never buy off truth.
sentence.Chinese: 金钱可以收买小人,却不能收买真理.

sentence.English: Money is a bottomless sea, in which honour, conscience, and truth may be drowned.
sentence.Chinese: 金钱是深不可测的海洋,能淹没廉耻,良心和是非感.

sentence.English: Money is a good servant but a bad master.
sentence.Chinese: 金钱是个好仆人,又是个坏主人.

sentence.English: Money is round.It rolls away.
sentence.Chinese: 圆圆钱币,滚走容易.

sentence.English: Money may be the husk of many things,but not the kernel. It brings you food,but not appetite;medicine,but not health; acquaintances,but not friends; servants,but not loyalty; days of joy,but not peace of happiness.
sentence.Chinese: 金钱可以是许多东西的谷皮,却不是里面的谷粒.它能带来食物,却带不来胃口;能带来药,却带不来健康;能带来相识,却带不来友谊,能带来仆人,却带不来他们的忠心;能带来享受,却带不来幸福的宁静

sentence.English: Money spent on the brain is never spent in vain.
sentence.Chinese: 用于教育之金钱决不虚掷。

sentence.English: Morale should be boosted, not dampened.
sentence.Chinese: 气可鼓而不可泄.

sentence.English: Morality may consist solely in the courage of making a choice.
sentence.Chinese: 品德可能仅仅在于有勇气作出抉择.

sentence.English: More people are flattered into virtue than are bullied out of vice.
sentence.Chinese: 因受到赞扬而行善的人比因受到威胁而不作恶的人要多。

sentence.English: More than enough is too much.
sentence.Chinese: 超过所需就是太多.

sentence.English: More trouble is caused in this world by indiscreet answers than by indiscreet questions.
sentence.Chinese: 轻率的回答在这个世界上造成的麻烦比轻率的问题造成的麻烦多得多。

sentence.English: Most folks are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
sentence.Chinese: 对大多数人来说,他们认定自已有多幸福,就有多幸福.

sentence.English: Most of the trouble in the world is caused by people wanting to be important.
sentence.Chinese: 世界上大部分的麻烦都是要想成为伟大人物的人搞出来的。

sentence.English: Most quarrels are inevitable at the time; incredible afterwards.
sentence.Chinese: 大多数吵架当时都是不可避免的，事后都是令人难以置信的。

sentence.English: Murder will out.
sentence.Chinese: 恶行终会败露。

sentence.English: My aspiration is that the aged live an easy life,friends have faith in me and the youth cherish the memory of me.
sentence.Chinese: 老者安之，朋友信之，少者怀之。

sentence.English: My motto is: Contented with little, yet wishing for more.
sentence.Chinese: 我的座右铭是:满足于一点儿,但是希望有更多.

sentence.English: National progress is the sum of individual industry, energy and uprightness,as national decay is of individual idleness,selfishness and vice.
sentence.Chinese: 国家之前进源于个人的勤奋,奋发,正直,正如国家之衰落由于个人的懒惰,自私,堕落.

sentence.English: Natural abilities are like natural plants that need pruning by study.
sentence.Chinese: 天生的才干如同天生的植物一样,需要靠学习来修剪.

sentence.English: Nature has given us two ears,two eyes and one tongue, to the end that we should hear and see more than speak.
sentence.Chinese: 老天给人双耳双眼一张嘴，为使我们多听多看少讲话。

sentence.English: Nature is wonderful. A million years ago she didn't know we were going to need glasses, but look where she put our ears.
sentence.Chinese: 造化真妙。百万年前它并不知道我们会要戴眼镜，可是瞧瞧它把我们的耳朵放在什么地方。

sentence.English: Necessity and opportunity may make a coward valiant.
sentence.Chinese: 需要和机会可以使懦夫变得大胆.

sentence.English: Needs must when the devil drives.
sentence.Chinese: 天要下雨，娘要嫁人。

sentence.English: Neither adjust your shoe in a melon patch, nor your hat under a plum tree.
sentence.Chinese: 瓜田不纳履，李下不整冠。

sentence.English: Never ”for the sake of peace and quiet” deny your own experience or conviction.
sentence.Chinese: 永远不要”为了息事宁人”而否认自己的经验或信念。

sentence.English: Never bow to authority, but always tip your hat.
sentence.Chinese: 应向有权者敬礼，不应向他屈膝。

sentence.English: Never do things by halves.
sentence.Chinese: 做事不可半途而废.

sentence.English: Never fear a hard-beaked bird,but beware of a heart-eating worm.
sentence.Chinese: 不怕硬嘴鸟，最怕蛀心虫。

sentence.English: Never fear shadows. They simply mean there's a light shining somewhere nearby.
sentence.Chinese: 不要害怕黑影。它只不过意味着附近有光在照耀。

sentence.English: Never fry a fish till it is caught.
sentence.Chinese: 鱼未捉到手，不要忙着煎。

sentence.English: Never hope for too much.
sentence.Chinese: 不要期望太多.

sentence.English: Never let your feet run faster than your shoes.
sentence.Chinese: 不要让你的脚跳得比你的鞋子快。

sentence.English: Never make two bites of a cherry.
sentence.Chinese: 一颗樱桃不要分两口吃. /做事不要拖泥带水.

sentence.English: Never offer to teach fish to swim.
sentence.Chinese: 切忌班门弄斧。

sentence.English: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
sentence.Chinese: 今日事今日毕. /勿将今事待明日.

sentence.English: Never say ”die'.
sentence.Chinese: 永远不要说” 完了”.

sentence.English: Never seem wiser, nor more learned, than the people you are with.
sentence.Chinese: 与人相处切忌卖弄聪明与学识。

sentence.English: Never spend your money before you have it.
sentence.Chinese: 钱财未到手,不可提前花.

sentence.English: Never trust a man who speaks well of everybody.
sentence.Chinese: 谁的好话都说的人不可信赖.

sentence.English: Never try to prove what nobody doubts.
sentence.Chinese: 无人怀疑的事无须费力去证实.

sentence.English: Never was a good work done without great effort.
sentence.Chinese: 不花大力气干不好工作.

sentence.English: Never write what your dare not sign.
sentence.Chinese: 不要写不敢署名的文章.

sentence.English: New brooms sweep clean. / A new official applies strict measures.
sentence.Chinese: 新官上任三把火.

sentence.English: Newborn calves are not afraid of tigers.
sentence.Chinese: 初生牛犊不怕虎.

sentence.English: Newspapers are the world's mirror.
sentence.Chinese: 报纸是世界的镜子。

sentence.English: Ninety-li is only half of a hundred-li journey.
sentence.Chinese: 行百里者半九十.

sentence.English: No animal ever invented anything so bad as drunkness-or so good as drink.
sentence.Chinese: 没有动物发明过象喝醉这样糟糕的事——也没有发明过象饮酒这样美好的享受。

sentence.English: No autumn friut without spring blossoms.
sentence.Chinese: 没有春天百花开,哪来秋天果满枝.

sentence.English: No cross,no crown.
sentence.Chinese: 未经苦难,得不到荣冠.

sentence.English: No entertainment is so cheap as reading nor any pleasure so lasting.
sentence.Chinese: 没有比读书更便宜的娱乐,也没有比读书更持久的欢乐.

sentence.English: No hand can make the clock strike for me the hours that are passed.
sentence.Chinese: 光阴如流水,一去不复返.

sentence.English: No herb will cure love.
sentence.Chinese: 相思病无药医.

sentence.English: No legacy is so rich as honesty.
sentence.Chinese: 没有一笔遗产能象诚实一样丰厚。

sentence.English: No living man all things can.
sentence.Chinese: 世上没有万能的人.

sentence.English: No man can lose what he never had.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人从来没有过的东西,他永远不会失去.

sentence.English: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人不能侍奉两个主人；不是恨这个爱那个，就是重这个轻那个。

sentence.English: No man is a hero to his valet.
sentence.Chinese: 在最贴身的人眼中，谁也充不了伟人。

sentence.English: No man is born wise or learned.
sentence.Chinese: 人非生而知之.

sentence.English: No man is content with his lot.
sentence.Chinese: 没有人对自己的境遇感到满足.

sentence.English: No man is happy but by comparison.
sentence.Chinese: 人的幸福都是比较而言的。

sentence.English: No man is indispensable.
sentence.Chinese: 没有一个人是不可缺少的。/少了谁地球也转。

sentence.English: No man is infallible.
sentence.Chinese: 没有人不犯错误。

sentence.English: No man is rich enough to buy back his past.
sentence.Chinese: 再富有的人也买不回自己的过去.

sentence.English: No man is so old,but thinks he may yet live another year.
sentence.Chinese: 人活百年不嫌多.

sentence.English: No man is the whole of himself; his friends are the rest of him.
sentence.Chinese: 任何人自己都不是完整的; 他的朋友是他的其余部分.

sentence.English: No man is useless in this world who lightens the burden of someone else.
sentence.Chinese: 在这个世界上能为别人减轻负担的人都是有用的.

sentence.English: No man loves his fetters,be they made of gold.
sentence.Chinese: 即使是金子做的镣铐，也没有人喜欢。

sentence.English: No matter in what high esteem you are held,always have the courage to say to yourself.”I am always ignorant.”
sentence.Chinese: 不管你的威望有多高,要永远有勇气对自己说:”我永远是无知的.”

sentence.English: No mill, no meal.
sentence.Chinese: 不磨面,没饭吃.

sentence.English: No one but the wearer knows where the shoe pinches.
sentence.Chinese: 穿鞋的人自己知道哪儿夹脚。

sentence.English: No one can be perfectly free till all are free;no one can be perfectly moral till all are moral;no one can be perfectly happy till all are happy.
sentence.Chinese: 在所有的人都获得自由之前，没有一个人能完全自由；在所有的人都有道德之前，没有一个人能被称为完全有道德；在所有的人都幸福之前，没有一个人能完全幸福！

sentence.English: No one is a fool always, every one sometimes.
sentence.Chinese: 没有终生的傻瓜,也没有终生不当傻瓜的人.

sentence.English: No one is rich enough to do without a neighbour.
sentence.Chinese: 人略钜富,亦需邻居.

sentence.English: No pleasure without pain.
sentence.Chinese: 乐中必有苦.

sentence.English: No question is ever settled until it is settled right.
sentence.Chinese: 正确解决问题才算真正解决。

sentence.English: No road of flowers lead to glory.
sentence.Chinese: 没有一条通向光荣的道路是铺满鲜花的.

sentence.English: No song, no supper.
sentence.Chinese: 不出力,不得食.

sentence.English: No sweet without sweat.
sentence.Chinese: 幸福来自汗水.

sentence.English: No way is impossible to courage.
sentence.Chinese: 勇士面前无险路.

sentence.English: Noise proves nothing. Often a hen who has merely laid an egg cackles as if she had laid an asteroid.
sentence.Chinese: 噪声不能证明什么。母鸡产下一只蛋，往往大声啼叫，好象产下小行星似的。

sentence.English: None but the brave deserves the fair.
sentence.Chinese: 只有勇士搭配美人.

sentence.English: None is of freedom or life deserving unless he daily conquers it anew.
sentence.Chinese: 只有每天再度战胜生活并夺取自由的人,才配享受生活或自由.

sentence.English: None so blind as they who will not see.
sentence.Chinese: 不愿正视事实的人是瞎而又瞎的.

sentence.English: None so deaf as those who won't hear.
sentence.Chinese: 不愿听人的,比聋子还聋.

sentence.English: None so old that he hopes not for a year of life.
sentence.Chinese: 老寿星也不会嫌寿长.

sentence.English: Not ignorance,but the ignorance of ignorance,is the death of knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 不是无知本身,而是对无知的无知,才是知识的死亡.

sentence.English: Not good is it to harp on the same string.
sentence.Chinese: 不要老是弹一根弦。

sentence.English: Not keeping an appointment is an act of clear dishonesty. You may as well borrow a person's money as his time.
sentence.Chinese: 爽约显然是不诚实的行为.占人时间无异于借人钱.

sentence.English: Nothing comes out of the sack but what was in it .
sentence.Chinese: 空袋倒不出豆. /无中不能生有.

sentence.English: Nothing in life is to be feared.It is only to be understood.
sentence.Chinese: 生活中没有可怕的东西,只有需要理解的东西.

sentence.English: Nothing in the world is difficult for one who sets his mind on it.
sentence.Chinese: 世上无难事,只怕有心人.

sentence.English: Nothing is a greater misfortune than not being able to bear misfortune.
sentence.Chinese: 经不起不幸是最大的不幸。

sentence.English: Nothing is better than a loyal friend.
sentence.Chinese: 什么也比不上一个忠实的朋友.

sentence.English: Nothing is dearer to a man than a friend in need.
sentence.Chinese: 患难之交最可贵.

sentence.English: Nothing is impossible to a willing heart.
sentence.Chinese: 心之所愿,无事不成.

sentence.English: Nothing is more precious than independence and freedom.
sentence.Chinese: 没有什么比独立自由更可宝贵的了.

sentence.English: Nothing is more terrible than ignorance in action.
sentence.Chinese: 最可怕的事莫过于无知而行动.

sentence.English: Nothing is worth more than a mind well instructed.
sentence.Chinese: 什么好也比不上教育好。

sentence.English: Nothing must be done hastily but killing of fleas.
sentence.Chinese: 除非要捉跳蚤,作事不可匆忙.

sentence.English: Nothing seek,nothing find.
sentence.Chinese: 无所求则无所获.

sentence.English: Nothing venture,nothing have.
sentence.Chinese: 不担风险就无收获.

sentence.English: Novelists should never allow themselves to weary of the study of real life.
sentence.Chinese: 小说家们永远不应对研究真实的生活感到厌烦。

sentence.English: Nurture passes nature.
sentence.Chinese: 教养胜过天性.

sentence.English: Observation is the best teacher.
sentence.Chinese: 观察是最好的老师.

sentence.English: Of all eloquence a nickname is the most concise, of all arguments the most unanswerable.
sentence.Chinese: 绰号是最简洁的雄辩,最无法反驳的论据.

sentence.English: Of all the possessions of this life, fame is the noblest; when the body has sunk into the dust,the great name still lives.
sentence.Chinese: 身外之物, 声誉最贵;人死之后,名声犹在.

sentence.English: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
sentence.Chinese: 老年和其它事物一样,要使之成功,必须从年轻时开始.

sentence.English: Old friends and old wine are best.
sentence.Chinese: 陈酒味醇,老友情深.

sentence.English: On Monday morning don't be looking for Saturday night.
sentence.Chinese: 别在开始工作时就想休息.

sentence.English: On earth there is nothing great but man;in the man there is nothing great but mind.
sentence.Chinese: 地球上唯一伟大的是人,人身上唯一伟大的是心灵.

sentence.English: On life's earnest battle they only prevail, who daily march onward and never say fail.
sentence.Chinese: 生活在顽强战斗中,只有每天不屈不挠奋勇向前的人才能取得胜利.

sentence.English: Once a beggar, always a beggar.
sentence.Chinese: 一次做乞丐，永远是乞丐。

sentence.English: Once bitten,twice shy.
sentence.Chinese: 吃一次亏,学一次乖.

sentence.English: Once virtue is lost, all is lost.
sentence.Chinese: 一旦丧失道德,便是丧失了一切.

sentence.English: One cannot help being old, but one can resist being aged.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人无法不变老,但是他可以抵制衰朽.

sentence.English: One cannot put back the clock.
sentence.Chinese: 时光不能倒流.

sentence.English: One cannot serve God and Mammon.
sentence.Chinese: 不能既拜上帝又拜财神。

sentence.English: One careless move may lose the whole game.
sentence.Chinese: 一着不慎, 满盘皆输.

sentence.English: One cloud is enough to eclipse all the sun.
sentence.Chinese: 片云足以遮全日。

sentence.English: One enemy is too many, and a hundred friends too few.
sentence.Chinese: 敌人一个也嫌多,朋友上百也嫌少.

sentence.English: One eyewitness is better than two hearers.
sentence.Chinese: 一个目睹者胜过两个道听途说的人. /耳听为虚,眼见为实.

sentence.English: One father is more than a hundred schoolmasters.
sentence.Chinese: 一个父亲，胜过百名教师。

sentence.English: One fifth of the people are against everything all the time.
sentence.Chinese: 有五分之一的人永远是反对一切的。

sentence.English: One flower does not make a spring.
sentence.Chinese: 一花独放不是春.

sentence.English: One gives nothing so liberally as advice.
sentence.Chinese: 不花钱出主意，谁人不乐意。

sentence.English: One good turn deserves another.
sentence.Chinese: 应以德报德。

sentence.English: One half of knowing what you want is knowing what you must give up before you get it.
sentence.Chinese: 知道想要什么,一半在于知道得到它之前必须放弃什么.

sentence.English: One in love fears no storm; he fears only the death of love.
sentence.Chinese: 恋爱者不会害怕暴风雨,他只担心爱情的终止.

sentence.English: One is never too old to learn.
sentence.Chinese: 人有老的时候,没有老得不能学的时候.

sentence.English: One link broken,the whole chain is broken.
sentence.Chinese: 一环断，全链断。/ 百尺之链，断于一环。

sentence.English: One loses by pride and gains by modesty.
sentence.Chinese: 满招损，谦受益。

sentence.English: One loses time seeking for words; one kiss brings understanding.
sentence.Chinese: 寻找言辞徒费时光,一吻即可得理解.

sentence.English: One love drives out another.
sentence.Chinese: 新的爱情来,旧的爱情去.

sentence.English: One machine can do the work of 50 ordinary men, but no machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
sentence.Chinese: 一台机器可以做五十个普通人的工作，但是没有任何机器能够做一个非凡的人的 工作。

sentence.English: One man's fault is another man's lesson.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人的过失是另一个人的教训.

sentence.English: One man,no man.
sentence.Chinese: 个人是渺小的.

sentence.English: One may overcome a thousand men in battle.but he who conquers himself is the greatest victor.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人能在战场上制胜千军,但只有战胜自己才是最伟大的胜利者.

sentence.English: One must draw back in order to leap better.
sentence.Chinese: 退后才能跳得更远.

sentence.English: One must draw the line somewhere.
sentence.Chinese: 干什么都应有个限度。

sentence.English: One never goes to the temple for no reason.
sentence.Chinese: 无事不登三宝殿。

sentence.English: One of the difficult tasks in this world is to convince a woman that even a bargain costs money.
sentence.Chinese: 世界上难办的事之一,是使女人相信便宜货也是要花钱的.

sentence.English: One of the greatest pleasures in life is conversation.
sentence.Chinese: 生活中最大的乐趣之一是交谈.

sentence.English: One of these days in none of these days.
sentence.Chinese: 拖延时日,终难实现. /终久要做,等于不做.

sentence.English: One pound of learning requires ten pounds of common sense to apply it.
sentence.Chinese: 一分学问,要辅以十分见识才能运用.

sentence.English: One should always live in the best company, whether it be of books or of men.
sentence.Chinese: 无论是人,是书,人生应与益友为伴 .

sentence.English: One should eat to live,not live to eat.
sentence.Chinese: 人生应为生而食,不应为食而生.

sentence.English: One strand of silk doesn't make a thread; one tree doesn't make a forest.
sentence.Chinese: 单丝不成线,独木不成林.

sentence.English: One swallow does not make a summer.
sentence.Chinese: 一燕飞来不成夏.

sentence.English: One thing I know, that is, know nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 有一件事我很清楚那,就是我无知

sentence.English: One thing I know:The only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
sentence.Chinese: 有一点我是知道的:在你们之中,只有那些愿意寻求并发现如何为别人服务的人,才是真正幸福的.

sentence.English: One today is worth two tomorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 一个今天抵得上两个明天.

sentence.English: One touch of nature makes the whole world kin.
sentence.Chinese: 自然情感的流露,使人们更亲近.

sentence.English: One tree does not make a forest.
sentence.Chinese: 独木不成林.

sentence.English: One volunteer is better than ten forced men.
sentence.Chinese: 一个志愿者胜过十个被迫者.

sentence.English: One who keeps abreast of the time remains young.
sentence.Chinese: 和时代并驾齐驱的人,永远年轻.

sentence.English: One wonderful thing about a vacation is that it makes you feel good enough to go back to work and poor enough so that you have to.
sentence.Chinese: 外出休假的妙处是既使你身心舒畅,愿意回去工作,又使你不名一文,不得不去工作.

sentence.English: One's ability falls short of one's wishes./ The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.
sentence.Chinese: 心有余而力不足。

sentence.English: One's sin will find one out.
sentence.Chinese: 坏事终归要败露。

sentence.English: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.
sentence.Chinese: 只有为别人而活,生命才有价值.

sentence.English: Only by working hard can we reap a bumper harvest.
sentence.Chinese: 只有通过辛勤的劳动才能收获丰硕的成果.

sentence.English: Only the person who has faith in himself is able to be faithful to others.
sentence.Chinese: 只有对自己有信念的人才能对别人守信用.

sentence.English: Only the selfless can be fearless.
sentence.Chinese: 无私才能无畏.

sentence.English: Only when one plunges into the powerful current of the times will one's life shine brilliantly.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人只有投身于伟大的时代洪流中,他的生命才会闪耀出光彩.

sentence.English: Open confession is good for the soul.
sentence.Chinese: 坦然承认错误，有益于灵魂。

sentence.English: Open different locks with different keys.
sentence.Chinese: 一把钥匙开一把锁。

sentence.English: Opinions should be formed with great caution-and changed with greater.
sentence.Chinese: 形成意见要慎重，改变意见要更慎重。

sentence.English: Opportunities do not wait.
sentence.Chinese: 机不可失,时不再来.

sentence.English: Opportunity is rare, and a wise man will never let it go by him.
sentence.Chinese: 机会难得,聪明人从不交臂失之.

sentence.English: Optimist:A man who gets treed by a lion but enjoys the scenery.
sentence.Chinese: 乐观主义者：被狮子逼上了树但仍然能欣赏风景的人。

sentence.English: Ordinary people think merely how they will spend time,a man of intellect tries to use it.
sentence.Chinese: 常人只想如何消磨时间,智者则努力利用时间.

sentence.English: Other people's defects are good teachers.
sentence.Chinese: 别人的缺点就是自己的好老师.

sentence.English: Other times,other manners.
sentence.Chinese: 隔代不同礼。

sentence.English: Our best thought comes form others.
sentence.Chinese: 我们最好的思想来源于他人.

sentence.English: Our bravest and best lessons are not learned through success,but through misadventure.
sentence.Chinese: 最好最妙的经验教训来自失利而非来自成功.

sentence.English: Our faults irritate us most when we see them in others.
sentence.Chinese: 自已的缺点在别人身上看到，最令我们讨厌。

sentence.English: Our greatest glory consists not in never falling but in rising every time we fall.
sentence.Chinese: 我们最值得自豪的不在于从不跌倒,而在于每次跌倒之后都爬起来.

sentence.English: Our mightiest feeling are always those which remain most unspoken.
sentence.Chinese: 最强烈的总是那些最缄默的感情。

sentence.English: Overeating will cause indigestion.
sentence.Chinese: 贪多嚼不烂.

sentence.English: Pain past is pleasure.
sentence.Chinese: 痛苦过去即欢乐.

sentence.English: Painting is silent poetry,and poetry is a speaking picture.
sentence.Chinese: 画是无言之诗，诗是有声之画。

sentence.English: Pardon all but thyself.
sentence.Chinese: 宽恕一切人，只是别宽恕自己。

sentence.English: Patience is a virtue.
sentence.Chinese: 忍耐是一种美德.

sentence.English: Patience is the ability to put up with people you'd like to put down.
sentence.Chinese: 能容忍你想羞辱的人，便是忍耐。

sentence.English: Patience! The windmill never strays in search of the wind.
sentence.Chinese: 耐心等待! 风车从不跑去找风.

sentence.English: Patience:A minor form of despair disguised as virtu.
sentence.Chinese: 耐心：被伪装成美德的轻度的绝望。

sentence.English: Pen and ink is wit's plough.
sentence.Chinese: 笔墨是才智之犁.

sentence.English: People don't resent having nothing nearly as much as too little.
sentence.Chinese: 人们埋怨的常常是太少,而不是没有.

sentence.English: People generally quarrel because they cannot argue.
sentence.Chinese: 通常人们是因为不会辩理才吵架的。

sentence.English: People who cannot find time for recreation are Obliged sooner or later to find time for illness.
sentence.Chinese: 没有时间娱乐的人，迟早得有时间生病。

sentence.English: People who fight fire with fire usually end up with ashes.
sentence.Chinese: 以火攻火者，结果只剩一片灰烬。

sentence.English: Perfect understanding will sometimes almost extinguish pleasure.
sentence.Chinese: 完全的理解有时几乎会使乐趣消失.

sentence.English: Perfection is finally attained, not when there is no longer to add, but when there is no longer anything to take away.
sentence.Chinese: 最终达到完美，不在于无可增添，而在于无可删减。

sentence.English: Perseverance is failing nineteen times and succeeding the twentieth.
sentence.Chinese: 坚韧不拔,意味着失败十九次,而第二十次终于成功.

sentence.English: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after another.
sentence.Chinese: 坚持并非一次长跑,而是一次接一次的无数短跑.

sentence.English: Perseverance is the only road to success.
sentence.Chinese: 百折不挠是通向成功的唯一道路.

sentence.English: Personality is to man what perfume is to a flower.
sentence.Chinese: 人的品格,犹如花的香味.

sentence.English: Pessimist:One who, when he has the choice of two evils,chooses both.
sentence.Chinese: 悲观主义者：可在两种不幸中选择一个时而两者都选的人。

sentence.English: Pity is akin to love.
sentence.Chinese: 怜悯生爱.

sentence.English: Plain living and high thinking.
sentence.Chinese: 生活要朴素,情操要高尚.

sentence.English: Plan your consumption carefully on a long term basis, and you need not worry when a famine occurs.
sentence.Chinese: 细水长流,遇灾不愁.

sentence.English: Please all and you please none.
sentence.Chinese: 要面面俱到者，面面不到。

sentence.English: Plough deeper and harvest more.
sentence.Chinese: 深耕细作,多打粮秣.

sentence.English: Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings.
sentence.Chinese: 诗乃自发溢出的强烈的情感。

sentence.English: Politeness costs nothing and gains everything.
sentence.Chinese: 礼貌不用花一分钱，却能赢得一切。

sentence.English: Popularity?It's glory's small change.
sentence.Chinese: 名望吗?那不过是光荣的零头.

sentence.English: Poverty is the test of civility and the touchstone of friendship.
sentence.Chinese: 贫穷是对人情的检验,也是友谊的试金石.

sentence.English: Poverty of speech is the outward evidence of poverty of mind.
sentence.Chinese: 语言贫乏说明头脑空虚。

sentence.English: Poverty shows us who our friends are and who are our enemies.
sentence.Chinese: 贫穷让我们看出谁是朋友,谁是敌人.

sentence.English: Poverty tries friends.
sentence.Chinese: 贫穷考验朋友.

sentence.English: Practise what you preach.
sentence.Chinese: 躬行己说,身体力行. /自己怎么说,就得怎么干.

sentence.English: Preparedness prevents calamity./ Where there is precaution, there is no danger.
sentence.Chinese: 有备无患.

sentence.English: Presumption begins in ignorance and ends in ruin.
sentence.Chinese: 自以为是由无知开始,以毁灭告终.

sentence.English: Prettiness makes no pottage.
sentence.Chinese: 漂亮不能当饭吃.

sentence.English: Prevention is better than cure.
sentence.Chinese: 治病不如防病。

sentence.English: Pride and grace dwell never in one place.
sentence.Chinese: 傲慢与优雅决不共存。

sentence.English: Pride breakfasted with Plenty, dined with Poverty,and supped with Infamy.
sentence.Chinese: 骄者往往早餐丰盛,午餐寒酸,晚餐时声名狼藉.

sentence.English: Pride goes before fall.
sentence.Chinese: 骄者必败。

sentence.English: Pride hurts, modesty benefits.
sentence.Chinese: 满招损，谦受益。

sentence.English: Pride increases our enemies, but puts our friends to flight.
sentence.Chinese: 骄傲招来敌人,驱走朋友.

sentence.English: Pride, the most dangerous of all faults, proceeds from want of sense, or want of thought.
sentence.Chinese: 骄傲是最危险的过错，它产生于缺乏见识，或缺乏思考。

sentence.English: Principles without programs are platitudes.
sentence.Chinese: 没有纲领的原则只是陈词滥调。

sentence.English: Problems can best be tackled by experts.
sentence.Chinese: 万事怕行家.

sentence.English: Problems loom large when men don't.
sentence.Chinese: 困难象弹簧,你弱它就强.

sentence.English: Procrastination is the thief of time.
sentence.Chinese: 拖延为时间之贼.

sentence.English: Progress is not created by contented peodle.
sentence.Chinese: 满足的人不能创造进步.

sentence.English: Progress is the activity of today and the assurance of tomorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 进步乃今日之努力,又为明日的保证.

sentence.English: Progress is the activity of today and the assurance of tomorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 进步是今天的活动，明天的保证。

sentence.English: Promises must be kept and action must be resolute./ Always be true in word and resolute in deed.
sentence.Chinese: 言必信，行必果。

sentence.English: Propaganda is the art of persuading others of what one does not believe oneself.
sentence.Chinese: 宣传是劝说别人去相信自己不相信的东西的艺术。

sentence.English: Prudence is a good thing; forethought is wisdom.
sentence.Chinese: 谨慎小心是好事；深谋远虑是明智。

sentence.English: Public officers are the servants and agents of the people, to execute the laws which the people have made.
sentence.Chinese: 政府官员是人民的公仆和代理人，应执行人民制定的法律。

sentence.English: Put all your eggs in one basket--and watch that basket.
sentence.Chinese: 把所有的鸡蛋放在一只篮子里,然后看好这只篮子.

sentence.English: Put your hand no further than your sleeve will reach.
sentence.Chinese: 量入为出.

sentence.English: Quality matters more than quantity.
sentence.Chinese: 质比量重要.

sentence.English: Rashness borrows the name of courage, but it is of another race, and nothing allied to that virtue; the one descended a direct line from prudence, the other from folly and presumption.
sentence.Chinese: 鲁莽借用了勇气的名义，但属于另一类，和美德毫无关系；勇气直接裔于谨慎 ，鲁莽则裔于愚蠢和狂妄。

sentence.English: Reading enriches the mind.
sentence.Chinese: 开卷有益.

sentence.English: Reading is like permitting a man to talk a long time, and refusing you the right to answer.
sentence.Chinese: 读书犹如允许一个人作长时间的谈话,却不给你答复的权利.

sentence.English: Reading makes a full man, conference a ready man, and writing an exact man.
sentence.Chinese: 阅读使人渊博,会谈使人机敏,写作使人严谨.

sentence.English: Reading without comprehension is like eating with no relish.
sentence.Chinese: 读书不知意,等于嚼树皮.

sentence.English: Reading without reflecting is like eating without digesting.
sentence.Chinese: 读而不思,犹食而不化.

sentence.English: Real charity doesn't care if it's taxdeductible or not.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的慈善捐款不在乎捐款是否可以免税。

sentence.English: Real friendship does not freeze in winter.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的友谊遇到寒冬也不会冻结.

sentence.English: Reason rules all things.
sentence.Chinese: 理智统治一切.

sentence.English: Red sky at night,shepherd's delight;red sky in the morning,shephered's warning.
sentence.Chinese: 傍晚天红，牧羊人高兴；早晨天红，牧羊人当心。

sentence.English: Religion is in heart, not in the knees.
sentence.Chinese: 信仰在心里,并不在膝下.

sentence.English: Remember that time is money. Dost thoulove life? Then do not squander time,for that's the stuff life is made of .
sentence.Chinese: 记住,时间就是金钱.你热爱生命吗?那就不要浪费时间,因为生命是由时间所组成的.

sentence.English: Remember that you took a wrong way to a place, and you can have a smooth trip home.
sentence.Chinese: 记着去时走错的路，回来时就顺利了。

sentence.English: Render threrfore unto Caesar the things that are Caesar's; and unto God the things that are God's.
sentence.Chinese: 凯撒的物当归还给凯撒，上帝的物当归还给上帝。

sentence.English: Repent what's past, avoid what is to come.
sentence.Chinese: 前事不忘，后事之师。

sentence.English: Respect a man, he will do the same.
sentence.Chinese: 尊重别人，别人就会尊重你。

sentence.English: Respect yourself, or no one else will respect you.
sentence.Chinese: 人必自敬,然后人敬之.

sentence.English: Reward lies ahead of diligence,but nothing is gained by indolence.
sentence.Chinese: 勤有功,嬉无益.

sentence.English: Riches serve a wise man but commands a fool.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明人使财富为自已服务,傻瓜却任它支配自已.

sentence.English: Rome was not built in a day.
sentence.Chinese: 罗马不是一天建成的./ 伟业非一日之功.

sentence.English: Running water does not get stale; a doorhinge is never worm-eaten.
sentence.Chinese: 流水不腐，户枢不蠹。

sentence.English: Save early and avoid want later. / Better spare at brim than at bottom.
sentence.Chinese: 及早节省免得以后受穷.

sentence.English: Say the right thing at the right time,and keep still most of the time.
sentence.Chinese: 只在恰当的时候说恰当的话，大部分时间则不要说话。

sentence.English: Saying and doing are two things.
sentence.Chinese: 说与做是两回事.

sentence.English: Saying is one thing and doing another.
sentence.Chinese: 说是一回事,做是另一回事. /说来容易做来难.

sentence.English: Science must not be a selfish pleasure. Those who have the good fortune to be able to devote themselves to scientific pursuits must be first to place their knowlege at the service of humanity.
sentence.Chinese: 科学绝不是一种自私自利的享乐.有幸能够致力于科学研究的人,首先应该拿自己的学识为人类服务.

sentence.English: Score twice before you cut once. / Look before you leap.
sentence.Chinese: 三思而后行.

sentence.English: Second thoughts are best.
sentence.Chinese: 再思为上.

sentence.English: Seeing much, suffering much, and studying much, are the three pillars of learning.
sentence.Chinese: 多见识,多受苦,多学习,是知识的三大来源.

sentence.English: Seize opportunity by the beard, for it is bald behind.
sentence.Chinese: 见了机会,就要抓他的胡子,因为他后面没有头发.

sentence.English: Seize the present; trust the future as little as you may.
sentence.Chinese: 抓住现在;尽量少指望未来.

sentence.English: Seize this day! Begin now! Each day is a new life.Seize it, Live it .For in today already walks tomorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 把握好今天!现在就开始!每天都是一次新生.把握住它,好好生活,因为今天未逝时,明天已开始.

sentence.English: Self-confidence and self-reliance are the mainstays of a strong character.
sentence.Chinese: 自信和自力更生是坚强的柱石。

sentence.English: Self-control is courage under another form.
sentence.Chinese: 自我克制是勇气的另一种形式.

sentence.English: Self-discipline is when your conscience tells you to do something and you don't talk back.
sentence.Chinese: 听从良心劝告不违背良心办事即谓之有自约能力。

sentence.English: Self-praise is no recommendation.
sentence.Chinese: 自夸不足为自荐。

sentence.English: Self-trust is the first secret of success.
sentence.Chinese: 自信是成功的首要秘诀.

sentence.English: Shallow streams make most din.
sentence.Chinese: 溪浅声喧。

sentence.English: Shared joy is double joy and shared sorrow is half-sorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 与人同乐则乐倍之,与人分忧则忧半之.

sentence.English: Sharp tools make good work.
sentence.Chinese: 工欲善其事,必先利其器.

sentence.English: Sharpening your axe will not delay your job of cutting wood.
sentence.Chinese: 磨刀不误砍柴工.

sentence.English: Short speeches are not always the best, but the best speeches are always short.
sentence.Chinese: 短话不一定是最好的，但最好的话却总是短的。

sentence.English: Silence gives consent.
sentence.Chinese: 沉默就是赞成。

sentence.English: Silence is one of the hardest arguments to refute.
sentence.Chinese: 沉默是最难反驳的论点之一。

sentence.English: Since they do not speak; kisses never lie.
sentence.Chinese: 接吻不用讲话,所以从不会撒谎.

sentence.English: Since yesterday has gone and tomorrow has not come, take account of this one moment that now is.
sentence.Chinese: 昨日已去,明日未到,故应重视现在这顷刻.

sentence.English: Sloth makes all things diffiicult, but industry all things easy.
sentence.Chinese: 懒惰使一切都难办;勤奋使凡事皆顺利.

sentence.English: Slow and steady wins the race.
sentence.Chinese: 稳扎稳打;无往不胜.

sentence.English: Slumber not in the tents of your fathers. The world is advancing. Advance with it.
sentence.Chinese: 不要在你父兄的帐篷里沉睡.时代在前进,紧跟它向前吧!

sentence.English: Smokers and non-smokers can not be equally free in the same railway carriage.
sentence.Chinese: 吸烟的人和不吸烟的人在同一节火车车厢里不可能同样自由。

sentence.English: Snatching the eternal out of the desperately fleeting is the great magic trick of human existence.
sentence.Chinese: 人类生存的最大魔法,是从稍纵即逝的事物中攫取永恒.

sentence.English: So long as you work hard enough,an iron rod can be ground into a needle.
sentence.Chinese: 只要功夫深,铁杵磨成针.

sentence.English: So many countries ,so many customs.
sentence.Chinese: 异国不同俗。

sentence.English: Social science affirms that a woman's place in society marks the level of civilization.
sentence.Chinese: 社会科学认为，妇女在社会里的地位标志着文明的水平。

sentence.English: Some people cannot see the wood for the trees.
sentence.Chinese: 有些人见树不见林。

sentence.English: Some people have all the luck. And they're the ones who never depend on it.
sentence.Chinese: 有些人经常走运，但他们却常是最不依赖运气的人。

sentence.English: Something attempted, something done.
sentence.Chinese: 有所尝试,就等于有所作为.

sentence.English: Sometimes a majority simply means that all the fools are on the same side.
sentence.Chinese: 有时多数只意味着所有的愚人都站在同一边 。

sentence.English: Sometimes one pays most for the things one gets for nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 有时候一个人为不花钱得到的东西付出的代价最高.

sentence.English: Sometimes the best gain is to lose.
sentence.Chinese: 有时吃亏就是最大的便宜。

sentence.English: Sound love is not soon forgotten.
sentence.Chinese: 牢固的爱情不会顷刻忘怀.

sentence.English: Sound men wear out shoes, sick men sheets.
sentence.Chinese: 健康者费鞋子，久病者费床单。

sentence.English: Sow nothing, reap nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 春不播,秋不收. /无功不能受禄.

sentence.English: Spare the rod and spoil the child.
sentence.Chinese: 不打不成器。

sentence.English: Speak the truth and shame the devil.
sentence.Chinese: 说真话可使魔鬼感到羞愧。

sentence.English: Spectators see clearly while the participants are often lost in the maze.
sentence.Chinese: 旁观者清，当局者迷。

sentence.English: Speech is silver,humour is gold.
sentence.Chinese: 雄辩是银, 幽默是金.

sentence.English: Speech is silver,siilennce is gold.
sentence.Chinese: 雄辩如银,沉默如金.

sentence.English: Speech is the image of actions.
sentence.Chinese: 语言是行动的图象。

sentence.English: Speech is the picture of the mind.
sentence.Chinese: 言语是心灵的画像。

sentence.English: Spend not where you may save; spare not where you must spend.
sentence.Chinese: 可以省时不要花;必须花时不要省.

sentence.English: Spite is never lonely; envy always tags along.
sentence.Chinese: 怨恨绝不孤独；嫉妒总是与它相随。

sentence.English: Spring is a time when youth dreams and old age remembers.
sentence.Chinese: 春天是青年人梦想将来和老年人缅怀过去的季节.

sentence.English: Standers-by see more than gamesters.
sentence.Chinese: 旁观者清，当局者迷。

sentence.English: Still waters run deep.
sentence.Chinese: 静水流深。

sentence.English: Storms make trees take deeper roots.
sentence.Chinese: 风暴使树木深深扎根.

sentence.English: Strangers are friends that you have yet to meet.
sentence.Chinese: 陌生人是你尚未结识的朋友.

sentence.English: Strangers at the first meeting,friends at the second.
sentence.Chinese: 一回生,二回熟.

sentence.English: Stretch your legs according to your coverlet.
sentence.Chinese: 量被伸脚.

sentence.English: Strike the iron while it is hot.
sentence.Chinese: 打铁要趁热.

sentence.English: Striving for success without hard work is like trying to harvest where you haven't planted.
sentence.Chinese: 不努力而求成功,无异于不栽种而求收获.

sentence.English: Strong in action, gentle in method.
sentence.Chinese: 行动要坚强，方式要温和。

sentence.English: Study,study,and study.
sentence.Chinese: 学习,学习,再学习.

sentence.English: Stuff today and starve tomorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 今日大鱼大肉,明日饥肠辘辘.

sentence.English: Stupidity won't kill you, but it can make you sweat.
sentence.Chinese: 愚蠢不会使你丧生,却会让你吃苦.

sentence.English: Success belongs to the persevering.
sentence.Chinese: 成功属于不屈不挠的人.

sentence.English: Success covers a multitude of blunders.
sentence.Chinese: 成功能掩盖大量失误。

sentence.English: Success has many friends.
sentence.Chinese: 成功者朋友多.

sentence.English: Success in money--making is not always a good criterion of real success in life.
sentence.Chinese: 是否赚了大钱不足为生活中是否真正成功的标准.

sentence.English: Success is achieved by converting each step into a goal and each goal into a step.
sentence.Chinese: 把每个步骤变成目标,再把每个目标变成步骤,便能成功.

sentence.English: Success is never final and failure never fatal. It's courage that counts.
sentence.Chinese: 没有最终的成功,也没有致命的失败.决定的因素是勇气.

sentence.English: Superfluous wealth can but superfluities only.
sentence.Chinese: 多余的财富只能买来多余的东西.

sentence.English: Swearing was invented as a compromise between running away and fighting.
sentence.Chinese: 发明诅咒是把它作为逃跑和打架之间的一种折衷 。

sentence.English: Sweep before your own door.
sentence.Chinese: 正人先正己。

sentence.English: Sweet are the uses of adversity.
sentence.Chinese: 逆境之苦可变甜.

sentence.English: Sweet discourse makes short days and nights.
sentence.Chinese: 晤谈神会使人不觉日夜之长.

sentence.English: Tact is the art of recognizing when to be big and when not to be little.
sentence.Chinese: 知道何时应该宽宏大度，何时不应量小器微，是谓练达。

sentence.English: Take care of the pence and the pounds will take care of themselves.
sentence.Chinese: 小财注意,大财自来.

sentence.English: Take it and return it:the kiss of love.
sentence.Chinese: 对于爱之吻,接受它并立即退回它.

sentence.English: Take little, but give(or offer)much.
sentence.Chinese: 应少索取,而多奉献.

sentence.English: Take not a musket to kill a butterfly.
sentence.Chinese: 杀蝶不用枪。

sentence.English: Take the whole into consideration. but do the job bit by bit.
sentence.Chinese: 大处着眼,小处着手.

sentence.English: Take things as they come.
sentence.Chinese: 随遇而安。

sentence.English: Take time by the forelock.
sentence.Chinese: 要把握时机.

sentence.English: Take time to deliberate; but when the time for action arrives,stop thinking and go in.
sentence.Chinese: 考虑时不要匆忙；但是一旦行动的时刻来到，就要停止思考投入行动。

sentence.English: Take time while time is, for time will be away.
sentence.Chinese: 有时间就要利用,因为时间会消逝.

sentence.English: Taking joy in living is a woman's best cosmetic.
sentence.Chinese: 对人生感到乐趣是女人最好的化妆品.

sentence.English: Talent is as talent does.
sentence.Chinese: 是不是有实才,就看干得来干不来.

sentence.English: Talents come form diligence,and knowledge is gained by accumulation.
sentence.Chinese: 天才在于勤奋,知识在于积累.

sentence.English: Tell all that you know and tell it without reserve.
sentence.Chinese: 知无不言，言无不尽。

sentence.English: That friendship will not continue to the end that is begun for an end.
sentence.Chinese: 出于权宜之计的友谊不会长久.

sentence.English: That is a good book which is opened with expectation and closed with profit.
sentence.Chinese: 好书使人开卷有所求,闭卷有所获.

sentence.English: That which is brief, if it be good, is good twice over.
sentence.Chinese: 精练的智语是双倍的明智.

sentence.English: That which was bitter to endure may be sweet to remember.
sentence.Chinese: 当时艰辛回味甜.

sentence.English: That's good wisdom which is wisdom in the end.
sentence.Chinese: 最后正确才是真正确.

sentence.English: The administration of justice is the firmest pillar of government.
sentence.Chinese: 主持正义是政府最坚定的支柱。

sentence.English: The art of progress is to preserve order amid change,and to preserve change amid order.
sentence.Chinese: 进步的艺术是在变革中保持秩序，在秩序中保持变革。

sentence.English: The beginning is not everything.
sentence.Chinese: 开头并不是事情的全貌.

sentence.English: The best argument is that which seems merely an explanation.
sentence.Chinese: 最有力的争辩看上去只是一种解释.

sentence.English: The best fish swim near the bottom.
sentence.Chinese: 高山出鹰鹞,深水藏好鱼.

sentence.English: The best hearts are always the bravest.
sentence.Chinese: 心灵最高尚的人,也总是最勇敢的人.

sentence.English: The best is often the enemy of the good.
sentence.Chinese: 完美常是美好之敌。

sentence.English: The best mirror is a friend's eye.
sentence.Chinese: 朋友的眼睛是最好的镜子.

sentence.English: The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today.
sentence.Chinese: 为把明天的工作做好,最好的准备是把今天的工作做好.

sentence.English: The best way of answering a bad argument is to let it go on.
sentence.Chinese: 答复糟糕论点的最好办法是任其继续.

sentence.English: The better part of valour is discretion.
sentence.Chinese: 小心即大勇.

sentence.English: The bitter must come before the sweet; and that also make the sweet the sweeter.
sentence.Chinese: 苦应先于甜,会使甜更甜.

sentence.English: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
sentence.Chinese: 坟前洒下的最悲伤的眼泪,是痛悔应说而未说的话和应做而未做的事.

sentence.English: The brighter you are, the more you have to learn.
sentence.Chinese: 越聪明的人,越需要学习.

sentence.English: The bull must be taken by the horns.
sentence.Chinese: 对付公牛得抓其角.

sentence.English: The cat could very well be man's best friend but would never stoop to admitting it.
sentence.Chinese: 猫可以是人们最好的朋友，但它自己却不肯屈尊承认这一点。

sentence.English: The chain is not stronger than its weakest link.
sentence.Chinese: 麻绳专在细处断.

sentence.English: The chains of habit are too weak to be felt until they are too strong to be broken.
sentence.Chinese: 习惯之链很弱，往往感觉不到，一旦感觉到了，已经牢固得绷不断了。

sentence.English: The cleverest housewife cannot cook a meal without rice.
sentence.Chinese: 巧妈难为无米之炊。

sentence.English: The company of a good man is the light of the soul, of an evil man the poison of life.
sentence.Chinese: 结交好人,启迪心灵;结交坏人,败坏一生.

sentence.English: The course of true love never did run smooth.
sentence.Chinese: 真诚的爱情之路永不会是平坦的.

sentence.English: The cow eats grass but gives milk.
sentence.Chinese: 牛吃的是草,挤出来的是奶.

sentence.English: The crash of the whole solar and stellar systems could only kill you once.
sentence.Chinese: 即使整个太阳系和星系崩溃,你也只死一次.

sentence.English: The darkest hour is that before the dawn.
sentence.Chinese: 黎明之前最黑暗.

sentence.English: The dead are only dead when they die in the thoughts of the living.
sentence.Chinese: 没有活人思念的死人,才是真正的死了.

sentence.English: The deepest turths are the simplest and the most common.
sentence.Chinese: 最深刻的真理是最简单,最普通的道理.

sentence.English: The devil is not so black as he is painted.
sentence.Chinese: 魔鬼并不象人们描绘的那样黑。

sentence.English: The devil knows many things becuase he is old.
sentence.Chinese: 人老见识广. /老马识途.

sentence.English: The dictionary is the only place where success comes before work
sentence.Chinese: 成功先于工作的唯一地方是在字典里. 注:字典里字母S先于W.

sentence.English: The difficulty with humorists is that they will mix what they believe with what they don't, whichever seems likelier to win an effect.
sentence.Chinese: 幽默家的困难，在于他们把相信的和不信的全混在一起，只考虑哪个看上去更 有效果。

sentence.English: The early bird catches the worn.
sentence.Chinese: 先出巢的鸟儿先得食.

sentence.English: The essence of language is human activity.
sentence.Chinese: 语言的本质是人类活动。

sentence.English: The exception proves the rule.
sentence.Chinese: 例外证明法则的存在。

sentence.English: The failures of the past prepare the triumph of the future.
sentence.Chinese: 过去的失败给未来的胜利铺路.

sentence.English: The fairest rose is at last withered.
sentence.Chinese: 好花终有凋谢时.

sentence.English: The fame of great men ought to be judged always by the means they used to acquire it.
sentence.Chinese: 判断伟人的名誉应该以他们如何得到它来衡量.

sentence.English: The fire is the test of gold; adversity is the test of a strong man.
sentence.Chinese: 火对金子是考验,逆境对人是磨炼.

sentence.English: The first requirement of good conversation is that nobody should know what is coming next.
sentence.Chinese: 谈话艺术的第一要素是让人不知道你接下去要讲什么。

sentence.English: The first step is as good as half over.
sentence.Chinese: 第一步是最关键的一步.

sentence.English: The fly that sips treacle is lost in the sweet.
sentence.Chinese: 啜饮蜜糖的苍蝇在甜蜜中丧生.

sentence.English: The food that enters the mind must be watched as closely as the food that enters the body.
sentence.Chinese: 对精神食粮和对营养身体的食物同样必须谨于选择.

sentence.English: The fool does think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
sentence.Chinese: 愚者自以为智,智者自知其愚.

sentence.English: The force of the wind tests the strength of the grass.
sentence.Chinese: 疾风知劲草.

sentence.English: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
sentence.Chinese: 每个国家的基础都在于对其青年的教育。

sentence.English: The friend is known in the time of difficulty.
sentence.Chinese: 困难时刻才会知道谁是朋友.

sentence.English: The full area of ignorance is not mapped; We are at present only exploring its fringes.
sentence.Chinese: 无知的全部疆域尚未测绘成图:目前我们只是在其周边探索.

sentence.English: The future becomes the present if we fight for it.
sentence.Chinese: 只要为之奋斗,未来就会变成现在.

sentence.English: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour,whatever he does,whoever he is.
sentence.Chinese: 未来是这样一件东西,每个 都以每小时六十分钟的速度朝它走去,不管他做什么,也不管他是谁.

sentence.English: The golden age is before us, not behind us.
sentence.Chinese: 黄金时代是在我们前面而不在我们背后.

sentence.English: The good is the enemy of the best.
sentence.Chinese: 过得去是精益求精的敌人。

sentence.English: The good or ill of man lies within his own will
sentence.Chinese: 人的善良或邪恶都存在于他自己的意志之中.

sentence.English: The great use of life is to spend it for some thing that overlasts it.
sentence.Chinese: 生命的最大用处是将它用于比生命更长久的事物上.

sentence.English: The greater a man is, the more distasteful is praise and flattery to him.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人越伟大，对表扬和奉承就越反感。

sentence.English: The greater part of whitewashing is done with ink.
sentence.Chinese: 大部分的粉饰是用墨水进行的。

sentence.English: The greater the man,the more restrained his anger.
sentence.Chinese: 人越伟大,越能克制怒火

sentence.English: The greater the power ,the more dangerous the abuse.
sentence.Chinese: 权力越大，滥用权力造成的危险也越大。

sentence.English: The greatest artist was once a beginner.
sentence.Chinese: 最伟大的艺术家也曾是个初学者。

sentence.English: The greatest friend of truth is time,her greatest enemy is prejudice,and her constant company is humility.
sentence.Chinese: 真理最好的朋友是时间,最大的敌人是偏见,永恒的伴侣是谦逊.

sentence.English: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
sentence.Chinese: 给人最大的帮助，不单是让他分享你的富有，而是向他指明他的富有。

sentence.English: The greatest talkers are the least doers.
sentence.Chinese: 语言的巨人常是行动的矮子.

sentence.English: The happiest people seem to be those who have no particular cause for being happy except that they are so.
sentence.Chinese: 最快乐的人似乎是那些并没有特别原因觉得快乐而只是快乐的人。

sentence.English: The heart that once truly loves never forgets.
sentence.Chinese: 真正恋爱过的心永不遗忘.

sentence.English: The higher the ape goes, the more he shows his tail.
sentence.Chinese: 猴子爬得越高，尾巴露得越多。

sentence.English: The highest branch is not the safest roost.
sentence.Chinese: 高枝非良栖之所。

sentence.English: The highest possble stage in moral culture is when we recognize that we ought to control our thoughts.
sentence.Chinese: 道德修养能达到的最高阶段,是认识到我们应该控制我们的思想.

sentence.English: The highest towers begin from the ground.
sentence.Chinese: 万丈高楼平地起.

sentence.English: The horizon of life is broadened chiefly by the enlargement off the heart.
sentence.Chinese: 生活的地平线是随着心灵的开阔而变宽广的.

sentence.English: The important thing in life is to have a great aim,and the determination to attain it.
sentence.Chinese: 人生重要的在于确立一个伟大的目标,并有决心使其实现.

sentence.English: The insolent have no friends.
sentence.Chinese: 目空一切的人无朋友.

sentence.English: The jealous are troublesome to others, but a torment to themselves.
sentence.Chinese: 妒忌者对别人是烦恼，对他们自己却是折磨。

sentence.English: The last drop makes the cup run over.
sentence.Chinese: 满斟之杯,溢于最后一滴.

sentence.English: The least said, the soonest mended.
sentence.Chinese: 少说一句，息事宁人。

sentence.English: The love of economy is the root of all virtue.
sentence.Chinese: 节约是一切美德的根源.

sentence.English: The love of money is a root of all knids of evil; which some reaching after have been led astray from the faith, and have pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
sentence.Chinese: 贪财是万恶之根:有人贪恋钱财,就被诱离了正道,使自己充满许多愁苦.

sentence.English: The lowly are most intelligent; the elite are most ignorant.
sentence.Chinese: 卑贱者最聪明，高贵者最愚蠢。

sentence.English: The lustre of pure gold will never fade; the faith of an upholder of truth will never change.
sentence.Chinese: 纯真的金子,光泽永远不变;坚持真理的人,信念始终不渝.

sentence.English: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything or nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 生活中的主要危险来自那些想要改变一切或什么也不想改变的人。

sentence.English: The man who agrees with everybody is not worth having anybody agree with him.
sentence.Chinese: 同意所有人的意见的人,不配得到任何人的同意.

sentence.English: The man who doesn't recognize a fool when he sees one is one himself.
sentence.Chinese: 看见傻瓜而认不出来的人,自己也是傻瓜.

sentence.English: The man who gets angry suffers more than the person who is the object of his wrath.
sentence.Chinese: 发脾气的人比对方受罪。

sentence.English: The man who has made up his mind to win will never say ”Impossible”.
sentence.Chinese: 凡是决心取得胜利的人是从来不说”不可能”的.

sentence.English: The man who offers an insult writes it in sand,but for the man who received it,it's chiselled in bronze.
sentence.Chinese: 侮辱人者是把话写在沙上，受辱者却把它看作飧刻在铜上。

sentence.English: The man who saves when young will have more to spend when he is old.
sentence.Chinese: 年少节俭,年老不愁.

sentence.English: The man with a new idea is a crank until the idea succeeds.
sentence.Chinese: 具有新想法的人在其想法被接受之前是怪人。

sentence.English: The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell,a hell of heaven.
sentence.Chinese: 心灵是自己作主的地方，能把地狱变成天堂，把天堂变成地狱。

sentence.English: The moon does not heed the barking of dogs.
sentence.Chinese: 月亮不怕狗叫。/ 只要品格高尚，何惧他人底毁。

sentence.English: The moon is a moon still, whether it shine or not.
sentence.Chinese: 月明月暗，终不失其为月亮。

sentence.English: The moon is a moon whether it shines or not.
sentence.Chinese: 或明或暗,月亮总是月亮.

sentence.English: The moon is not seen where the sun shines.
sentence.Chinese: 日出月不见。

sentence.English: The more we do, the more we can do; the more busy we are ,the more leisure we have.
sentence.Chinese: 事越做越能做,人越忙越有空.

sentence.English: The more we study, the more we discover our ignorance.
sentence.Chinese: 读书越多,越感到学识不足.

sentence.English: The more you have, the more you want.
sentence.Chinese: 拥有的愈多,想要的愈多. /越富越贪.

sentence.English: The most difficult secret for a man to keep is his own opinion of himself.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人最难保守的秘密是自己对自己的看法。

sentence.English: The most difficult thing in life is to know yourself.
sentence.Chinese: 人生最难是自知.

sentence.English: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
sentence.Chinese: 生活中最使人筋疲力尽的事是装虚作假。

sentence.English: The most precious of all possessions is a wise and loyal friend.
sentence.Chinese: 最宝贵的财富是明智而忠实的朋友.

sentence.English: The mother's breath is aye sweet.
sentence.Chinese: 母亲的气息，永远甜蜜。

sentence.English: The net of heaven is large and wide,but it lets nothing through.
sentence.Chinese: 天网恢恢，疏而不漏。

sentence.English: The noble soul has reverence for itself.
sentence.Chinese: 灵魂高尚的人必自尊.

sentence.English: The noblest vengeance is to forgive.
sentence.Chinese: 最高尚的复仇是宽容。

sentence.English: The object of education is to prepare the young to educate themselves throughout their lives.
sentence.Chinese: 教育的目的在于让青年人作好毕生自我教育的准备。

sentence.English: The obscure we see eventually.The com pletely obvious,it seems,takes longer.
sentence.Chinese: 隐悔的，我们终究会体会。显而易见的，却似乎需要更长的时间才能看出。

sentence.English: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
sentence.Chinese: 我年纪越大,就越不相信智慧会随年龄增长这句老生常谈.

sentence.English: The one real object of education is to have a man in the condition of continually asking questions.
sentence.Chinese: 教育的真正目的是让一个人习惯于不断地提出的问题。

sentence.English: The only function of economic forecasting is to make astrology look respectable.
sentence.Chinese: 经济预测的唯一作用是使占星术看起来体面一些。

sentence.English: The only man who is really free is the one who can turn down an invitation to dinner without giving any excuse.
sentence.Chinese: 唯一真正自由的人是能够拒绝宴会的邀请而不用提出理由的人。

sentence.English: The only really difficult thing about a poem is the critic's explanation of it.
sentence.Chinese: 对于诗歌，唯一真正难以理解的是批评家对它的解释。

sentence.English: The only thing most people do better than anyone else is to read their own handwriting.
sentence.Chinese: 大多数人唯一比别人做得好的事，是认自己写的字。

sentence.English: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 只要好人不闻不问，邪恶就能胜利。

sentence.English: The only thing wealth does for some people is to make them worry about losing them.
sentence.Chinese: 财富对有些人只做了一件事:使他们担心会失去财富.

sentence.English: The only way on earth to muitiply happiness is to divide it.
sentence.Chinese: 世界上唯一成倍地增加幸福的办法是与人分享.

sentence.English: The only worthwhile achievements of man are those which are socially useful.
sentence.Chinese: 人的成就只有对社会有用才是有价值的.

sentence.English: The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true.
sentence.Chinese: 乐观主义者宣称,我们生活在最美好的世界里,而悲观主义者则害怕这是真的.

sentence.English: The overturned cart ahead is a warning to the carts behind.
sentence.Chinese: 前车之覆，后车之鉴。

sentence.English: The path of duty is the way to glory.
sentence.Chinese: 责任的道路就是通往荣誉的道路.

sentence.English: The path to glory is lways rugged.
sentence.Chinese: 光荣之路常坎坷.

sentence.English: The pen is mightier than the sword.
sentence.Chinese: 笔锋利于剑。

sentence.English: The people who get on in this world are the people who get up and look for circumstances they want,and if they cannot find them, make them.
sentence.Chinese: 在这个世界上取得成功的人,都努力去寻找他们想要的机会,如果找不到时,他们就自己创造机会.

sentence.English: The people, and the people alone,are the motive force in the making of world history.
sentence.Chinese: 人民，只有人民，才是创造世界历史的动力。

sentence.English: The person who knows how will always have a job. But the person who knows why will be his boss.
sentence.Chinese: 知其然者用于人,但知其所以然者用人.

sentence.English: The philosophers have only interpretered the world in various ways. The point however is to change it.
sentence.Chinese: 哲学家们只是用各种方法解释世界,而问题在于改造世界.

sentence.English: The poorest man in the world is he who has nothing but money.
sentence.Chinese: 世上最穷的人是除了钱以外什么也没有的人.

sentence.English: The pot calls the kettle black.
sentence.Chinese: 锅嫌罐黑。/ 责人而不责己。

sentence.English: The primary purpose of education is not to teach you to earn your bread,but to make every mouthful sweeter.
sentence.Chinese: 教育最主要的目的，不是教你挣得面包，而是使每一口面包都香甜。

sentence.English: The principal thing in this world is to keep one's soul aloft.
sentence.Chinese: 人生在世的首要大事是保持灵魂的高尚.

sentence.English: The proof of the pudding is in the eating.
sentence.Chinese: 不亲口尝一尝,不知布丁的好坏.

sentence.English: The proper function of man is to live, not to exist.
sentence.Chinese: 人的正确功能是生活,而不是生存.

sentence.English: The reading of all good books is like a conversation with the finest men of past centuries.
sentence.Chinese: 阅读好书,就好比是同过去多少世纪最杰出的人们交谈.

sentence.English: The real art of conversation is not only to say the right thing in the right place but to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.
sentence.Chinese: 讲话的真正艺术不仅是在适当的场合讲适当的话，而且要在最诱人的时刻不要 讲错误的话。

sentence.English: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself.
sentence.Chinese: 明白事理的人使自己适应世界；不明事理的人硬想使世界适应自己。

sentence.English: The relation of genius to talent is the same as that of instinct to reason.
sentence.Chinese: 天资之于才华一如本能之于理智.

sentence.English: The safest way to double your money is to fold it over once and put it in your pocket.
sentence.Chinese: 要使你的钱翻一番,最保险的办法是将它折叠起来放进口袋.

sentence.English: The same man never crossed the same river twice.
sentence.Chinese: 旧地重来景已非。

sentence.English: The secret of a man who is universally interesting is that he is universally interested.
sentence.Chinese: 大家都对他感兴趣的人的秘密,在于他对大家都感兴趣.

sentence.English: The secret of being miserable is to have leisure to bother about whether you are happy or not.
sentence.Chinese: 痛苦的秘密在于有闲功夫为自己是否幸福而烦恼.

sentence.English: The secret of life is not to do what one likes, but to try to like what one has to do.
sentence.Chinese: 生活的秘密不在于做自己喜欢做的,而在于喜欢自己不得不做的.

sentence.English: The secret of study lies in the integration of throry with practice.
sentence.Chinese: 学习的秘诀在于理论与实践的统一.

sentence.English: The secret of success is constancy of purpose.
sentence.Chinese: 成功的秘诀是目标坚定.

sentence.English: The severest test of character is not so much the ability to keep a secret as it is, but when the secret is finally out, to refrain from disclosing that you knew it all along.
sentence.Chinese: 对品德的最严格考验,不在于你能否保守秘密,而在于秘密泄露后你能否不说你早就知道.

sentence.English: The shortest answer is doing.
sentence.Chinese: 最简短的回答是干.

sentence.English: The shortest way to do many things is to do only one thing at a time.
sentence.Chinese: 多做事的捷径是每次只做一件事.

sentence.English: The soft can overcome the hard,and the weak can defeat the strong.
sentence.Chinese: 柔能克刚，弱能制强。

sentence.English: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.
sentence.Chinese: 人没有想象力,犹如天文台没有望远镜.

sentence.English: The spectators see the game better than the players.
sentence.Chinese: 当局者迷,旁观者清.

sentence.English: The storehouse of wisdom is stocked with proverbs.
sentence.Chinese: 智慧的仓库里储满箴言.

sentence.English: The story of a love is not important---what is important is that one is capable of love. It is perhaps the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.
sentence.Chinese: 爱情的故事并不重要,重要的是一个人能爱.这也许是让我们能瞥到永恒的仅有机会.

sentence.English: The strong slways succeeds; the weakest goes to the wall.
sentence.Chinese: 坚强的人往往成功;软弱的人往往失败.

sentence.English: The sum of behaviour is to retain a man's own dignity, without intruding upon the liberty of others.
sentence.Chinese: 人的行为准则是,维护自己尊严,不妨碍他人自由.

sentence.English: The sun shines upon all alike.
sentence.Chinese: 太阳照人，不分贵贱。

sentence.English: The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved.
sentence.Chinese: 生活中最大的幸福是坚信有人爱我们.

sentence.English: The talent of success is nothing more than doing well whatever you do without a thought of fame.
sentence.Chinese: 取得成功的秘诀不过是无论干什么都把它干好而不去想到出名.

sentence.English: The talents of an individual are limited; the wisdom of the collective is boundless.
sentence.Chinese: 个人的聪明有限,集体的智慧无穷.

sentence.English: The throne is but a piece of wood covered with velvet.
sentence.Chinese: 皇帝的宝座不过是一块盖着天鹅绒的木头。

sentence.English: The time to stop talking is when the other person nods his head affirmatively but says nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 等到对方只是点头同意而一言不发时，那就是你该停止说话的时候了。

sentence.English: The tongue is not steel,yet it cuts.
sentence.Chinese: 舌头非剑，但可伤人。

sentence.English: The tragedy of life is not so much what men suffer, but what they miss.
sentence.Chinese: 生活的悲剧不在于人们受到多少苦,而在于人们错过了什么.

sentence.English: The treacherous, unexplored areas of the world are not in continents or the seas; they are in the minds and hearts of men.
sentence.Chinese: 世上未经勘探的险恶之境，不是在大陆上，也不是在海洋中，而是在人们的头脑和心里。

sentence.English: The truth will out.
sentence.Chinese: 真相总会大白.

sentence.English: The truths we least like to hear are those which it is most to our advantage to know.
sentence.Chinese: 我们最不愿听到的真话,往往是我们知道了会大有好处的真话.

sentence.English: The turtle lays thousands of eggs without anyone knowing, but when the hen lays an egg, the whole country is informed.
sentence.Chinese: 海龟下几千只蛋都不动声色，母鸡下一只蛋就闹得四邻皆知。

sentence.English: The tyrant dies and his rule ends,the martyr dies and his rule begins.
sentence.Chinese: 暴君死了，他的统治也就结束了；烈士死了，他的统治刚开始。

sentence.English: The unexamined life is not worth living.
sentence.Chinese: 浑浑噩噩的生活不值得过.

sentence.English: The universe is not required to be in perfect harmony with human ambition.
sentence.Chinese: 宇宙不必和人类的雄心壮志完全协调一致。

sentence.English: The used key is always bright.
sentence.Chinese: 常用的钥匙不长锈.

sentence.English: The usual excuse of those who cause others trouble is that they wish them well.
sentence.Chinese: 给别人造成麻烦的人通常的借口是出于好意。

sentence.English: The value of a man's life increases with the fact that he really knows how to make full use of his time.
sentence.Chinese: 真正懂得利用时间的人,他的生命价值也就因之增加.

sentence.English: The value of an idea has nothing whatever to do with the sincerity of the man who expresses it.
sentence.Chinese: 一个想法的价值与表述它的人是否真诚没有关系。

sentence.English: The value of life lies not in the length of days,but in the use we make of them.
sentence.Chinese: 生命的价值不在于能活多少天,而在于我们如何使用这些日子.

sentence.English: The voice of the people is the voice of God.
sentence.Chinese: 人民的呼声就是上帝的声音。

sentence.English: The wages of sin is death.
sentence.Chinese: 为恶者应灭亡。

sentence.English: The water supporting a ship can also upset it.
sentence.Chinese: 水可以载舟，亦可以覆舟。

sentence.English: The weak have one weapon; The errors of those who think they are strong.
sentence.Chinese: 弱者有一个武器；那些自认为强者的人的错误。

sentence.English: The wealth of the mind is the only wealth.
sentence.Chinese: 精神的财富是唯一的财富.

sentence.English: The well-dressed man is he whose clothes you never notice.
sentence.Chinese: 服饰得体的人使你永远也不会注意到他的穿着.

sentence.English: The whole dignity of man lies in the power of thought.
sentence.Chinese: 人的全部尊严在于思考的能力.

sentence.English: The wife is the key of the house.
sentence.Chinese: 妻子是一家的关键.

sentence.English: The wind cannot be caught in a net.
sentence.Chinese: 撒网捕风,徒劳无功.

sentence.English: The wise man is always good listener.
sentence.Chinese: 智者善听人言.

sentence.English: The wise man knows he knows nothing; the dunce thinks he knows all.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明人知道自己不懂什么,蠢人则认为自己什么都懂.

sentence.English: The wish is father to the thought.
sentence.Chinese: 思考源于愿望. /心有所欲,脑有所思.

sentence.English: The world belongs to the energetic.
sentence.Chinese: 世界属于朝气蓬勃者

sentence.English: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
sentence.Chinese: 世界是一本书，没有旅行过的人只读了一页。

sentence.English: The world is a ladder for some to go up and some down.
sentence.Chinese: 世事如长梯,有人上来有人下.

sentence.English: The world is a looking-glass,and gives back to every man the reflection of his own face.
sentence.Chinese: 世界是一面镜子，每个人都在上面照到自己。

sentence.English: The world is a play that would not be worth seeing if we knew the plot.
sentence.Chinese: 世界是一出戏，要是事先知道情节，就不值得看了。

sentence.English: The world is before you, and you need not take it or leave it as it was when you came in.
sentence.Chinese: 世界在你面前，你不必原封不动地接受它或让它去。

sentence.English: The world is but a little place,after all.
sentence.Chinese: 天涯原咫尺,何处不相逢.

sentence.English: The world is his who enjoys it.
sentence.Chinese: 世界属于热爱世界的人.

sentence.English: The world is so full of a number of things, I'm sure we should all be as happy as kings.
sentence.Chinese: 世界上的东西是那样丰富多彩，我肯定我们都应当象国王一样愉快。

sentence.English: The world wants geniuses,but it wants them to behave just like other people.
sentence.Chinese: 世界需要天才,不过需要他们象其他人一样为人行事.

sentence.English: The worst tragedy for a poet is to be admired through being misunderstood.
sentence.Chinese: 对于诗人来说，最大的悲剧莫过于由于误解而受到钦佩。

sentence.English: The worst vice of the fanatic is his sincerity.
sentence.Chinese: 狂热者的大恶在于他的诚意。

sentence.English: The worst wheel of the cart creaks most.
sentence.Chinese: 最差的车轮吱嘎声最大。

sentence.English: The worth of a thing is best known by the want of it.
sentence.Chinese: 缺乏一件东西时,才知道它的可贵.

sentence.English: The years teach much which the days never know.
sentence.Chinese: 学问积年而成,而每日不自知.

sentence.English: There are more ways to the wood than one.
sentence.Chinese: 此路不通彼路通.

sentence.English: There are no faults in a thing we want badly.
sentence.Chinese: 我们非常想要的东西总是没有缺点的。

sentence.English: There are only two ways to be quite unprejudiced and impartial. One is to be completely ignorant.The other is to be completely indifferent.
sentence.Chinese: 只有两种办法可以做到不偏不倚，一种是完全无知，一种是完全不在乎。

sentence.English: There are people who want to be everywhere at once and they seem to get nowhere.
sentence.Chinese: 有些人想同时去所有的地方,结果看来哪儿也去不成.

sentence.English: There are spots in the sun.
sentence.Chinese: 太阳也有黑点。

sentence.English: There are three things that ought to be considered before some things are spoken, the manner,the place, and the time.
sentence.Chinese: 有些事情在谈论之前应该考虑三点：方式、地点和时间。

sentence.English: There are tricks in every trade.
sentence.Chinese: 各行各业都有诀窍.

sentence.English: There are two things to aim at in life: First, to get what you want; and after that,to enjoy it.Only the wisest of mankind achieve the second.
sentence.Chinese: 生活中有两个目标:首先得到你想要的东西,然后则是尽情地享受它.只有最明智的人才能做到第二步.

sentence.English: There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.
sentence.Chinese: 人生有两出悲剧。一是失去心中所欲的，另一是得到心中所欲的。

sentence.English: There is ,however, a limit at which forbearance ceases to be a virtue.
sentence.Chinese: 克服也有个限度，超过了限度就不再是美德。

sentence.English: There is a black sheep in every flock.
sentence.Chinese: 羊多必有黑羊；人多必有败类。

sentence.English: There is a great deal of difference between an eager man who wants to read a book and the tired man who wants a book to read.
sentence.Chinese: 一个渴望读书的人和一个累了想找本书看的的是大不相同的.

sentence.English: There is a great man who makes every man feel small. But the real great man is the man who makes every man feel great.
sentence.Chinese: 有一个伟大人物使所有的人都感动渺小.但是真正伟大的人却使所有的人感到伟大.

sentence.English: There is a history in all men's lives.
sentence.Chinese: 所有人的生活里都有一部历史.

sentence.English: There is a tide in the affairs of men.
sentence.Chinese: 人生事业有盛有衰.

sentence.English: There is a time to speak and a time to be silent.
sentence.Chinese: 有该说话的时候,也有该沉默的时候.

sentence.English: There is a very good saying that if triangles invented a god,they would make him threesided.
sentence.Chinese: 有一句话说得很好：如果三角形发明一个上帝，它们也会使他有三条边。

sentence.English: There is more than one way to help people but there is only one way to live: help people.
sentence.Chinese: 助人之道不一,做人之道则只有一种:助人.

sentence.English: There is no better or more blessed bondage than to be a prisoner of hope.
sentence.Chinese: 做希望的俘虏,是为无上的幸福所束缚.

sentence.English: There is no cure for birth and death save to enjoy the interval.
sentence.Chinese: 生和死都无法治,只有享受两者之间的间隔.

sentence.English: There is no defence, except stupidity, against the impact of a new idea.
sentence.Chinese: 除了愚蠢,对新思想的影响别无防御之法.

sentence.English: There is no disputing about tastes.
sentence.Chinese: 品味无可争论。/ 人各有所好。

sentence.English: There is no end to learning.
sentence.Chinese: 学无止境.

sentence.English: There is no fence or hedge around time that has gone. You can go back and have what you like if you remember it well enough.
sentence.Chinese: 过去的岁月没有围墙和篱笆,如果你把它珍藏于记忆中,便可以回到从前并重新获得你所喜爱的.

sentence.English: There is no friend so faithful as a good book.
sentence.Chinese: 最忠实的朋友莫过于一本好书.

sentence.English: There is no garden without its weeds.
sentence.Chinese: 没有不长杂草的花园。

sentence.English: There is no greater grief than to recall a time of happiness when in misery.
sentence.Chinese: 没有比在悲惨中回忆起幸福的时刻更痛苦。

sentence.English: There is no joy without alloy.
sentence.Chinese: 世上没有十全十美的快乐。/ 金无足赤，乐无十全。

sentence.English: There is no mistake so great as that of being always right.
sentence.Chinese: 最大的错误莫过于总是自信正确。

sentence.English: There is no moral precept that does not have something inconvenient about it.
sentence.Chinese: 任何一条道德戒律在奉行时都会引起不便。

sentence.English: There is no other misfortune that could be compared with the loss of time.
sentence.Chinese: 没有一种不幸可与浪费时间相比.

sentence.English: There is no rose without a thorn.
sentence.Chinese: 没有无刺的蔷薇.

sentence.English: There is no royal road to learning.
sentence.Chinese: 求知无坦途.

sentence.English: There is no royal road to sciece, and only those who do not dread the fatiguing climb of its steep paths have a chance of gaining its luminous summits.
sentence.Chinese: 在科学上没有平坦的大道,只有不畏劳苦沿着陡峭山路攀登的人,才有希望达到光辉的顶点.

sentence.English: There is no rule without an exception.
sentence.Chinese: 有规则必有例外。

sentence.English: There is no satiety in study.
sentence.Chinese: 学而不厌.

sentence.English: There is no such thing as darkness; only a failure to see.
sentence.Chinese: 没有黑暗这种东西,只有看不见而已.

sentence.English: There is no such thing as genius; it is nothing but labour and diligence.
sentence.Chinese: 世间无所谓天才,它仅是刻苦加勤奋.

sentence.English: There is no such thing in anyone's life as an unimportant day.
sentence.Chinese: 人生没有不重要的一天.

sentence.English: There is no time like the present.
sentence.Chinese: 最好的时间就是现在.

sentence.English: There is nothing noble in being superior to some other man, True nobility is being superior to your former self.
sentence.Chinese: 优于别人并非高尚; 今日之你优于昨日之你,才是真正的高尚.

sentence.English: There is nothing permanent except change.
sentence.Chinese: 唯有变化才是永恒的.

sentence.English: There is nothing which has not been bitter before being ripe.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事在成熟前，都是苦味的。

sentence.English: There is one thing about hens that looks like wisdom-they don't cackle until they have laid their eggs.
sentence.Chinese: 母鸡有一点看来是明智的—它们在下了蛋之后才咯咯叫。

sentence.English: There is one thing more important than knowing self; it is governing self. There is one thing better than crushing impulse, it is using impulse.
sentence.Chinese: 有一件事比自知更重要，即自制；有一件事比压制冲动更好，即利用冲动。

sentence.English: There is one thing which give radiance to everything. It is the idea of something around the corner.
sentence.Chinese: 有一样东西可给任何事物添上光彩，那就是好事即将来临的想法。

sentence.English: There is only one good, that is knowledge; there is only one evil,that is ignorance.
sentence.Chinese: 唯一的善是知识,唯一的恶是无知.

sentence.English: There is only one success---to be able to spend your life in your own way.
sentence.Chinese: 只有一种成功,那就是能够用自己的方式度过自己的一生.

sentence.English: There is something that is much more scarce, something rarer than ability. It is the ability to recognize ability.
sentence.Chinese: 有的东西比才能稀罕得多,珍贵得多,这就是识别才能的能力.

sentence.English: There is strength in numbers, but impotence in singlehandedness.
sentence.Chinese: 人多势众,孤掌难鸣.

sentence.English: There must be a happy medium somewhere between being totally informed and blissfully unaware.
sentence.Chinese: 无所不知与幸福地无知之间，一定有适得其所的中间地。

sentence.English: There's many a good tune played on an old fiddle.
sentence.Chinese: 旧琴也能奏出好乐章.

sentence.English: There's many a slip'twixt cup and lip.
sentence.Chinese: 酒杯到唇边还可能滑落. /非到最后不足以说成功.

sentence.English: There's no wisdom like silence.
sentence.Chinese: 保持沉默最聪明。

sentence.English: There's nothing new under the sun.
sentence.Chinese: 天下原无新事物。

sentence.English: There's only a step form the sublime to the ridiculous, but there's no road leading back form the ridiculous to the sublime.
sentence.Chinese: 从崇高到荒谬只有一步之差,可是从荒谬却没有路能回到崇高.

sentence.English: There's only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving,and that's your own self.
sentence.Chinese: 宇宙中只有一芥之地你肯定可以改善,那就是你自己.

sentence.English: There's only one kind of tax that would please everybody-one that nobody but the other guy has to pay.
sentence.Chinese: 只有一种税人人欢迎，那就是只有别人必须缴纳的税。

sentence.English: They are fools who adulate every decision of their leaders.
sentence.Chinese: 对领导的每个决定一味奉承的人是蠢材.

sentence.English: They brag most who can do least.
sentence.Chinese: 本领最小的人，最会吹牛。

sentence.English: They have rights who dare defend them.
sentence.Chinese: 敢于保卫权利的人就能拥有权利。

sentence.English: They must hunger in winter that will not work in summer.
sentence.Chinese: 夏不劳动冬挨饿.

sentence.English: They that can give up essential liberty to obtaina little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
sentence.Chinese: 不惜牺牲自由以图苟安的人，既不配享受自由，也不配获得自由。

sentence.English: They that live longest see most.
sentence.Chinese: 年岁越高,阅历越深.

sentence.English: They who lay traps for others are often caught by their own bait.
sentence.Chinese: 给别人设圈套的人常常落在自己的圈套里。

sentence.English: Things are seldom what they seem.
sentence.Chinese: 事情很少象表面所显示的那样。

sentence.English: Things will probably come out all right, but sometimes it takes strong nerves just to watch.
sentence.Chinese: 事情可能结局很好，不过有时单是等待事态发展就需要极大的勇气。

sentence.English: Think more, and you'll become wiser.
sentence.Chinese: 多思出智慧.

sentence.English: Think more,and you'll become wiser./ Use your brain and you'll become a wise man.
sentence.Chinese: 多思出智慧。

sentence.English: Think not on what you lack as much as on what you have.
sentence.Chinese: 少想自己欠缺的,多想自己拥有的.

sentence.English: Think today and speak tomorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 熟思而后言.

sentence.English: Thinking is ,or ought to be, a coolness and a calmness; and our poor hearts throb, and our poor brains beat too much for that.
sentence.Chinese: 思考是,或者应该是,冷静沉着的;而我们可怜的心怦怦跳,我们可怜的脑子老兴奋,使我们不能思考.

sentence.English: Those that make the best use of their time have none to spare.
sentence.Chinese: 充分利用时间的人不会有余暇.

sentence.English: Those who desire to be rich fall into a temptation and a snare and many foolish and hurtful lusts,such as down men in destruction and perdition.
sentence.Chinese: 那些想要发财的人,就陷入迷惑,落进罗网和许多愚蠢有害的私欲里,叫人毁灭沦丧.

sentence.English: Those who expect to reap the blessings of freedom must undergo the fatigue of supporting it.
sentence.Chinese: 想要收获自由之果的人,必须承受维护自由的劳苦.

sentence.English: Those who foolishly sought power by riding on the back of the tiger ended up inside.
sentence.Chinese: 那些愚蠢地骑在虎背上追求权利的人终将被老虎吞下肚子。

sentence.English: Those who seek to please everybody please nobody.
sentence.Chinese: 见人就献媚，谁也不待见。

sentence.English: Though malice may darken truth, it cannot put it out.
sentence.Chinese: 恶意可以诽谤真理,但不能消灭真理.

sentence.English: Thrift is not only a great virtue, but also a great revenue.
sentence.Chinese: 节俭不仅是一大美德,而且是一大财源.

sentence.English: Through obedience learn to command.
sentence.Chinese: 通过服从学习指挥.

sentence.English: Time and thinking tame the strongest grief.
sentence.Chinese: 岁月流逝,悲哀消失;思想专注,忧愁解除.

sentence.English: Time and tide wait for no man.
sentence.Chinese: 时光如逝水,岁月不待人.

sentence.English: Time cures all things.
sentence.Chinese: 时间是最好的医生. /时间能医愈一切创痛.

sentence.English: Time dresses the greatest wounds.
sentence.Chinese: 时间能愈合最大的创伤.

sentence.English: Time drops in decay. Like a candle burnt.
sentence.Chinese: 时间一点一滴流逝, 犹如蜡烛慢慢燃掉.

sentence.English: Time flies.
sentence.Chinese: 光阴似箭.

sentence.English: Time is a bird for ever on the wing.
sentence.Chinese: 时间是一只永远在飞翔的鸟.

sentence.English: Time is everything for all of us.
sentence.Chinese: 对我们大家来说,时间就是一切.

sentence.English: Time is grain for peasants.
sentence.Chinese: 对农民来说,时间就是粮食.

sentence.English: Time is knowledge for educationists.
sentence.Chinese: 对教育家来说,时间就是知识.

sentence.English: Time is life for doctors.
sentence.Chinese: 对医生来说,时间就是生命.

sentence.English: Time is life.
sentence.Chinese: 时间就是生命.

sentence.English: Time is money for enterprisers.
sentence.Chinese: 对企业家来说,时间就是金钱.

sentence.English: Time is money.
sentence.Chinese: 时间就是金钱.

sentence.English: Time is often said to be mondy,but it is more--it is life.
sentence.Chinese: 人们常说时间就是金钱,但不如说----时间就是生命.

sentence.English: Time is speed for scientists.
sentence.Chinese: 对科学家来说,时间就是速度.

sentence.English: Time is the father of truth.
sentence.Chinese: 时间是真理之父.

sentence.English: Time is the great healer.
sentence.Chinese: 时间是最好的医治者.
