sentence.English: Time is the greatest teacher.
sentence.Chinese: 时间就是良师.

sentence.English: Time is victory for strategists.
sentence.Chinese: 对军事家来说,时间就是胜利.

sentence.English: Time is wealth for workers.
sentence.Chinese: 对工人来说,时间就是财富.

sentence.English: Time lost cannot be won again./ Time past cannot be recalled.
sentence.Chinese: 光阴一去不复返.

sentence.English: Time lost may be repented but never recalled.
sentence.Chinese: 失去时间可以后悔,但无法追回.

sentence.English: Time marches on.
sentence.Chinese: 岁月如流

sentence.English: Time means life,time means speed,time means strength.
sentence.Chinese: 时间就是生命,时间就是速度,时间就是力量.

sentence.English: Time still, as he flies, brings increase to her truth. And gives to her mind what he steals form her youth.
sentence.Chinese: 时间在飞逝中仍然带给她更多的真理, 而且把从她青春中偷走的东西给予她的智力.

sentence.English: Time tries all things.
sentence.Chinese: 时间检验一切.

sentence.English: Time works great changes.
sentence.Chinese: 时间会产生巨大的变化.

sentence.English: Time works wonders.
sentence.Chinese: 时间能创造奇迹.

sentence.English: Timely snow foretells a bumper harvest./Auspicious snow promises good harvests.
sentence.Chinese: 瑞雪兆丰年。

sentence.English: Times change.
sentence.Chinese: 时代在改变.

sentence.English: Titles do not reflect honour on men,but rather men on theri titles.
sentence.Chinese: 称号并没有给人带来荣誉，而是人给自己的称号带来荣誉。

sentence.English: To be both a speaker of words and a doer of deeds.
sentence.Chinese: 既当演说家,又做实干家.

sentence.English: To be or not to be: that is the question.
sentence.Chinese: 生与死是至关重要的问题.

sentence.English: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.
sentence.Chinese: 有些东西你想要而没有,这是幸福不可缺少的一个部分.

sentence.English: To err is human. To forgive ,divine.
sentence.Chinese: 有过失是人之常情。能原宥别人，才是超越常人。

sentence.English: To feel that one has a place in life solves half the problem of content.
sentence.Chinese: 如果感觉到自己在生活中有了一个位置,满足的问题就解决了一半.

sentence.English: To find friendship offer friendship.
sentence.Chinese: 以友谊换友谊.

sentence.English: To flee vice is the beginning of virtue,and to have got rid of folly is the beginning of wisdom.
sentence.Chinese: 远离罪恶是美德之始；摆脱愚蠢是智慧之初。

sentence.English: To follow,without halt, one aim:There's the secret of success.
sentence.Chinese: 不停顿地向一个目标前进:这就是成功的秘密.

sentence.English: To govern is to keep straight,If you take a lead in doing so, who will dare to act otherwise?
sentence.Chinese: 政者，正也。子帅以正，孰敢不正?

sentence.English: To have doubted one's own first principles is the mark of a civilized man.
sentence.Chinese: 曾对自己的最初原则表示怀疑，是文明人的标记。

sentence.English: To have great poets, there must be great audience too.
sentence.Chinese: 要有伟大的诗人，必须要有伟大的听众。

sentence.English: To hide a fault with a lie is to replace a blot by a hole.
sentence.Chinese: 用谎言掩盖错误，等于挖一个洞除掉污渍。

sentence.English: To him that does everything in its proper time, one day is worth three.
sentence.Chinese: 凡事及时做,一天赛三天.

sentence.English: To idle away one's time amounts to killing oneself.
sentence.Chinese: 虚度年华等于自杀

sentence.English: To insure peace of mind ignore the rules and regulations.
sentence.Chinese: 要想心安理得,就不要去管什么条条框框.

sentence.English: To know a little less and understand a little more is our greatest need.
sentence.Chinese: 少知道一点,多理解一点是我们最大的需要.

sentence.English: To know everything is to know nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 样样都通,件件稀松.

sentence.English: To know how to wait is the great secret of success.
sentence.Chinese: 懂得如何等待是成功的重要秘诀.

sentence.English: To know oneself is wisdom, to forget oneself is folly.
sentence.Chinese: 自知之明是智慧,忘乎所以是愚蠢.

sentence.English: To know that we know what we know,and that we do not know what we do not know,that is true knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 知之为知之,不知为不知,是知也.

sentence.English: To live in hearts we leave behind is not to die.
sentence.Chinese: 活在生者的心里,就是不死.

sentence.English: To live is to function. That is all there is in living.
sentence.Chinese: 活着就要发挥作用,这就是生活的全部内容.

sentence.English: To live remains an art which everyone must learn,and which no one can teach.
sentence.Chinese: 生活是一种人人须学而无人能教的艺术.

sentence.English: To me, faith means not worrying.
sentence.Chinese: 对我来说，信念意味着不担心。

sentence.English: To no man will we refuse justice.
sentence.Chinese: 对一切人都应给以正义。

sentence.English: To profit form good advice requires more widsom than to give it.
sentence.Chinese: 提出忠告需要智慧,采纳忠告更需要智慧.

sentence.English: To receive a present handsomely and in a right spirit, even when you have none to give in return, is to give one in retrun.
sentence.Chinese: 雍容大方地接受礼物,虽然你无以回报,也等于回赠了礼物.

sentence.English: To recognize a toxin will do you as much good as to get a good medicine.
sentence.Chinese: 认清毒物，如获良药。

sentence.English: To save time is to lengthen life.
sentence.Chinese: 节省时间就是延长生命.

sentence.English: To sensible men, every day is a day of reckoning.
sentence.Chinese: 对聪明人来说,每一天都是要计算盈亏的.

sentence.English: To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.
sentence.Chinese: 胆小怕事,优柔寡断的人,会觉得什么事看来都不可能做好.

sentence.English: To think is to see.
sentence.Chinese: 思考就是明白.

sentence.English: To wait for luck is the same thing as waiting for death.
sentence.Chinese: 等待走运无异于等待死亡.

sentence.English: To widen your life without deepening it is only to weaken it.
sentence.Chinese: 扩大 生活面而不加深生活,只能削弱生活.

sentence.English: To youth I have but three words of counsel-wrok, work, and work.
sentence.Chinese: 对青年,我的忠告只有三句话----工作,工作,工作.

sentence.English: Today is Yesterday's pupil.
sentence.Chinese: 今天是昨天的学生.

sentence.English: Today's opportunities erase yesterday's failures.
sentence.Chinese: 今日的机遇可抹去昨日的失败.

sentence.English: Tomorrow is another day.
sentence.Chinese: 明天又是一个新的开始.

sentence.English: Tomorrow never comes.
sentence.Chinese: 切莫依赖明天. / 我生待明日,万事成蹉跎.

sentence.English: Too many cooks spoil the broth.
sentence.Chinese: 厨师太多烧坏汤。

sentence.English: Too much experience is a dangerous thing.
sentence.Chinese: 经验过多反而危险.

sentence.English: Too muh spoils, too little is nothing.
sentence.Chinese: 饭多会馊,饭少不饱

sentence.English: Towering genius disdains a beaten path. It seeks regions hitherto unexplored.
sentence.Chinese: 卓越的天才不屑走旁人走过的路.他寻找迄今未开拓的地区.

sentence.English: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
sentence.Chinese: 困难的只是穿上工作服的机遇.

sentence.English: True affluence is not needing anything.
sentence.Chinese: 一无所缺是真正的富裕.

sentence.English: True coral needs no painter's bursh.
sentence.Chinese: 真珊瑚不需要用画笔.

sentence.English: True friendship is a plant of slow growth, and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity before it is entitled to that appellation.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的友谊是慢慢生长的树,要经得起患难的冲击,才称得上真正的友谊.

sentence.English: True friendship is like sound health, the value of which is seldom known until it be lost.
sentence.Chinese: 健康和友谊，不丢不知惜。

sentence.English: True friendship lasts forever.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的友谊恒久不变.

sentence.English: True love is giving, not taking.
sentence.Chinese: 真挚的爱是给予,而不是索取.

sentence.English: True love never grows old.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的爱永不衰老.

sentence.English: True nobility is exempt from fear.
sentence.Chinese: 真正高尚的人是无所畏惧的.

sentence.English: True praise roots and spreads.
sentence.Chinese: 诚实的赞美深入人心.

sentence.English: True science teaches, above all, to doubt and be ignorant.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的科学首先是教人怀疑和知道自己无知.

sentence.English: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly and they will show themselves great.
sentence.Chinese: 信任别人，别人才能对你忠诚；待人尊重，别人才能尊重自持。

sentence.English: Trust thyself only, and another shall not betray thee.
sentence.Chinese: 不信他人信自己，别人不会出卖你。

sentence.English: Truth is stranger than fiction.
sentence.Chinese: 事实离奇胜于虚构。

sentence.English: Truth is the daughter of time.
sentence.Chinese: 真理是时间的女儿.

sentence.English: Truth may be blamed, but shall never be shamed.
sentence.Chinese: 真理可能会被责难,但决不会受羞辱.

sentence.English: Truth needs no colour.
sentence.Chinese: 真理不需要打扮.

sentence.English: Truth will prevail.
sentence.Chinese: 真理必胜

sentence.English: Truth's best ornament is nakedness.
sentence.Chinese: 打扮真理的秘决是不加掩饰.

sentence.English: Try not to become a man of success but rather try to become a man of value.
sentence.Chinese: 不要为成功而努力,要为作一个有价值的人而努力.

sentence.English: Two can play at the game.
sentence.Chinese: 你会耍的花招，别人也会。

sentence.English: Two heads are better than one.
sentence.Chinese: 两人智慧胜一人.

sentence.English: Two things only a man cannot hide: that he is drunk and that he is in love.
sentence.Chinese: 人不能隐瞒的只有两件事:醉酒和恋爱.

sentence.English: Two wrongs do not make a right.
sentence.Chinese: 两个错误,加不出一个正确. /用错误改正不了错误.

sentence.English: United we stand, divided we fall.
sentence.Chinese: 团结则存,分裂则亡.

sentence.English: Vainglory blossoms but never bears.
sentence.Chinese: 虚荣光开花，永远不结果。

sentence.English: Variety is the spice of life.
sentence.Chinese: 变化是生活的调味品.

sentence.English: Very often a change of self is needed more than a change of scene.
sentence.Chinese: 改变自己往往比改变环境更为需要。

sentence.English: Vice is often clothed in virtue's habit.
sentence.Chinese: 罪恶往往披着德道的外衣。

sentence.English: Victories or defeats are tranisient, while friendship is everlasting. / To win or lose in a match is temporary while friendship between the contestants is lasting.
sentence.Chinese: 胜负是暂时的,友谊是永恒的.

sentence.English: Victory is won not in miles but in inches. Win a little now,hold your ground, and later win a little more.
sentence.Chinese: 胜利是一点一点取得的.现在取得一点点胜利,坚持不退,再取得更大的一点胜利.

sentence.English: Victory won't come to me unless I go to it.
sentence.Chinese: 胜利是不会向我走来的,我必须自己走向胜利.

sentence.English: Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent.
sentence.Chinese: 暴力是无能者的最后手段。

sentence.English: Virtue is beyond price./ Virtue is a jewel of great price.
sentence.Chinese: 美德乃无价之宝.

sentence.English: Virtue is bold, and goodness never fearful.
sentence.Chinese: 美德是勇敢的,善良从来无所畏惧.

sentence.English: Virtue never grows old.
sentence.Chinese: 美德不会衰老.

sentence.English: Vows made in storms are forgotten in calms.
sentence.Chinese: 急风暴雨时信誓旦旦，风平浪静时忘在一边。

sentence.English: Waste not, want not.
sentence.Chinese: 不浪费,不会穷.

sentence.English: Wasting time is a crime against the cause of revolution.
sentence.Chinese: 浪费时间就是对革命事业的一种罪过.

sentence.English: Wasting time is robbing oneself.
sentence.Chinese: 浪费时间就是掠夺自己.

sentence.English: Water is a boon in the desert,but the drowning man curses it.
sentence.Chinese: 水是沙漠里的恩物，快淹死的人却诅咒它。

sentence.English: Water-drops,gathered together,become a sea; experience, gathered together, becomes knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 水滴汇集成大海,经历汇集成学问.

sentence.English: We all have weaknesses, But I have figured that others have put up with mine so tolerantly that I would be less than fair not to make a reasonable discount for theirs.
sentence.Chinese: 我们都有缺点.可是我想,既然别人那么宽容我的缺点,如果我不对别人的缺点适当地宽容,那我就不够公道.

sentence.English: We are all slaves of opinoin.
sentence.Chinese: 我们都是意见的奴隶。

sentence.English: We are here to add what we can you to life,not to get what we can from it.
sentence.Chinese: 我们来到世上是为了尽自己所能给生活增加一些东西,而不是为了从生活中获取我们所能得到的一切.

sentence.English: We are in bondage to the law in order that we may be free.
sentence.Chinese: 我们受法律约束，为的是可以自由。

sentence.English: We are not born for ourselves.
sentence.Chinese: 人之有生,不为一已.

sentence.English: We are only young once. That is all society can stand.
sentence.Chinese: 我们一生只年轻一次,社会也只能忍受这么多.

sentence.English: We are such stuff as dreams are made on.
sentence.Chinese: 人生如梦幻.

sentence.English: We can only love what we know and we can never know completely what we do not love.
sentence.Chinese: 我们只能爱我们理解的东西,而永远无法彻底理解我们不爱的东西.

sentence.English: We can't all be heroes. Somebody has to sit on the curb and elap as they go by.
sentence.Chinese: 我们不可能都成为英雄。总得有人在英雄们走过时坐在路边鼓掌。

sentence.English: We cannot wait for favours from nature; we must take them from her--that is our task.
sentence.Chinese: 我们不能等待大自然的恩赐,我们必须向它索取---这就是我们的任务.

sentence.English: We could't conceive of a miracle if none had ever happened.
sentence.Chinese: 如果从来没有发生过奇迹，我们便无法想象奇迹这种事。

sentence.English: We get so much in the habit of wearing a disguise before others that we eventually appear disguised before ourselves.
sentence.Chinese: 我们惯于在别人面前矫揉造作，结果对自己也矫揉造作。

sentence.English: We grow neither better nor worse as we grow old but more and more like ourselves.
sentence.Chinese: 随着年龄的增长,我们并不变好也不变坏,而是变得更象我们自己.

sentence.English: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
sentence.Chinese: 正象我们无权只享受财富而不创造财富一样,我们也无权只享受幸福而不创造幸福.

sentence.English: We learn form the mistakes of others.
sentence.Chinese: 我们能从别人的错误中得到教训.

sentence.English: We may give advice,but we cannot give conduct.
sentence.Chinese: 别人可以相劝,做人还靠自己./ 别人可以给你忠告,但不能给你品行.

sentence.English: We must accept finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope.
sentence.Chinese: 我们必须接受失望,因为它是有限的,但千万不可失去希望,因为它是无穷的.

sentence.English: We must deal with pleasure as we do with honey,only touch them with the tip of the finger. and not with the whole hand for fear of surfeit.
sentence.Chinese: 我们应该象吃蜂蜜那样对待享受,只用指尖蘸点儿,而不能用整只手去抓,以免吃得太多.

sentence.English: We must set the example but that doesn't mean we must follow it.
sentence.Chinese: 我们必须树立起榜样，但这并不意味着我们必须照办。

sentence.English: We need in politics men who have something to give ,not men who have something to get.
sentence.Chinese: 在政治中我们需要能有所奉献的人，而不是想有所收获的人。

sentence.English: We need to learn to set our course by the stars,not by the lights of every passing shop.
sentence.Chinese: 我们应该学会按照星辰决定航向,而不是跟随每艘驶过的船只的灯光.

sentence.English: We needn't guard against one who calls himself a thief, but we should watch out for one who calls himself an upright gentleman.
sentence.Chinese: 自称盗贼的无须防，自称正人君子的必须防。

sentence.English: We often pardon those who bore us,but we cannot pardon those whom we bore.
sentence.Chinese: 我们往往原谅使我们厌烦的人，但不能原谅厌烦我们的人。

sentence.English: We prefer to die a hero,rather than live a slave.
sentence.Chinese: 宁为英雄而死,不为奴隶生.

sentence.English: We probably wouldn't worry about what people think of us if we could know how seldom they do.
sentence.Chinese: 如果我们知道别人难得想到我们，大概便不会担心别人对我们的想法。

sentence.English: We shall never have friends if we expect to find them without fault.
sentence.Chinese: 世上找不到十全十美的朋友.

sentence.English: We should never remember the benefits we have offered, not forget the favour received.
sentence.Chinese: 做点好事别提起，别人恩情要牢记。

sentence.English: We should so live and labor in our time that what came to us as seed may go to the next generation as blossom,and that what came to us as blossom may go to them as fruit. This is what we mean by progress.
sentence.Chinese: 我们一生应该这样地生活和劳动,使给予我们的种子能在下一代开花,使给予我们的花朵能在下一代结果.这就是我们所说的进步的意义.

sentence.English: We soon believe what we desire.
sentence.Chinese: 心里想什么就会相信什么。

sentence.English: We thought, because we had power,we had wisdom.
sentence.Chinese: 我们曾这样想,因为我们有权力,我们就有智慧.

sentence.English: Weak men are crushed by detraction, but the brave hold on and succeed.
sentence.Chinese: 贬抑只能压倒弱者,勇者则能坚持到胜利.

sentence.English: Wealth got by labour is sweet in the enjoyment.
sentence.Chinese: 劳动得来的财富享受起来味道甜美.

sentence.English: Wealth is a slave to the wise, a master to the fool.
sentence.Chinese: 财富是聪明人的奴隶,是蠢人的主子.

sentence.English: Wealth is the test of a man's character.
sentence.Chinese: 财富是对一个人品格的试金石.

sentence.English: What God will no frost can kill.
sentence.Chinese: 天意难违。

sentence.English: What I do today is important because I am exchanging a day of my life for it.
sentence.Chinese: 我今天做的事情很重要,因为我为它付了一天生命的代价.

sentence.English: What art offers is space-a certain breathing room for the spirit.
sentence.Chinese: 艺术提供的空间——一种给心灵呼吸的空间。

sentence.English: What colour do you like best?----Red.
sentence.Chinese: 你最喜欢的颜色是什么?---红色.

sentence.English: What do you like to do best?---Delving into books.
sentence.Chinese: 你最喜欢做的事是什么?----啃书本

sentence.English: What greater crime than loss of time?
sentence.Chinese: 浪费时间是最大犯罪.

sentence.English: What is a workman without his tools?
sentence.Chinese: 巧妇难为无米之炊。

sentence.English: What is bought is cheaper than a gift.
sentence.Chinese: 自己花钱买的，比别人送的便宜。

sentence.English: What is bred in the bone will never come out of the flesh.
sentence.Chinese: 江山好改，本性难移。

sentence.English: What is done by night appears by day.
sentence.Chinese: 若要人不知。除非己莫为。

sentence.English: What is it that characterizes your personality? ----An unswerving aim.
sentence.Chinese: 你的主要特点是什么?-----目标始终如一

sentence.English: What is learned in the cradle is carried to the grave.
sentence.Chinese: 孩提时代学到的东西,到老死也不会忘记.

sentence.English: What is worth doing is worth doing well.
sentence.Chinese: 一件事如果值得做,就值得做好.

sentence.English: What makes life dreary is the want of motive.
sentence.Chinese: 没有了目的,生活便郁闷无光.

sentence.English: What man has done,man can do.
sentence.Chinese: 前人能办的事,后人也能做.

sentence.English: What may be done at any time is done at no time.
sentence.Chinese: 随时可做的事,往往没时间做.

sentence.English: What may be done at any time will be done at no time.
sentence.Chinese: 因循蹉跎,一事无成.

sentence.English: What meatters is not the idea a man holds,but the depth at which he holds it.
sentence.Chinese: 关键不在于一个人所持的观点，而在于他的这个观点有多么根深蒂固。

sentence.English: What moral character do you value most? ---Simplicity.
sentence.Chinese: 你最珍贵的品德是什么?----朴素.

sentence.English: What one loses on the swings one makes up on the roundabouts.
sentence.Chinese: 失之东隅，收之桑榆。

sentence.English: What the heart thinks the tongue speaks.
sentence.Chinese: 言为心声。

sentence.English: What weakness is it that you can never tolerate?---Sycophancy and servile flattery.
sentence.Chinese: 你最不能容忍的缺点是什么?----奴颜婢膝.

sentence.English: What you have inherited from your fathers, earn over again for yourselves,or it will not be yours.
sentence.Chinese: 从祖先继承来的东西,必须自己重新挣取,否则它将不属于你.

sentence.English: What's done cannot be undone.
sentence.Chinese: 木已成舟，覆水难收。

sentence.English: What's in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet.
sentence.Chinese: 名字有什么关系?把玫瑰花叫做别的名称，它还是照样芳香。

sentence.English: What's lost is lost.
sentence.Chinese: 失者不可复得。

sentence.English: What's man's first duty? The answer's brief: To be himself.
sentence.Chinese: 人的第一天职是什么?答案简单:不伪饰自己.

sentence.English: What's the use of running when you are on the wrong road?
sentence.Chinese: 路走错了，跑步又有何用?

sentence.English: Whatever you do,do with your might.
sentence.Chinese: 不论干哪 一行,都要尽力干.

sentence.English: When Greek meets Greek,then comes the tug of war.
sentence.Chinese: 两雄相遇，其斗必烈。

sentence.English: When I say I know women, I mean I know that I don't know them.
sentence.Chinese: 当我说我了解女人时，我的意思是我知道我并不了解她们。

sentence.English: When I was young, I admired clever prople. Now that I am old, I admire kind people.
sentence.Chinese: 少时喜欢聪明人,老来喜欢仁厚人.

sentence.English: When a dog bites a man that is not news, but when a man bites a dog that is news.
sentence.Chinese: 狗咬人不是新闻，人咬狗才是新闻。

sentence.English: When a man assumes a public trust, he should consider himself as public property.
sentence.Chinese: 当一个人受到公众信任时，他就应该把自己看作公众的财产。

sentence.English: When a man assumes a public trust,he should consider himself a pubic property.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人接受了公众的信任之后,就应该把自己看作是公共的财产.

sentence.English: When a man points a finger at someone else, he should remember that three of his fingers are pointing at himself.
sentence.Chinese: 用手指着别人的时候，该记得另三只手指是指着自己的。

sentence.English: When a man says he approves of something in principle,it means he hasn't the slightest intention of putting it into practice.
sentence.Chinese: 当一个人说他原则上赞成某事时，那就是说他根本无意把那件事付诸实施。

sentence.English: When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of ,he always declares that it is his duty.
sentence.Chinese: 愚人做自己感到惭愧的事情时，总是宣称那是他的职责。

sentence.English: When all else is lost the future still remains.
sentence.Chinese: 就是失去了一切别的，也还有未来。

sentence.English: When all men think alike, no man thinks very much.
sentence.Chinese: 大家都一样想的时候就没有人多想了。

sentence.English: When an opportunity is neglected, it never comes back to you.
sentence.Chinese: 机不可失,时不再来.

sentence.English: When angry, count ten before you speak; if very angry, count a hundred.
sentence.Chinese: 生气的时候，先数到十再开口；如果非常愤怒，先数到一百。

sentence.English: When answering the questions raised by his daughters Jenny and Laura.Marx wrote:
sentence.Chinese: 马克思在回答自己女儿燕妮和劳拉提出的问题时:写道

sentence.English: When at Rome,do as the Romans do.
sentence.Chinese: 入乡随风，入境随俗。

sentence.English: When nature brings difficulties to man, she also bestows a few ounces of intelligence on him.
sentence.Chinese: 大自然在给予人们困难时,也给人们增添几分智力.

sentence.English: When patterns are broken,new worlds can emerge.
sentence.Chinese: 打破固定的模式，新世界才能出现。/ 破旧立新。

sentence.English: When people are free to do as they please, they usually imitate each other.
sentence.Chinese: 当人们可以自由行事时，他们常常互相模仿。

sentence.English: When someone is beating a gong,listen to its overtones;when someone is talking,listen to his voice.
sentence.Chinese: 锣鼓听音，说话听声。

sentence.English: When someone sings his own praises,he always gets the tune too high.
sentence.Chinese: 一个人歌颂自己时，音调往往太高。

sentence.English: When the dust of death has choked a great man's voice,the common words he said turn to oracles.
sentence.Chinese: 死亡使一个伟人的声音沉寂之后,他生前平淡无奇的话,都成了至理名言.

sentence.English: When the enemy praises you.you should ask yourself what errors you have committed.
sentence.Chinese: 当敌人夸奖你的时候，你得想到自己做错了什么。

sentence.English: When the fight begins within himself, a man's worth something.
sentence.Chinese: 当一个内心开始斗争时,他就有了价值.

sentence.English: When the fox preaches, take care of your geese.
sentence.Chinese: 狐狸说教,当心鹅被盗.

sentence.English: When the fox preaches,the cock should ponder.
sentence.Chinese: 要是狐狸布道，公鸡就该深思。

sentence.English: When the lust has conceived,it bears sin,and the sin,when it is full-grown,brings forth death.
sentence.Chinese: 私欲既怀了胎，就生出罪来。罪既成长，就会死去。

sentence.English: When there is solar halo,it will rain;When there is lunar halo,it will blow.
sentence.Chinese: 日晕而雨，月晕而风。

sentence.English: When you have to make a choice and don't make it,that is in itself a choice.
sentence.Chinese: 当你必须作出选择而不选择时,这本身也是一种选择.

sentence.English: When you make new friends, don't forget the old one's.
sentence.Chinese: 有了新知,勿忘旧交.

sentence.English: When you sit with a nice girl for two hours you think it's only a minute. But when you sit on a hot stove for a minute you think it's two hours. That's relativity.
sentence.Chinese: 你和一位可爱的女郎坐在一起,两小时就象一分钟;你坐在炽热的炉灶上,一分钟就象两小时.这就是相对论.

sentence.English: Where it concerns himself, who's angry at a slander makes it true.
sentence.Chinese: 一涉及自己，忿怒便会使诽谤成真。

sentence.English: Where there are industrious persons, there is wealth, for the hand of the diligent makes riches.
sentence.Chinese: 哪里人勤劳,哪里就富裕,因为勤劳之手创财富.

sentence.English: Where there is a will, there is a way.
sentence.Chinese: 只要意志坚,道路不难寻.

sentence.English: Where there is unity, there is victory. / Victory belongs to those who are united.
sentence.Chinese: 有团结就有胜利.

sentence.English: Wherever valour true is found,true modesty will there abound.
sentence.Chinese: 真正的勇敢,都饱含谦虚.

sentence.English: Whether the pitcher strikes the stone, or the stone the pitcher, it is bad for the pitcher.
sentence.Chinese: 不论是水罐敲石头，还是石头敲水罐，都是水罐遭殃。

sentence.English: While the grass grows the horse starves.
sentence.Chinese: 等到草长出来,马已经饿死. / 远水不救近火.

sentence.English: While there is life there is hope.
sentence.Chinese: 一息尚存,希望不灭.

sentence.English: While there is one untrodden tract For intellect or will. And men are free to think and act, Life is worth living.
sentence.Chinese: 只要还有一块知识和意志尚未征服的领域,只要人们能自由思考和行动,生活就是值得的.

sentence.English: Who chatters to you will chatter of you.
sentence.Chinese: 对你论人是非者，必将对人论你是非。

sentence.English: Who has never tasted bitter, knows not what is sweet.
sentence.Chinese: 不尝黄连苦, 怎知蜂蜜甜.

sentence.English: Who knows most says least.
sentence.Chinese: 知道得最多的人说得最少。

sentence.English: Who learns young forgets not when he is old.
sentence.Chinese: 少而勤学,老而不忘.

sentence.English: Who likes not his business, his business likes not him.
sentence.Chinese: 谁若不爱本职,他的本职也不喜欢他.

sentence.English: Who loseth liberth loseth all.
sentence.Chinese: 失掉自由使失掉一切.

sentence.English: Who meddleth in all things may shoe the gosling.
sentence.Chinese: 爱管闲事只是浪费时间.

sentence.English: Who of us is mature enough for offspring before the offspring themselves arrive? The value of marriage is not that adults produce children but that children produce adults.
sentence.Chinese: 我们之中,有谁在生儿育子女前已成熟到可为人父母?结婚的好处并不在于成人可生养孩子,而在于孩子可助人成熟.

sentence.English: Who repairs not his gutters repairs his whole house.
sentence.Chinese: 今日不补沟,他日必补屋.

sentence.English: Who says that the heart of an inch-long plant. Can requite the radiance of full Spring?
sentence.Chinese: 谁言寸草心,报得三春晖.

sentence.English: Who swims in sin shall sink in sorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 在罪恶中漂浮者终将在悲哀中沉没。

sentence.English: Who will not keep a penny never shall have many.
sentence.Chinese: 不储小钱,哪来大钱.

sentence.English: Whom the gods destroy,they first make mad.
sentence.Chinese: 上帝要谁灭亡，必先让他疯狂。

sentence.English: Whosoever understands the times is great man. / A wise man submits to circumstances.
sentence.Chinese: 识时务者为俊杰。

sentence.English: Why is it that we rejoice at a birth and grieve at a funeral? It is because we are not the person involved.
sentence.Chinese: 我们为什么听到有人诞生就欢喜，看到有人出殡就悲伤呢?因为诞生和死亡的是别人。

sentence.English: Will, work and wait are the pyramidal cornerstones for success.
sentence.Chinese: 意志,工作,等待,是成功的三角塔的基石.

sentence.English: Wine and judgement mature with age.
sentence.Chinese: 酒老味醇,人老识深.

sentence.English: Wisdom comes form extensive observation and broad knowledge.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明来自于见多识广.

sentence.English: Wisdom consists in the ability to discriminate between the probable and improbable, and in being reconciled to the inevitable.
sentence.Chinese: 智慧在于辨别可能与不可能并顺应不可避免的事情。

sentence.English: Wisdom first teaches what is right.
sentence.Chinese: 智慧首先教人明理.

sentence.English: Wisdom in the mind is better than money in the hand.
sentence.Chinese: 头脑里的知识比手中的金钱更有用.

sentence.English: Wisdom is a good purchase though we pay dear for it.
sentence.Chinese: 为了求得智慧,代价再高也值得.

sentence.English: Wisdom is better than gold or silver.
sentence.Chinese: 知识胜过金银.

sentence.English: Wisdom is in the head and not in the beard.
sentence.Chinese: 智慧在于有脑子，不在于有胡子。

sentence.English: Wisdom is more precious than wealth.
sentence.Chinese: 智慧比财富更宝贵.

sentence.English: Wisdom is more to be envied than riches.
sentence.Chinese: 知识比财富更令人羡慕.

sentence.English: Wisdom is only found in truth.
sentence.Chinese: 唯有在真理中才能找到智慧.

sentence.English: Wisdom is to the mind what health is to the body.
sentence.Chinese: 智慧之于头脑,犹如健康之于躯体.

sentence.English: Wise fear begets care.
sentence.Chinese: 懂得担心,就会小心.

sentence.English: Wise men love truth. whereas fools shun it.
sentence.Chinese: 智者爱真理,愚者怕真理.

sentence.English: Wise men seek instruction, fools fall for applause.
sentence.Chinese: 聪明人喜欢别人指教,蠢人则喜欢别人赞美.

sentence.English: Wish you an endless view to cheer your eyes? Then one more story mount and higher rise.
sentence.Chinese: 欲穷千里目,更上一层楼.

sentence.English: Wishes never can fill a sack.
sentence.Chinese: 愿望装不满口袋。

sentence.English: Wit bought is better than wit taught.
sentence.Chinese: 付出代价学到的东西胜过老师教导.

sentence.English: Wit is the salt of conversation,not the food.
sentence.Chinese: 风趣是谈话中的盐，而不是主食。

sentence.English: With justice on your side,you can go anywhere; without it; you can't take a step.
sentence.Chinese: 有理走遍天下,无理寸步难行.

sentence.English: Without a friend,the worlds is a wilderness.
sentence.Chinese: 没有朋友,世界成了荒野.

sentence.English: Without carrying the load yourself you don't know how heavy it is,without walking the long distance yourself you don't know how far it is.
sentence.Chinese: 不挑担子不知重，不走长路不知远。

sentence.English: Without confidence there is no friendship.
sentence.Chinese: 没有信任就没有友谊.

sentence.English: Without hard work there won't be any scientific creations.
sentence.Chinese: 没有艰苦劳动,就没有科学创造.

sentence.English: Without learning. without eyes.
sentence.Chinese: 没有学识就是盲人.

sentence.English: Without method little can be done to any good purpose.
sentence.Chinese: 没有方法,什么事也做不好.

sentence.English: Without modesty beauty is ungraceful and wit detestable.
sentence.Chinese: 没有谦虚，美丽就不端庄，机智也讨人嫌。

sentence.English: Without respect, love cannot go far.
sentence.Chinese: 没有尊重的爱难以久存.

sentence.English: Women have simple tastes:they can get pleasure out of the conversation of children in arms and men in love.
sentence.Chinese: 女人们有最简单的爱好:她们能够从怀抱的孩子和爱她们的男人的谈话里得到快乐.

sentence.English: Wonders will never cease.
sentence.Chinese: 奇迹无穷尽。

sentence.English: Words are like bees, they have honey and a sting.
sentence.Chinese: 言语象蜜蜂,有蜜也有刺.

sentence.English: Words are like leaves; And where they most abound,much fruit of sense beneath is rarely found.
sentence.Chinese: 言语就象树叶，在最茂密的树叶下，很难找到丰硕的理智之果。

sentence.English: Words are the most powerful drug used by mankind.
sentence.Chinese: 言词是人类最有效的药物.

sentence.English: Words are the wise man's counters and the fool's money.
sentence.Chinese: 智者嘴在心里,愚者把它当金钱.

sentence.English: Words without ideas are likes sails without wind.
sentence.Chinese: 言之无物犹如有帆无风.

sentence.English: Work banishes those three great evils: boredom,vice and poverty.
sentence.Chinese: 工作撵跑三个恶鬼:无聊,堕落和贫穷.

sentence.English: Work is the grand cure of all the maladies and miseries that ever beset mankind.
sentence.Chinese: 工作是医治人间一切病痛和疾苦的万应良药.

sentence.English: Work is the true source of human welfare.
sentence.Chinese: 劳动是人类福祉的真正源泉.

sentence.English: Work while you work, play while you play.
sentence.Chinese: 工作的时候工作,游玩的时候游玩.

sentence.English: Work won't kill but worry will.
sentence.Chinese: 劳动无害，忧愁伤身。

sentence.English: Working without a plan is sailing without a compass.
sentence.Chinese: 工作无计划等于航海无罗盘.

sentence.English: Would you know your daughter, see her in company.
sentence.Chinese: 欲知女儿品性,可看她在人前的表现.

sentence.English: Write down the advice of him who loves you, though you like it not at present.
sentence.Chinese: 忠言虽难听,必须记在心.

sentence.English: Write it on your heart that every day is the best of the year.
sentence.Chinese: 把这铭记在你心里:每一天都是一年中最好的日子.

sentence.English: Writers,composers,entertainers and such know an awful truth: it is easier to please a million eople you don't know than to please one person you do know.
sentence.Chinese: 作家、作曲家、表演艺人等都知道一个可怕的事实：取悦一百万个陌生人，比 取悦一个熟人更容易。

sentence.English: Years bring wisdom.
sentence.Chinese: 年岁带来智慧.

sentence.English: You are not beaten until you give up.
sentence.Chinese: 你只要不投降就没有被打败.

sentence.English: You are not in charge of the universe; you are in charge of yourself.
sentence.Chinese: 你并不掌管整个宇宙,但你得掌管你自己.

sentence.English: You are permitted in time of great danger to walk with the devil until you have crossed the bridge.
sentence.Chinese: 危急之时人可以与魔鬼结伴而行，但需只到走过险桥后为止。

sentence.English: You are your greatest enemy if you are a coward; but if you are brave,you are your greatest friend.
sentence.Chinese: 怯懦者是自己最大的敌人。 勇敢者是自己最好的朋友。

sentence.English: You can become a Communist only when you enrich your mind with a knowledge of all the treasures created by mankind.
sentence.Chinese: 只有用人类创造的全部知识财富来丰富自己的头脑,才能成为共产主义者.

sentence.English: You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time,but you cannot fool all the people all the time.
sentence.Chinese: 你可以一时骗过所有的人，也可以在所有时间里骗过一些人，但不能在所有时 间里骗过所有的人。

sentence.English: You can read philosophy by yourself if you want to, but you must share a joke with someone else.
sentence.Chinese: 如果你愿意的话,可以一个人读哲学,但笑话必须与他人分享.

sentence.English: You can take a horse to the water but you cannot make him drink.
sentence.Chinese: 你可以把马牵到河边，但无法强迫它喝水。

sentence.English: You can tell a man's taste in literature by his judgment in knowing what not to read.
sentence.Chinese: 从一个人认为哪 些书不该看,你就可以知道他对文学的趣味高下.

sentence.English: You can tell the ideals of a nation by its ad vertisements.
sentence.Chinese: 从一个民族的广告可以看出这个民族的理想。

sentence.English: You can tell the size of a man by the size of the things that make him mad.
sentence.Chinese: 你可以根据多大的事情能使一个人生气，判断出这个人的器量。

sentence.English: You can't be afraid of stepping on toes if you want to go dancing.
sentence.Chinese: 你想去跳舞就不能害怕踩着别人的脚.

sentence.English: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
sentence.Chinese: 你不能靠你声称将要去做的事建立声誉.

sentence.English: You can't gain knowledge without practice. Wisdom comes from experience.
sentence.Chinese: 不经实践,不长知识. 智慧来自经验.

sentence.English: You can't have everything in this life.
sentence.Chinese: 万事如意古来难。

sentence.English: You can't judge a tree by its bark.
sentence.Chinese: 人不可貌相.

sentence.English: You can't make omelets without breaking eggs.
sentence.Chinese: 要炒鸡蛋必得打破鸡蛋.

sentence.English: You can't ride two horses at the same time.
sentence.Chinese: 不能同时骑两匹马.

sentence.English: You cannot burn the candle at both ends.
sentence.Chinese: 蜡烛不能两头点。

sentence.English: You cannot catch old birds with chaff.
sentence.Chinese: 用秕糠捉不到精明鸟。

sentence.English: You cannot have two forenoons in the same day.
sentence.Chinese: 同一天里是不可能有两个上午的.

sentence.English: You cannot kill time without injuring eternity.
sentence.Chinese: 消磨时间不可能不伤害永恒.

sentence.English: You cannot make a crab walk straight.
sentence.Chinese: 你无法叫螃蟹直着走。/不要做不可能的事。

sentence.English: You cannot make a silk purse out of sow's ear.
sentence.Chinese: 用猪耳朵做不成丝钱包。

sentence.English: You cannot put old heads on young shoulders.
sentence.Chinese: 幼者难具长者智.

sentence.English: You don't get to choose how you're going to die,or when. You can only decide how you're going to live now.
sentence.Chinese: 你不能选择怎样死,或什么时候死.你只能决定现在怎样生活.

sentence.English: You eat and eat, but you do not drink to fill you.
sentence.Chinese: 吃饭要饱，饮酒要少。

sentence.English: You have to believe in yourself.That's the secret of success.
sentence.Chinese: 人必须相信自已,这是成功的秘诀.

sentence.English: You know what charm is: A way of getting the answer ”Yes”without having asked any clear question.
sentence.Chinese: 你知道什么是魅力：一种不用明白地提出问题而能得到肯定答复的办法。

sentence.English: You may delay, but time will not.
sentence.Chinese: 你可以耽搁,但时间不会延迟.

sentence.English: You may glean knowledge by reading. but you must separate the chaff form the wheat by thinking.
sentence.Chinese: 读书可以获得知识,思考才能去粗存精.

sentence.English: You may know by a handful the whole sack.
sentence.Chinese: 抓一把就可知整袋装的是什么。/见微知著。

sentence.English: You need to be discreet in giving advice, humble in accepting it.
sentence.Chinese: 提出忠告要谨慎，接受忠告要虚心。

sentence.English: You never know what is enough,unless you know what is more than enough.
sentence.Chinese: 欲知何者为足够,必须先知何者为多余.

sentence.English: You never know what you can do till you try.
sentence.Chinese: 不尝试就不知道你能做什么.

sentence.English: You never know your luck.
sentence.Chinese: 命运好坏不由已.

sentence.English: You only live once. But if you work it right, once is enough.
sentence.Chinese: 你只活一次,如果活得好,一次就够了.

sentence.English: You should,like a candle,burn yourself out to give light to others.
sentence.Chinese: 要象蜡烛一样燃烧自已,照亮别人.

sentence.English: You will never have what you like until you learn to like what you have.
sentence.Chinese: 欲得到你喜欢的东西,应先学会喜欢你已有的东西.

sentence.English: You'll never get rid of a bad temper by losing it.
sentence.Chinese: 用发脾气的办法永远改不掉坏脾气。

sentence.English: Young people must equip themselves for life's duties and guard against its temptations.
sentence.Chinese: 年轻人必须为履行生活所赋予他们的职责充实自己,同时要抵制生活的诱惑.

sentence.English: Your liberty to swing your arms ends where my nose begins.
sentence.Chinese: 你有挥舞手臂的自由，但这自由必须止于我的鼻端。

sentence.English: Youth and white paper take any impression.
sentence.Chinese: 青年犹如白纸,可以打上任何印记.

sentence.English: Youth is a blunder; manhood a struggle; old age a regret.
sentence.Chinese: 青年鲁莽灭裂,中年奋斗不止;老年后悔无穷.

sentence.English: Youth is full of pleasance, age is full of care.
sentence.Chinese: 青春充满愉快，高龄满怀忧虑。

sentence.English: Youth is half the battle.
sentence.Chinese: 年轻是胜利的一半.

sentence.English: Youth is not being 20 years old. A young man is one who is moved by any injustice in the world.
sentence.Chinese: 并非韶华二十便算年轻，一个人能为世上的不公平感到不平才是年轻。

sentence.English: Youth is the season of hope.
sentence.Chinese: 青春是希望的季节.

sentence.English: Youth will have its course.
sentence.Chinese: 人生谁无少年时,甜苦酸辛各自知.

sentence.English: Zeal should not outrun discretion.
sentence.Chinese: 热情不应压倒谨慎。

sentence.English: Zeal without knowledge is a fire without light.
sentence.Chinese: 热情而无知,犹如无光之火.

sentence.English: fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
sentence.Chinese: 天使畏惧处,愚人敢闯入.

sentence.English: friendship cannot stand always on one side.
sentence.Chinese: 友谊是双方的事.

sentence.English: virtue is the only true nobility.
sentence.Chinese: 唯有美德是高贵的.

sentence.English: Absolutely
sentence.Chinese: (用于答话）是这样;当然是;正是如此;绝对如

sentence.English: Absolutely impossible
sentence.Chinese: 绝对不可能的！

sentence.English: All I have to do is learn English
sentence.Chinese: 我所要做的就是学英语。

sentence.English: Are you free tomorrow?
sentence.Chinese: 你明天有空吗?

sentence.English: Are you married?
sentence.Chinese: 你结婚了吗？

sentence.English: Are you used to the food here?
sentence.Chinese: 你习惯吃这儿的饭菜吗？

sentence.English: Be careful
sentence.Chinese: 小心／注意。

sentence.English: Be my guest
sentence.Chinese: 请便／别客气。

sentence.English: Better late than never
sentence.Chinese: 迟到总比不到好。

sentence.English: Better luck next time
sentence.Chinese: 祝你下一次好运。

sentence.English: Better safe than sorry
sentence.Chinese: 小心不出大错。

sentence.English: Can I have a day off?
sentence.Chinese: 我能请一天假吗？

sentence.English: Can I have a word with you?
sentence.Chinese: 我能跟你谈一谈吗？

sentence.English: Could you do me a favor?
sentence.Chinese: 能请你帮个忙吗？

sentence.English: Could you introduce me to her?
sentence.Chinese: 你能把我介绍给她吗？

sentence.English: Could you say it again?
sentence.Chinese: 你能再说一遍吗？

sentence.English: Could you tell me where I can find these books?
sentence.Chinese: 您能告诉我在哪儿能找到这些书吗？

sentence.English: Curzon Street?Isn't Mary living there?
sentence.Chinese: 可胜街？玛丽不是也住那儿吗？

sentence.English: Did you see the special last night?
sentence.Chinese: 昨晚你看特别节目了吗？

sentence.English: Did you use to go fishing with friends?
sentence.Chinese: 过去你常和朋友钓鱼吗？

sentence.English: Do I need to be hospitalized?
sentence.Chinese: 我需要住院吗？

sentence.English: Do you fell better now?
sentence.Chinese: 你现在觉得好点了吗？

sentence.English: Do you get much rain in summer?
sentence.Chinese: 这里夏天雨水多吗？

sentence.English: Do you go on picnics?
sentence.Chinese: 你常去郊游吗？

sentence.English: Do you have a TV guide?
sentence.Chinese: 你有电视节目吗？

sentence.English: Do you have a computer?
sentence.Chinese: 你有计算机吗？

sentence.English: Do you have an appointment?
sentence.Chinese: 你有预约吗？

sentence.English: Do you have any brothers or sisters?
sentence.Chinese: 你有兄弟或姐妹吗？

sentence.English: Do you have any hobbies?
sentence.Chinese: 你有什么爱好吗？

sentence.English: Do you have any idea?
sentence.Chinese: 你怎么想？

sentence.English: Do you have any more colors?
sentence.Chinese: 有别的颜色吗？

sentence.English: Do you have any plan for your career?
sentence.Chinese: 你对未来有什么计划吗？

sentence.English: Do you have anything to declare?
sentence.Chinese: 你有什么东西要向海关申报的吗？

sentence.English: Do you have glue?I need some here.
sentence.Chinese: 你有胶水吗？我这里需要一点。

sentence.English: Do you have my pencil?
sentence.Chinese: 你拿了我的铅笔吗？

sentence.English: Do you have shampoo here?
sentence.Chinese: 这儿有香波卖吗？

sentence.English: Do you know Mary?
sentence.Chinese: 你认识玛丽吗？

sentence.English: Do you know the exact date?
sentence.Chinese: 你知道确切日期吗？

sentence.English: Do you know what's on tonight?
sentence.Chinese: 你知道今天上演什么？

sentence.English: Do you know where I've put my glasses?
sentence.Chinese: 你知道我把眼镜搁哪儿了吗？

sentence.English: Do you like pop music?
sentence.Chinese: 你喜欢流行音乐吗？

sentence.English: Do you like to take a local train or an express?
sentence.Chinese: 你想坐普通车还是特快？

sentence.English: Do you like traveling?
sentence.Chinese: 你喜欢郊游吗？

sentence.English: Do you live with your parents?
sentence.Chinese: 你和你父母住一起吗？

sentence.English: Do you often go to a concert?
sentence.Chinese: 你经常去听音乐会吗？

sentence.English: Do you plan to do some odd jobs?
sentence.Chinese: 你打算打工吗？

sentence.English: Do you read advertisements too?
sentence.Chinese: 你也看广告吗？

sentence.English: Do you really want to know what I think?
sentence.Chinese: 你真想知道我怎么想吗？

sentence.English: Do you speak English?
sentence.Chinese: 你会说英语吗？

sentence.English: Do you still remember that Christmas?
sentence.Chinese: 你仍记得那个圣诞节吗？

sentence.English: Do you want some fruit?
sentence.Chinese: 你要水果吗？

sentence.English: Do you want to airmail it or not?
sentence.Chinese: 你想发航空信吗？

sentence.English: Do you want to change before the banquet?
sentence.Chinese: 宴会前你想换衣服吗？

sentence.English: Does anybody share David's opinion?
sentence.Chinese: 有谁同意大卫的观点吗？

sentence.English: Does his film appeal to you?
sentence.Chinese: 你喜欢他的电影吗？

sentence.English: Does the shop open at 9 am on weekdays?
sentence.Chinese: 这家店平日是早上9点开门吗？

sentence.English: Does your computer have a modem?
sentence.Chinese: 你的电脑有调制解调器吗？

sentence.English: Don't forget to put stamps on your letter.
sentence.Chinese: 别忘了贴邮票。

sentence.English: Don't hesitate any more.
sentence.Chinese: 别在犹豫了。

sentence.English: Don't shilly-shally.
sentence.Chinese: 别犹豫不决。

sentence.English: Don't you think it's too formal?
sentence.Chinese: 你不觉得太正式了吗？

sentence.English: Every one must receive 9 years of compulsory education.
sentence.Chinese: 每人必须接受九年的义务教育。

sentence.English: Excuse me.Can you tell me how to get to Mr.Hu's restaurant?
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，你能告诉我怎么去胡先生的餐馆吗？

sentence.English: Excuse me.Where is No.5 Street?
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，第五大街在哪儿？

sentence.English: Fashion is a very popular magazine in America.
sentence.Chinese: 《时尚》是美国很流行的杂志。

sentence.English: Football is my favorite.

sentence.English: That's for sure

sentence.English: That's good to know
sentence.Chinese: 幸好知道了这件事。

sentence.English: That's just what I was thinking
sentence.Chinese: 我也是这么想的。

sentence.English: That's life
sentence.Chinese: 这就是生活。

sentence.English: That's more like it
sentence.Chinese: 那样才像话。

sentence.English: That's not a problem
sentence.Chinese: 那没问题。

sentence.English: That's not true
sentence.Chinese: 那是不对的。

sentence.English: That's OK
sentence.Chinese: 可以。

sentence.English: That's ridiculous
sentence.Chinese: 那太荒唐了。

sentence.English: That's the way I look at it,too
sentence.Chinese: 我也是这么想。

sentence.English: That's the way it is
sentence.Chinese: 就是这么回事。

sentence.English: That's worthwhile
sentence.Chinese: 那是值得的。

sentence.English: The same to you
sentence.Chinese: 你也一样。

sentence.English: The shortest answer is doing
sentence.Chinese: 最简短的回答是干。

sentence.English: The sooner,the better
sentence.Chinese: 愈快愈好。

sentence.English: There is a call for you
sentence.Chinese: 有你的电话。

sentence.English: There is no doubt about it
sentence.Chinese: 那是毫无疑问的。

sentence.English: There is nothing I can do
sentence.Chinese: 我无能为力。

sentence.English: There's a possibility
sentence.Chinese: 有这个可能。

sentence.English: These things happen all the time
sentence.Chinese: 这是常有的事。

sentence.English: This soup tastes great
sentence.Chinese: 这个汤非常美味。

sentence.English: Time is money
sentence.Chinese: 时间就是金钱。

sentence.English: Tomorrow never comes
sentence.Chinese: 莫依赖明天。

sentence.English: Two heads are better than one
sentence.Chinese: 人多智广。

sentence.English: We are in the sme boat
sentence.Chinese: 我们的处境相同。

sentence.English: We can get by
sentence.Chinese: 我们过得去。

sentence.English: We can work it out
sentence.Chinese: 我们可以解决这个问题。

sentence.English: We have a lot in common
sentence.Chinese: 我们有很多相同之处。

sentence.English: We'll see
sentence.Chinese: 再说吧。

sentence.English: What a coincidence!
sentence.Chinese: 真是太巧了！

sentence.English: What a shame!
sentence.Chinese: 真是遗憾！

sentence.English: What are you talking about?
sentence.Chinese: 你在说什么?

sentence.English: What are you up to?
sentence.Chinese: 你在忙什么呢？

sentence.English: What are your plans for the weekend?
sentence.Chinese: 你周末计划做什么？

sentence.English: What can I do for you?
sentence.Chinese: 要我帮忙吗？

sentence.English: What do you do for relaxation?
sentence.Chinese: 你做什么消遣？

sentence.English: What do you recommend?
sentence.Chinese: 你推荐什么？

sentence.English: What do you think of it?
sentence.Chinese: 你觉得怎么样？

sentence.English: What do you think of my new car?
sentence.Chinese: 你觉得我的新车怎么样？

sentence.English: What is it about?
sentence.Chinese: 这是关于什么的？

sentence.English: What is it like there?
sentence.Chinese: 那儿怎么样？

sentence.English: What makes you say so?
sentence.Chinese: 你怎么这么说？

sentence.English: What's going on?
sentence.Chinese: 发生什么事了？

sentence.English: What's on your mind?
sentence.Chinese: 你在想什么呢？

sentence.English: What's the deadline?
sentence.Chinese: 截止到什么时候？

sentence.English: What's the matter with you？
sentence.Chinese: 你怎么啦？

sentence.English: What's the purpose of your visit？
sentence.Chinese: 你来访的目的是什么？

sentence.English: What's the weather like?
sentence.Chinese: 天气怎么样？

sentence.English: What's your favorite food?
sentence.Chinese: 你最喜欢的食物是什么？

sentence.English: What's your job?
sentence.Chinese: 你做什么工作？

sentence.English: Whatever you think is fine with me
sentence.Chinese: 我随你。

sentence.English: When is the most convenient time for you?
sentence.Chinese: 你什么时候最方便？

sentence.English: When will it be ready?
sentence.Chinese: 什么时候能准备好？

sentence.English: Where are you going?
sentence.Chinese: 你去哪儿？

sentence.English: Where can I check in?
sentence.Chinese: 在那儿办理登记手续?

sentence.English: Where can I go for help?
sentence.Chinese: 我该怎么办？

sentence.English: Where do you live?
sentence.Chinese: 你住在哪儿？

sentence.English: Where have you been?
sentence.Chinese: 你去哪儿了？

sentence.English: Where is the rest room,please?
sentence.Chinese: 请问洗手间在哪儿？

sentence.English: Where were we?
sentence.Chinese: 我们说到哪儿了？

sentence.English: Who is in charge here?
sentence.Chinese: 这里谁负责？

sentence.English: Would you care for a drink?
sentence.Chinese: 你要不要来点儿喝的？

sentence.English: Would you do me a favor?
sentence.Chinese: 你能帮我一个忙吗？

sentence.English: You are just saying that
sentence.Chinese: 你只是说说而已。

sentence.English: You are kidding
sentence.Chinese: 你开玩笑吧。

sentence.English: You are so considerate
sentence.Chinese: 你真有心。

sentence.English: You can count on me
sentence.Chinese: 你可以指望我。

sentence.English: You can say that again
sentence.Chinese: 我同意。

sentence.English: You can't complain
sentence.Chinese: 你该知足了。

sentence.English: You deserve it
sentence.Chinese: 这是你应得的。

sentence.English: You did a good job
sentence.Chinese: 你干得很好。

sentence.English: You get what you pay for
sentence.Chinese: 一分钱一分货。

sentence.English: You got a good deal
sentence.Chinese: 你买得真便宜。

sentence.English: You need a vacation
sentence.Chinese: 你需要休息。

sentence.English: You never know
sentence.Chinese: 世事难料。

sentence.English: You said it
sentence.Chinese: 你算说对了。

sentence.English: You should give it a try
sentence.Chinese: 你应该试一试。

sentence.English: You should take advantage of it
sentence.Chinese: 你应该好好利用这个机会。

sentence.English: You will be better off
sentence.Chinese: 你的状况会好起来的。

sentence.English: You will have to wait and see
sentence.Chinese: 你得等一等看。

sentence.English: You'll get used to it
sentence.Chinese: 你会习惯的。

sentence.English: You've dialed the wrong number
sentence.Chinese: 你拨错电话号码了。

sentence.English: You've got a point there
sentence.Chinese: 你说的有道理。

sentence.English: You've got it
sentence.Chinese: 你明白了。

sentence.English: You've made a good choice
sentence.Chinese: 你的眼力不错。

sentence.English: ”A small glass of whisky,please.”
sentence.Chinese: 请来一小杯威士忌。

sentence.English: ”After I get home,I'll call you.”
sentence.Chinese: 到家以后，我会给你打电话。

sentence.English: ”After I had finished my paper,I put it in the drawer.”
sentence.Chinese: 我写完论文，就把它放在抽屉了。

sentence.English: ”Along the northern coast of this continent,there are many crags.”
sentence.Chinese: 沿该大陆的北海岸线上有许多峭壁。

sentence.English: ”And it may get colder,it's already November.”
sentence.Chinese: 并且天气会更冷。

sentence.English: ”As a senior,Peter is writing his thesis.”
sentence.Chinese: 作为大学四年级学生，彼得正在写毕业论文。

sentence.English: ”As soon as he comes,we'll let him know.”
sentence.Chinese: 他一来，我们就告诉他。

sentence.English: ”Come in,please.”
sentence.Chinese: 请进。

sentence.English: ”Even if you had given him much more money,he might not have paid off the debt.”
sentence.Chinese: 就算你给了他更多的钱，他也还不清债务。

sentence.English: ”Even if you take the exam again,you won't pass it.”
sentence.Chinese: 就算再考一次你也通不过。

sentence.English: ”Excuse me,how can I get to the bus station?”
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，汽车站怎么走？

sentence.English: ”Excuse me,madam.Could you tell me where the post office is?”
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，女士，请问邮局在哪里？

sentence.English: ”Excuse me,would you give me a hand?”
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，你能帮我个忙吗？

sentence.English: ”Excuse me,would you tell me where I can get some butter?”
sentence.Chinese: 打扰一下，您能告诉我黄油在哪儿卖吗？

sentence.English: ”Finally,we came to an agreement.”
sentence.Chinese: 最后我们达成了一致。

sentence.English: ”Fine,thanks.And you?”
sentence.Chinese: 很好，谢谢，你呢？

sentence.English: ”Get me my coat,please.”
sentence.Chinese: 请帮我拿下外套。

sentence.English: ”Give me a definite answer,please.”
sentence.Chinese: 请给个明确的答复。

sentence.English: ”Good night,Jane.”
sentence.Chinese: 晚安，简。

sentence.English: ”Good try,but not quite right.”
sentence.Chinese: 是个很好的尝试，但并不完全正确。

sentence.English: ”Good-bye,Mike.”
sentence.Chinese: 再见，迈克。

sentence.English: ”Had I taken a taxi,I wouldn't have been late.”
sentence.Chinese: 如果我打的去的话就不会迟到了。

sentence.English: ”He has that book,doesn't he?”
sentence.Chinese: 他有那本书，是吗？

sentence.English: ”Hi,Ann.Nice to see you again.”
sentence.Chinese: 安，你好。真高兴再次见到你。

sentence.English: He has a strong accent.
sentence.Chinese: 他口音很重。

sentence.English: He has bought 10 tractors for the village.
sentence.Chinese: 他为村里买了10台拖拉机。

sentence.English: He hasn't answered my letter yet.
sentence.Chinese: 他还没有给我回信。

sentence.English: He is a doctor.He has his own practice.
sentence.Chinese: 他是个医生，他自己开业。

sentence.English: He is a manager of a famous corporation.
sentence.Chinese: 他是一家著名公司的经理。

sentence.English: He is a very creative student.
sentence.Chinese: 他是个很有创造力的学生。

sentence.English: He looks much younger than he is.
sentence.Chinese: 他看起来比他实际上年轻得多。

sentence.English: He made a successful career in business.
sentence.Chinese: 他的商务生涯十分成功。

sentence.English: He majored in Computers.
sentence.Chinese: 他主修计算机。

sentence.English: He phoned to cancel the meeting.
sentence.Chinese: 他打电话来取消会议。

sentence.English: He plays violin just for enjoyment.
sentence.Chinese: 他拉小提琴只是为了自娱自乐。

sentence.English: He speaks English fluently.
sentence.Chinese: 他讲英语很流利。

sentence.English: He speaks with London accent.
sentence.Chinese: 他带点伦敦口音。

sentence.English: He used to live in my neighborhood.
sentence.Chinese: 他曾与我是邻居。

sentence.English: He was absent yesterday.Do you know why?
sentence.Chinese: 昨天他没到，你知道为什么吗？

sentence.English: He was appointed president of the committee recently.
sentence.Chinese: 他最近被任命为那个革命会的总裁。

sentence.English: He will become a writer if he goes on doing well in writing.
sentence.Chinese: 如果他仍写的这么好的话，他将成为一个作家。

sentence.English: He will probably follow in his father's footsteps.
sentence.Chinese: 他可能会继承父业。

sentence.English: He's Bob.
sentence.Chinese: 他是鲍勃。

sentence.English: He's a manager.
sentence.Chinese: 他是个经理。

sentence.English: He's a very efficient young man though a little proud.
sentence.Chinese: 他是个很有能力的人，但是有点骄傲。

sentence.English: He's crazy about Michael Jordan.
sentence.Chinese: 他疯狂喜爱迈克·乔丹。

sentence.English: He's good at lifting weights.
sentence.Chinese: 他善于举重。

sentence.English: He's got a bad headache.
sentence.Chinese: 他头痛的厉害。

sentence.English: He's made up his mind to quit his job.
sentence.Chinese: 他已决定辞去他的工作。

sentence.English: He's not in.May I take a message for him?
sentence.Chinese: 他不在，我能替他捎个口信吗？

sentence.English: He's on the phone.
sentence.Chinese: 他在打电话。

sentence.English: He's still a boy after all.
sentence.Chinese: 他毕竟还只是个孩子。

sentence.English: He's the youngest in the family.
sentence.Chinese: 他是一家中最小的。

sentence.English: Hello!/ Hi!
sentence.Chinese: 你好!

sentence.English: Hello.Can I see Mr.Green?
sentence.Chinese: 你好，我能见格林先生吗？

sentence.English: Hello.May I speak to Mr.Green?
sentence.Chinese: 你好，我找格林先生。

sentence.English: Here is your change.
sentence.Chinese: 找您的钱。

sentence.English: Here is your food.
sentence.Chinese: 你的菜来了。

sentence.English: Here you are.
sentence.Chinese: 给。

sentence.English: Here!
sentence.Chinese: 到！

sentence.English: Here's your change.
sentence.Chinese: 这是找你的钱。

sentence.English: His flattery makes me sick.
sentence.Chinese: 他的恭维让我恶心。

sentence.English: His wife died a year ago.Now he lives alone.
sentence.Chinese: 他妻子去年去世了。现在他一个人住。

sentence.English: Hold on.
sentence.Chinese: 等一会儿。

sentence.English: How about Mary?How long has she lived there?
sentence.Chinese: 玛丽怎么样？她在那儿住多久了？

sentence.English: ”Hi,Jack,what lessons will you take this semester?”
sentence.Chinese: 你好，杰克，这学期你选什么课？

sentence.English: ”Hi,Jack,where do you live now?”
sentence.Chinese: 你好，杰克，你现在住哪儿？

sentence.English: ”Hi,Joe,is it really you?”
sentence.Chinese: 乔，你好，真是你吗？

sentence.English: ”Hi,Lucy.I'll take French and Economics.”
sentence.Chinese: 你好，露西，我想选法语和经济。

sentence.English: ”I had thought about arguing with the teacher about that,but I didn't have enough courage.”
sentence.Chinese: 我本想和老师争论那个问题，但我没有足够的勇气。

sentence.English: ”I have a dog,but it's very quiet.”
sentence.Chinese: 我有一只狗，不过它很安静。

sentence.English: ”I have never heard the piece before,who wrote it?”
sentence.Chinese: 我从没听过这首曲子，谁写的？

sentence.English: ”I heard the clock,but I didn't get up until 9.”
sentence.Chinese: 我听见闹钟了，但我捱到九点才起。

sentence.English: ”I like writing,but I wouldn't take it as my career.”
sentence.Chinese: 我喜欢协作但不愿以此为职业。

sentence.English: ”I shave,brush my teeth,and comb my hair.”
sentence.Chinese: 我洗脸，刷牙，梳头。

sentence.English: ”I tried to call you,but the line was busy.”
sentence.Chinese: 我试着给你打电话，但老占线。

sentence.English: ”I was born on September 1st,1976.”
sentence.Chinese: 我出生在1976年9月1日。

sentence.English: ”I'm always confused with ””s”” and ””th””.”
sentence.Chinese: 我常把s和th搞混。

sentence.English: ”I'm always making resolutions,like giving up smoking.”
sentence.Chinese: 我总在做出决定，比如戒烟。

sentence.English: ”I'm fine,too.”
sentence.Chinese: 我也很好。

sentence.English: ”I'm glad to,but I'm afraid I don't have the time.”
sentence.Chinese: 我很乐意，但我恐怕没时间。

sentence.English: ”If I had got enough money yesterday,I would have bought that tape.”
sentence.Chinese: 如果我昨天钱够的话，我就买了那盒磁带了。

sentence.English: ”If it doesn't rain tomorrow,we'll have a picnic.”
sentence.Chinese: 如果明天不下雨，我们就去野餐。

sentence.English: ”If it had been fine,we would have gone to the park.”
sentence.Chinese: 如果天气好的话，我们就去公园了。

sentence.English: ”If you have more,please give me some.”
sentence.Chinese: 如果你有多的，请给我。

sentence.English: ”If you install an outside antenna,you will have better reception.”
sentence.Chinese: 如果你安装了室外天线，你的电视接受效果会好点。

sentence.English: ”In Brazil,many ancient forests are very well preserves.”
sentence.Chinese: 在巴西，古老的森林得到了很好的保护。

sentence.English: ”In Britain,there are open universities.”
sentence.Chinese: 在英国，有成人大学。

sentence.English: ”In my opinion,your new coat is not worth so much money.”
sentence.Chinese: 我认为你的外套不值得这么多钱。

sentence.English: ”In the flat country,people grow wheat and raise cattle.”
sentence.Chinese: 在这平坦的乡间，人们种指小麦，饲养牲畜。

sentence.English: ”In the west of America,there are many high peeks and deep canyons.”
sentence.Chinese: 在美国西部有许多高峰和深谷。

sentence.English: ”In this country,the weather is usually very awful.”
sentence.Chinese: 在这个国家，天气通常十分恶劣。

sentence.English: ”It might be,I suppose.”
sentence.Chinese: 我想可能是这样。

sentence.English: ”It opens at 8 am on weekdays,but at 9 at weekends.”
sentence.Chinese: 平日上午8点开，但周末9点开。

sentence.English: ”It's January the 15th,1999.”
sentence.Chinese: 今天是1999年1月15日。

sentence.English: ”It's only a suggestion,you don't have to take it.”
sentence.Chinese: 这只是一个建议，你可以不听。

sentence.English: ”Looking back on it,I think I shouldn't have given up the contest so easily.”
sentence.Chinese: 回过头来看，我想我不应该如此轻易的放弃那次比赛。

sentence.English: ”Make me a cup of coffee,will you?”
sentence.Chinese: 给我冲杯咖啡，好吗？

sentence.English: ”Mr.Green,Mr.Smith is here.”
sentence.Chinese: 格林先生，史密斯先生在这里。

sentence.English: ”My country has an area of 500,000 square kilometers.”
sentence.Chinese: 我国面积五十万平里。

sentence.English: ”My mother has sent me a registered letter,I guess she has something important to tell me.”
sentence.Chinese: 我妈给我发了一封挂号信，我想她有什么重要的事情要说。

sentence.English: ”Nice to meet you,too.”
sentence.Chinese: 认识你我也很高兴。

sentence.English: ”Nice to see you,my old friend.”
sentence.Chinese: 真高兴见到你，我的老朋友。

sentence.English: ”No,I don't think so.”
sentence.Chinese: 不，我想不会。

sentence.English: ”No,I have no contact with her.”
sentence.Chinese: 没有。我和她没有一点儿联系。

sentence.English: ”No,I haven't decided yet.”
sentence.Chinese: 不，还没有。

sentence.English: ”No,I only wrote her one letter this year.”
sentence.Chinese: 是的，今年我才给她写过一封信。

sentence.English: ”No,I'll move to Hollywood next month.”
sentence.Chinese: 不，我下个月搬到好莱坞去。

sentence.English: ”No,I'm a single son.”
sentence.Chinese: 没有，我是独生子。

sentence.English: ”No,I'm listening to the radio.”
sentence.Chinese: 没有，我在听收音机。

sentence.English: ”No,he doesn't.”
sentence.Chinese: 不，他没有。

sentence.English: ”No,it isn't./ Yes,it is.”
sentence.Chinese: 不，它不是。/是的，它是。

sentence.English: ”No,it isn't.It's a bus.”
sentence.Chinese: 不，那是一辆公共汽车。

sentence.English: ”No,she isn't.”
sentence.Chinese: 不，她不是。

sentence.English: ”No,what does it say?”
sentence.Chinese: 没有，它说什么了？

sentence.English: ”Oh,I'm sorry to hear that.”
sentence.Chinese: 听到这消息我很遗憾。

sentence.English: ”Oh,how nice.Sorry,I've got to go now.”
sentence.Chinese: 那真好。对不起，我必须得走了。

sentence.English: ”Oh,really?I'm moving there too.”
sentence.Chinese: 真的？我也会搬到那儿去。

sentence.English: ”Oh,thank you.How have you been these days?”
sentence.Chinese: 欧，谢谢。这段时间你好吗？

sentence.English: ”Oh,that's not good.”
sentence.Chinese: 哦，那可不好。

sentence.English: ”People are always changing,aren't they?”
sentence.Chinese: 人总是在变，不是吗？

sentence.English: ”Rose,let me introduce my friend to you.”
sentence.Chinese: 罗斯，让我介绍一下我的朋友。

sentence.English: ”She is very well,thank you.”
sentence.Chinese: 她很好，谢谢。

sentence.English: ”She must be a model,isn't?”
sentence.Chinese: 她一定是个模特，不是吗？

sentence.English: ”Sit down,please.”
sentence.Chinese: 请坐。

sentence.English: ”Sorry,I don't.”
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，我没有。

sentence.English: ”Sorry,I'm engaged.”
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，我有约在先了。

sentence.English: ”Sorry,Mr.Green can't see you now.”
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，格林先生现在不能见您。

sentence.English: ”Sorry,can I see her before Friday?”
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，我能周五之前见她吗？

sentence.English: ”Sorry,it's broken.You have to use the stairs.”
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，它坏了，你只能走楼梯了。

sentence.English: ”Sorry,we only take cash.”
sentence.Chinese: 对不起，我们只收现金。

sentence.English: ”Tea,please.”
sentence.Chinese: 我喝点茶吧。

sentence.English: ”The TV programs were really boring,so I went to bed very early.”
sentence.Chinese: 电视节目很无聊，所以我早早睡了。

sentence.English: ”There's no gas range in the kitchen,but you can use the electric stove.”
sentence.Chinese: 厨房里没有煤气灶，但你可以用电炉。

sentence.English: ”To make it fast,you can send a fax.”
sentence.Chinese: 要想快点的话就发个传真。

sentence.English: ”Well,it depends.”
sentence.Chinese: 这得视情况而定。

sentence.English: ”What do you like best,apples,pears,or bananas?”
sentence.Chinese: 苹果，梨，香蕉，你最喜欢哪个？

sentence.English: ”When I arrived at the station,the train had already left.”
sentence.Chinese: 我到车站时，火车已经开了。

sentence.English: ”When she leaves,he'll cry for a day.”
sentence.Chinese: 她走时，他会哭一天。

sentence.English: ”Which do you like better,the news or the editorial?”
sentence.Chinese: 新闻和评论你最喜欢看哪个？

sentence.English: ”Which do you prefer,fishing or mountain-climbing?”
sentence.Chinese: 钓鱼和登山，你更喜欢哪一个？

sentence.English: ”Would you open the door for me,please?”
sentence.Chinese: 你能替我开门吗？

sentence.English: ”Yes,I am./ No,I'm not.”
sentence.Chinese: 是，我是。/ 不，我不是。

sentence.English: ”Yes,I do.”
sentence.Chinese: 是的，我有。

sentence.English: ”Yes,I have your eraser,too.”
sentence.Chinese: 是的，我还拿了你的橡皮。

sentence.English: ”Yes,I like it a great deal/it very much.”
sentence.Chinese: 是的，我很喜欢。

sentence.English: ”Yes,I lost my pet cat yesterday.”
sentence.Chinese: 是啊，昨天我的宠物猫丢了。

sentence.English: ”Yes,I think so.”
sentence.Chinese: 是的，我认为是。

sentence.English: ”Yes,I'm applying to work at the library.”
sentence.Chinese: 是的，我在申请图书馆管理员的工作。

sentence.English: ”Yes,I'm watching Channel 5.”
sentence.Chinese: 是的，我在看5频道。

sentence.English: ”Yes,I've just come back from Scotland.”
sentence.Chinese: 是的，我刚从苏格兰回来。

sentence.English: ”Yes,a lot of friends.”
sentence.Chinese: 是的，很多。

sentence.English: ”Yes,and I hope we can have some snow this winter.”

sentence.English: ”Yes,we should try to contact more.”

sentence.English: ”Yes,you're right.After all,she is smart enough to go into business.”

At about seven.

sentence.English: I feel at home living here.The landlady is very kind to me.

sentence.English: I find classical concerts more to my liking than rock concerts.

sentence.English: I find my name on the blackboard.I must have got a remittance.

sentence.English: I generally agree with you.

sentence.English: I hope that will not cause you too much trouble.

sentence.English: I hope the weather there is cold enough.

sentence.English: I hope you'll be well soon.

sentence.English: I must have dialed a wrong number.

sentence.Chinese: 通常我通过阅读小说使我的注意力从工作上转移过来。

sentence.English: I particularly like English literature.

sentence.English: I plan to learn photography.

sentence.English: I prefer tea to coffee.

sentence.English: I really appreciate your help.

sentence.English: I really don't known.

sentence.English: I recommend to you Time and Newsweek. They are excellent.
sentence.Chinese: 我向你推荐《时代》和《新闻周刊》，它们很棒。

sentence.English: I slept soundly all night.
sentence.Chinese: 我整夜睡的很熟。

sentence.English: I started school at the age of 6.

sentence.English: I subscribed to a lot of periodicals last year.

sentence.English: I suppose I can finish the project next year.

sentence.English: I suppose he was sick.

sentence.English: I then take a bath in the bathroom.
sentence.Chinese: 然后我去洗澡间洗个澡。

sentence.English: I think you're mistaken about that.
sentence.Chinese: 我想你那样不对。

sentence.English: I used to take a walk in the early morning.
sentence.Chinese: 我过去常一大早出去散步。

sentence.English: I usually get up at 8 o'clock.

sentence.English: I wake my sister up.

sentence.English: I want an apartment with two bedrooms and a kitchen.
sentence.Chinese: 我想要一套有两间卧室和一个厨房的公寓。

sentence.English: I want to be a journalist after graduation.
sentence.Chinese: 毕业后我想当记者。

sentence.English: I want to be a pilot of possible.

sentence.English: I want to hear your opinion.

sentence.English: I want to make a long distance call.

sentence.English: I want to rent a furnished house.
sentence.Chinese: 我想要有家具的房子。

sentence.English: I want to see the weather.
sentence.Chinese: 我想看天气预报。

sentence.English: I was 10 minutes late.
sentence.Chinese: 我迟到了五分钟。

sentence.English: I was about to leave.
sentence.Chinese: 我正要出门。

sentence.English: I was born in China and brought up in the U.S.A.
sentence.Chinese: 我出生在中国，在美国长大。

sentence.English: I was just on time.
sentence.Chinese: 我刚好赶上。

sentence.English: I was on the track team 10 years ago.
sentence.Chinese: 十年前，我在田径队。

sentence.English: I went there on business.

sentence.English: I will see you off at the railway station.
sentence.Chinese: 我会去机场送你。

sentence.English: I wish I had told him the truth.
sentence.Chinese: 我真希望我把真相告诉了他。

sentence.English: I wish you hadn't cheated me.
sentence.Chinese: 我希望你没有欺骗我。

sentence.English: I woke up seven and got up right away.
sentence.Chinese: 我七点醒了，然后马上起床了。

sentence.English: I worked as an intern in that firm last summer.
sentence.Chinese: 去年夏天我在那家商行实习。

sentence.English: I would have had a much better holiday if I had stayed at home.

sentence.English: I'll be back in 5 days.
sentence.Chinese: 我五天之后回来。

sentence.English: I'll be waiting for you at the restaurant this time tomorrow.
sentence.Chinese: 我明天这时候在餐馆等你。

sentence.Chinese: 课前我要点名。

sentence.English: I'll further my study.

sentence.English: I'll go on an outing with some friends.

sentence.English: I'll go skiing of the weather permits.
sentence.Chinese: 天气允许的话，我会去滑雪。

sentence.Chinese: 我要去听音乐会。

sentence.English: I'll go to pick up some odds and ends at the store.
sentence.Chinese: 我要到商店买些零碎的东西。

sentence.English: I'll have some ice cream.
sentence.Chinese: 我要冰淇淋。

sentence.English: I'll leave for London if I finish my work today.
sentence.Chinese: 如果我今天完成工作，我就会去伦敦。

sentence.Chinese: 我们明天见面。

sentence.English: I'll probably stay home and watch TV.
sentence.Chinese: 我可能会呆在家看电视。

sentence.English: I'll take it.

sentence.English: I'll wear my blue dress.

sentence.Chinese: 今天是五月二十一号。

sentence.English: Today is Monday.
sentence.Chinese: 今天星期一。

sentence.English: Tom has opened his own business while his classmates are still slogging away at school.
sentence.Chinese: 当汤姆的同学还在学校苦读时，他已经开始了自己的事业。

sentence.English: Tom reads newspapers in the afternoon.
sentence.Chinese: 汤姆下午读报。

sentence.English: Traveler's check's are very convenient for long-distance travel.
sentence.Chinese: 旅行支票对于长途旅行很方便。

sentence.English: Turn down the radio please.
sentence.Chinese: 请放低音量。

sentence.English: Turn up your radio please.
sentence.Chinese: 请你把收音机开响一点儿。

sentence.English: We are sure to defeat them.
sentence.Chinese: 我们一定会打败他们。

sentence.English: We can't get good pictures on our TV set.
sentence.Chinese: 我们的电视机图象有问题。

sentence.English: We enjoyed ourselves very much.
sentence.Chinese: 我们玩的很开心。

sentence.English: We go to bed at 10:30.
sentence.Chinese: 我们十点半睡觉。

sentence.English: We had a good time.
sentence.Chinese: 我们玩的很开心。

sentence.English: We have 50 provinces.
sentence.Chinese: 我们有50个省。

sentence.English: We have a few kitchen things and a dining room set.
sentence.Chinese: 我们有一些厨房用具和一套餐厅设备。

sentence.English: We have known each other for 6 years.
sentence.Chinese: 我们认识有六年了。

sentence.English: We keep in touch with each other by Email since he left China.
sentence.Chinese: 他离开中国以后，我们用Email保持联系。

sentence.English: We must arrive there on time.
sentence.Chinese: 我们必须准时到那儿。

sentence.English: We'll have a soap opera series on TV this week.
sentence.Chinese: 这周我们将在电视上看一个肥皂剧。

sentence.English: We'll have fine weather for the next few days?
sentence.Chinese: 以后几天天气晴朗。

sentence.English: We're broadcasting from London.
sentence.Chinese: 我们从伦敦播放。

sentence.English: We've been married for 2 years.
sentence.Chinese: 我们结婚两年了。

sentence.English: What a beautiful garden you have!
sentence.Chinese: 你的花园真漂亮。

sentence.English: What a boring movie it is!
sentence.Chinese: 多么无聊的一场电影啊。

sentence.English: What about another dance?
sentence.Chinese: 再跳一曲好吗？

sentence.English: What about your opinion?
sentence.Chinese: 你怎么想？

sentence.English: What are you doing next week?
sentence.Chinese: 下周你干什么？

sentence.English: What are you doing?
sentence.Chinese: 你在干什么？

sentence.English: What are you going to do with the books?
sentence.Chinese: 你打算拿这些书怎么办？

sentence.English: What are you interested in?
sentence.Chinese: 你对什么比较感兴趣？

sentence.English: What are your interests?
sentence.Chinese: 你的爱好是什么？

sentence.English: What channel are you watching now?
sentence.Chinese: 现在你在看哪个新闻？

sentence.English: What column do you like best?
sentence.Chinese: 你最喜欢哪个栏目？

sentence.English: What day is it today?
sentence.Chinese: 今天星期几？

sentence.English: What day is today?
sentence.Chinese: 今天星期几？

sentence.English: What did he say in the letter?
sentence.Chinese: 他在信里说什么了？

sentence.English: What did the doctor say?
sentence.Chinese: 医生怎么说？

sentence.English: What did you do the week before last?
sentence.Chinese: 上上星期你干了什么？

sentence.English: What did you have for lunch?
sentence.Chinese: 你中午吃些什么？

sentence.English: What do think about this poem?
sentence.Chinese: 你觉得这首诗怎么样？

sentence.English: What do you call this in English?
sentence.Chinese: 这个用英语怎么说？

sentence.English: What do you dislike most about this movie?
sentence.Chinese: 这部电影你最不喜欢什么？

sentence.English: What do you do at work?
sentence.Chinese: 你上班干些什么？

sentence.English: What do you do in your spare time?
sentence.Chinese: 闲暇时，你干些什么？

sentence.English: What do you do? I'm a farmer.
sentence.Chinese: 你是做什么的？我是个农民。

sentence.English: What do you like to do in your spare time?
sentence.Chinese: 空闲时你喜欢干什么？

sentence.English: What do you plan to do this Friday?
sentence.Chinese: 明天你打算干什么？

sentence.English: What do you say we have a party this weekend?
sentence.Chinese: 我们周末开个派对，你觉得怎么样？

sentence.English: What do you think about it?
sentence.Chinese: 你对此怎么看？

sentence.English: What do you think of their skill?
sentence.Chinese: 你觉得他们演奏技术如何？

sentence.English: What do you want to do after graduation?
sentence.Chinese: 你毕业后想干什么？

sentence.English: What does he do?
sentence.Chinese: 他是干什么的？

sentence.English: What does your father do?
sentence.Chinese: 你父亲做什么工作？

sentence.English: What have you been doing since I saw you last time?
sentence.Chinese: 自从我上次见到你以后你都在干什么？

sentence.English: What is she doing now?
sentence.Chinese: 她现在干些什么呢？

sentence.English: What is the color of your new book?
sentence.Chinese: 你的新书是什么颜色的？

sentence.English: What kind of climate do you have in this country?
sentence.Chinese: 这个国家的气候如何？

sentence.English: What kind of furniture do you like?
sentence.Chinese: 你喜欢什么样的家具？

sentence.English: What kind of newspapers do you read?
sentence.Chinese: 你读什么样的报纸？

sentence.English: What month is this?
sentence.Chinese: 现在是几月？

sentence.English: What position do you play?
sentence.Chinese: 你踢什么位置？

sentence.English: What sort of medicine do you take?
sentence.Chinese: 你吃的是什么药？

sentence.English: What time are you going to leave for the airport tomorrow?
sentence.Chinese: 你明天打算什么时候去机场？

sentence.English: What time do you finish your work?
sentence.Chinese: 你什么时候下班？

sentence.English: What time do you start work?
sentence.Chinese: 你什么时候开始工作？

sentence.English: What time is it now?
sentence.Chinese: 现在几点？

sentence.English: What time?
sentence.Chinese: 什么时候？

sentence.English: What were you doing this time last year?
sentence.Chinese: 去年这时候你在干什么？

sentence.English: What were you doing when I called?
sentence.Chinese: 我打电话给你时你在干吗？

sentence.English: What will it be after the clear weather?
sentence.Chinese: 晴天以后天气会怎么样？

sentence.English: What will you do about it?
sentence.Chinese: 你会拿这事怎么办？

sentence.English: What will you do during this weekend?
sentence.Chinese: 这周末你干什么？

sentence.English: What will you do the day after on next?
sentence.Chinese: 后天你干什么？

sentence.English: What will you do this weekend?
sentence.Chinese: 这周末你将干什么？

sentence.English: What will you wear for the party?
sentence.Chinese: 晚会上你穿什么？

sentence.English: What would you have done if you hadn't gone out for a picnic yesterday?
sentence.Chinese: 如果你昨天没有出去野餐的话。你会干什么？

sentence.English: What would you like for dessert?
sentence.Chinese: 你要什么甜点？

sentence.English: What would you like to eat?
sentence.Chinese: 你想吃点什么？

sentence.English: What year is this?
sentence.Chinese: 今年是哪一年？

sentence.English: What you have said about this is very interesting.
sentence.Chinese: 你说的很有意思。

sentence.English: What's on Channel 8 now?
sentence.Chinese: 现在8频道播什么节目？

sentence.English: What's so interesting about football?We girls don't like it.
sentence.Chinese: 足球有什么意思？我们女生不喜欢它。

sentence.English: What's the average yearly output of cars in your factory?
sentence.Chinese: 你们厂平均年产汽车多少台？

sentence.English: What's the capital of your country?
sentence.Chinese: 贵国首都是哪儿？

sentence.English: What's the circulation of this magazine?
sentence.Chinese: 这杂志发行量怎么样？

sentence.English: What's the color of your new dress?
sentence.Chinese: 你的新衣服是什么颜色的？

sentence.English: What's the date today?
sentence.Chinese: 今天是几号？

sentence.English: What's the height of the building?
sentence.Chinese: 这座楼有多高？

sentence.English: What's the matter with you?
sentence.Chinese: 你怎么啦？

sentence.English: What's the name of the cat?
sentence.Chinese: 这猫叫什么名字？

sentence.English: What's the population of China?
sentence.Chinese: 中国有多少人口？

sentence.English: What's the shape of your balloon?
sentence.Chinese: 你的气球是什么形状？

sentence.English: What's the size of your shoes?
sentence.Chinese: 你的鞋多大尺寸？

sentence.English: What's the time by your watch?
sentence.Chinese: 你的表几点了？

sentence.English: What's the typical farm product in this region?
sentence.Chinese: 这个地区典型的农产品是什么？

sentence.English: What's this?
sentence.Chinese: 这是什么？

sentence.English: What's your family name?
sentence.Chinese: 你姓什么？

sentence.English: What's your favorite music?
sentence.Chinese: 你最喜欢什么音乐？

sentence.English: What's your favorite sport?
sentence.Chinese: 你最喜欢什么运动？

sentence.English: What's your motherland?
sentence.Chinese: 你祖国是哪儿？

sentence.English: What's your name?
sentence.Chinese: 你叫什么名字？

sentence.English: What's your nationality?
sentence.Chinese: 你是什么国籍？

sentence.English: What's your plan for the summer holiday?
sentence.Chinese: 暑假计划干什么？

sentence.English: What's your size?
sentence.Chinese: 你穿多大号？

sentence.English: What's your trouble?
sentence.Chinese: 你有什么不舒服？

sentence.English: When did you buy the car?
sentence.Chinese: 你什么时候买的车？

sentence.English: When did you get up yesterday morning?
sentence.Chinese: 你昨天早上几点起床？

sentence.English: When do you get up everyday?
sentence.Chinese: 每天你几点起床？

sentence.English: When were you born?
sentence.Chinese: 你什么时候出生的？

sentence.English: When will he come to see you?
sentence.Chinese: 他什么时候来看你？

sentence.English: Where are my glasses?
sentence.Chinese: 我的眼镜在哪儿？

sentence.English: Where are the stairs?
sentence.Chinese: 楼梯在哪里呢？

sentence.English: Where are you from?
sentence.Chinese: 你来自哪儿？

sentence.English: Where are you going?
sentence.Chinese: 你去哪儿？

sentence.English: Where did you go for dinner yesterday?
sentence.Chinese: 你们昨天去哪儿吃的饭？

sentence.English: Where did you visit?
sentence.Chinese: 你去参观了哪些地方？

sentence.English: Where do you have your lunch?
sentence.Chinese: 你在哪儿吃午饭？

sentence.English: Where's the company?
sentence.Chinese: 那个公司在哪儿？

sentence.English: Which is the right size?
sentence.Chinese: 哪个尺码是对的？

sentence.English: Which is your bag?
sentence.Chinese: 哪个是你的包？

sentence.English: Which one is Mr.Jame's office?
sentence.Chinese: 哪间是詹姆司先生的办公室？

sentence.English: Which one is the longest river in China?
sentence.Chinese: 中国哪条河流最长？

sentence.English: Who are you writing to?
sentence.Chinese: 你在给谁写信？

sentence.English: Who are you?
sentence.Chinese: 你是谁？

sentence.English: Who is the guy over there?
sentence.Chinese: 那边那个人是谁？

sentence.English: Who is the lady in white?
sentence.Chinese: 穿白衣服的那位小姐是谁？

sentence.English: Who told you?
sentence.Chinese: 谁告诉你的？

sentence.English: Who will accompany you to the airport?
sentence.Chinese: 谁将陪你去机场？

sentence.English: Whose pen is this?
sentence.Chinese: 这是谁的笔？

sentence.English: Why did you go there?
sentence.Chinese: 你为什么去那儿？

sentence.English: Why don't you agree?
sentence.Chinese: 你为什么不同意？

sentence.English: Why don't you put an advertisement in the paper to sell that old car?
sentence.Chinese: 为什么不在报上登广告卖旧车呢？

sentence.English: Why not go out for a walk?
sentence.Chinese: 干吗不出去散步？

sentence.English: Why?What will you wear?
sentence.Chinese: 为什么？你会穿什么？

sentence.English: Will it rain tomorrow?
sentence.Chinese: 明天会下雨吗？

sentence.English: Will you go shopping with me?
sentence.Chinese: 你跟我去买东西吗？

sentence.English: Will you stay there for long?
sentence.Chinese: 你会在那儿待很长时间吗？

sentence.English: Witch pleasure.
sentence.Chinese: 很高兴。

sentence.English: With pleasure.
sentence.Chinese: 很荣幸。

sentence.English: Would he have seen you if you hadn't waved to him?
sentence.Chinese: 如果你没有朝他挥手，他能看见你吗？

sentence.English: Would you answer the phone please?
sentence.Chinese: 你能接下电话吗？

sentence.English: Would you be so kind as to lend me some money?
sentence.Chinese: 你能借我一点儿钱吗？

sentence.English: Would you call back tomorrow?
sentence.Chinese: 你能明天回个电话吗？

sentence.English: Would you help me remove the refrigerator?
sentence.Chinese: 能帮忙移一下冰箱吗？

sentence.English: Would you like something to drink?
sentence.Chinese: 您想喝点什么吗？

sentence.English: Would you mind closing the window for me?
sentence.Chinese: 能帮我关一下窗户吗？（你介意关下窗户吗？）

sentence.English: Would you mind mailing this letter for me?
sentence.Chinese: 你能替我寄这封信吗？

sentence.English: Would you mind not spitting everywhere?
sentence.Chinese: 不要随地吐痰行吗？

sentence.English: Would you mind opening the window?
sentence.Chinese: 你介意开窗吗？

sentence.English: Would you please open the door for me?
sentence.Chinese: 请你帮忙开个门好吗？

sentence.English: Would you tell Mr.Green that I called?
sentence.Chinese: 你能告诉格林先生我给他打了个电话吗？

sentence.English: Would you wait here for a minute?
sentence.Chinese: 您能在这里等一下吗？

sentence.English: Yes,a little.
sentence.Chinese: 会讲一点。

sentence.English: Yes.At 3 pm.
sentence.Chinese: 是的，约的是下午3点。

sentence.English: You are probably right.
sentence.Chinese: 你也许是对的。

sentence.English: You can reach me at 6609823.
sentence.Chinese: 你打电话6609823就能找到我。

sentence.English: You can receive our program at short wave 37.5 MH.
sentence.Chinese: 你可在短波37.5赫兹上收到我们的节目。

sentence.English: You can stay as long as you pay the rent on time.
sentence.Chinese: 只要你按时交房租，你就能住这儿。

sentence.English: You can take the bus and get off at the second stop.
sentence.Chinese: 你可以坐公共汽车第二站下。

sentence.English: You can't miss it.
sentence.Chinese: 你不可能找不到.

sentence.English: You don't have to pay any duty on personal belongings.
sentence.Chinese: 个人物品不需要关税。

sentence.English: You forgot to fasten the collar buttons.
sentence.Chinese: 你忘了系鞋带。

sentence.English: You have the final say.
sentence.Chinese: 你说了算。

sentence.English: You have to apply for a passport in advance.
sentence.Chinese: 你必须提前申请护照。

sentence.English: You have to be operated on.
sentence.Chinese: 你得做手术。

sentence.English: You look elegant in that dress.
sentence.Chinese: 你穿这条裙子显的很漂亮。

sentence.English: You look radiant tonight.
sentence.Chinese: 你今晚真是光彩照人。

sentence.English: You may go in now.
sentence.Chinese: 您可以进去了。

sentence.English: You must have enjoyed yourself.
sentence.Chinese: 你一定玩的很开心。

sentence.English: You name the time.
sentence.Chinese: 你定时间吧。

sentence.English: You need an injection.
sentence.Chinese: 你需要打针。

sentence.English: You should have studied much harder.
sentence.Chinese: 你本应该更努力的学习。

sentence.English: You should have your suit cleaned and ironed.
sentence.Chinese: 你应该把你的套装拿去洗烫一下。

sentence.English: You should take the advice of your teacher.
sentence.Chinese: 你应该听老师的话？

sentence.English: You speak English pretty well.
sentence.Chinese: 你的英语讲的很好。

sentence.English: You two don't have much contact？
sentence.Chinese: 你们俩没怎么联系吗？

sentence.English: You'd better put on your jacket.It's cold outside.
sentence.Chinese: 你最好穿上夹克，外面冷。

sentence.English: You'll be on air in two minutes.
sentence.Chinese: 两分钟以后你会上电视。

sentence.English: You're a good dancer.
sentence.Chinese: 你舞跳的真好。

sentence.English: You've changed little.
sentence.Chinese: 你一点也没变。

sentence.English: You've got an express mail.
sentence.Chinese: 你有特快专递。

sentence.English: You've got the point.
sentence.Chinese: 你抓住了问题的实质。

sentence.English: Your English is very good.
sentence.Chinese: 你的英语很好。

sentence.English: Your pronunciation is excellent.
sentence.Chinese: 你的发音很好。

sentence.English: Your shoe lace is loose.
sentence.Chinese: 你的鞋带松了。

sentence.English: Your work seems not satisfactory.
sentence.Chinese: 你的工作看起来并不令人满意。

sentence.English: hey'll have a party for their 10th wedding anniversary.
sentence.Chinese: 他们将为结婚十周年开个晚。
